text: They have an awesome brunch menu. Stomach gravitated towards the Johnnycakes, which hit the spot. Nice outdoor seating in the shade. Really friendly staff and management too!

This place is awesome! Great food (I've had almost everything on the menu), great hot and cold brew coffee, and great atmosphere. Also, the staff are really friendly! Definitely my go-to breakfast/brunch place in central Phoenix.

Found this place on Yelp, so I had to add to the hype! Not only is the food one step above the rest the staff are beyond polite and accommodating. I can always tell a good business owner when they make a personal stop to your table. I had the biscuits and gravy and they are TO DIE FOR!!

I've enjoyed breakfast twice so far this year. I'm gluten-free, and both times I ordered grits with the Wilcox Avenue (two egg, sausage and potato plate.) The food is delicious. The first time the grits came smothered in butter. The second visit, I ordered them dry, with a side of maple syrup. I order hot tea and appreciate the bevy of milks and sweeteners. It's best to arrive early to ensure a table. The staff is so attentive and polite.

Vovomeena opened in my neighborhood a few years ago, and I've been maybe 35 or 40 times by this point. The quality of the food rivals, well sorta-almost rivals a Big Breakfast, and while that may not sound like an overt compliment, that is actually high praise! The winner point here is the ability to avoid the turista/gawker contingent that plagues Matt's. You can reasonably expect to get a comfortable seat here except mid-mornings on the weekends, when it does get very crowded. We stopped coming for a while when there were more-than-occasional loud-baby issues at these very crowded times last year; it seems to me that management did nothing to encourage the young parents to perhaps take the unhappy one on a brief outdoor excursion to maybe give a break to the other patrons. This would be less of a problem if the acoustics of the layout were different--Vovomeena can get loud when crowded. Anyway, it's a problem all restaurants face, it just seems Vovomeena didn't quite master the communications with the new-child set. We just started leaving when we'd come in and see babies, and then just stopped coming in altogether when this happened a few times in a row. Things seem to have been sorted on this front in 2015, and so we've returned

This place is great.  Really cool spot with artwork before you walk in.  The dining room is small and we barely found a place to sit after ordering.  The food however didn't disappoint.  I had the eggs over easy and bacon with hash browns and a fresh biscuit. The hash had caramelized onions and were nice and crispy.  I had the banana bread French toast or Pain Perdu.  I thought it was very creative and delicious. Not too sweet.  The iced Vietnamese coffee was bold and nicely balanced. Would definitely come again.

This place is a tremendous addition to the 7th Ave & McDowell corner - we're very excited to have it so close to home!  I had the Savory Crepes. The filling was delicious and the sauce that topped it was fantastic. My boyfriend has the Pepperonata which he raved about. Even though it was a busy Sunday morning, we got served  more quickly than we expected. The coffee was excellent as well - a vitally important part of any Sunday breakfast!  As another reviewer mentioned, I would like to see more non-meat options on the menu. I'm not a vegetarian, but I'm not big on sausage and pork chops either. I could probably be happy with the crepes on every visit - they are that good - but I'd like to have a few more choices.  I'd gladly up a star too if I saw that happen.
Great food, nice location. The staff is nice. Modern atmosphere. The only complaint I have is they tend to burn the "boxty" every time.

I went here based on a yelp review and enjoyed my experience.   First, the decor is very charming and modern. The place has great ambiance and the people that work there seemed genuinely nice.   Second, coffee was amazing! I'm a bit of a coffee snob and chose this place over Matt's Big Breakfast based solely on the rave coffee reviews. Best $2 I ever spent on a cup of joe. It's pour-over quality coffee reminiscent of Blue Bottle Coffee Co. in San Francisco.   Third, the food was pretty good. In our group of three we got the pancakes, potatoes and choice of meat, the savory crepes and the pain perdu.  The pancakes, potatoes and sausage my friend got were average. I tried her potatoes which were my favorite part of her meal.  The crepes were....interesting...but in a good way, like when you first try something and you're not sure you'll like it, so you keep eating, intrigued, and then you decide that this is really good though perhaps more like something you crave every once in a while than something you'd eat regularly....bit of stream of consciousness for you...the pain perdu was too much too sweet....it's a banana bread pudding topped with a sweet and salty, thick caramel sauce and fresh banana slices....you get two brownie-sized squares of it with a side of bacon....I hated that my crunchy bacon was covered in the caramel sauce....I enjoyed this meal because the bread is not sweet, but super sweetened by the caramel sauce...it's just too much for breakfast and would be better if they reduced the portion size of the bread pudding and added some eggs or potatoes....my tummy felt queezy after such a sweet meal...glad my friends shared their meals to portion mine out.   The menu's knid of limited, but I think it keeps the place original. I'd definitely recommend and maybe even return just to sit and sip their delicious coffee.

Had a great experience this afternoon; Japanese cold brew coffee was great and the food delicious...My only comment was the server was too quick in discussing the menu and coffee..felt rushed for their first week introducing themselves. I will be back to tour the menu!

Yelping it up for a breakfast location on vacation and we were led to vovomeena by the reviews.  Wasn't quite sure what to expect but we were pleasantly surprised. We visited on a Saturday morning around 10:30 a.m. And it was not too busy to be served quickly. You order at a counter and then select an open table and your food is brought to you. It's a small menu but with some great choices.  I tried the Mexican Benedict and really liked it. There is a corn tamale like base instead of an English muffin.  My husband got the blackstone scrambler and enjoyed that. He selected a multi grain toast that was amazing.  He also asked about recommended coffee and we tried the flight of cold brewed regular and flavored coffees which was unique and enjoyable.  I love the decor and the baristas were very helpful.   On a side note I really enjoyed my silverware. It was heavy duty and nice to hold.  :) Loved this place and wish we had one near home.

My family and I tried Vovomeena for the first time today and we were impressed. My husband had the Mexican Benedict and I had the Johnnycakes. Both dishes were delicious! We shared the coffee flight and each one was unique and tasty. Great price too! We are definitely coming back to try the other dishes. Highly recommended.

Had brunch there today with my husband and daughter.  Would they come back?  Most definitely not.  Would I come back?  Maybe, in a year or two assuming they stay in business.    Would I encourage people to try this place?  Yes, but on a leisurely day, and not when you want to impress or be impressed.     The space is pleasant: ample outside seating, high ceilings, narrow hall running east west with plenty of light coming in from both ends.  They have a limited but ample menu with items that conceptually sound delicious.  (You know, like Tuck and Astor House.)  After more than 40 minutes of waiting, we had: 1.  boxty (grated apple & potato pancakes, honey mascarpone, choice of meat).  The grated apple is not cooked into the pancakes but put on top.  Honey mascarpone was sickeningly sweet, and pancakes were peppery -- weird combination.  I picked sausage as my meat choice but it wasn't served with my boxty.  I asked the server "Was I supposed to get sausage with my boxty?"  She responded, "I don't know, were you?"   I showed her the menu and the sausages were brought out shortly; but response was borderline rude and at best it showed she didn't know the menu which had 12 items on it.    2.  johnnycakes (corn and chiles, stack of three, sweet rice & fruit, choice of meat).  This might have been the best item from the three that we ordered.  The pancakes were beautifully browned; like fluffy cornbread.  But something was missing to tie the flavors of the pancakes, sausage, sweet rice & fruit together.  Maybe syrup?  Maybe a butter chile sauce?  But the sweet rice needs to go.  3.  piperrada (fry up of pork shoulder, green & red peppers, tomato, onion, two eggs on top).  The number one ingredient in the entree description was barely there.  Hubby did the rude thing of picking his food apart right after it came, maybe because he was not happy that his first two picks (grillades and mexican benedict) were not available.  Table manners aside, when he removed the two eggs from the top of the pile, the underneath was mostly red and green peppers and onions.  If you pieced together the pork shoulder pieces like a jigsaw puzzle, it might have ended up being the size of a small bacon strip.  Tomatoes were also missing.  Two separate people asked if everything was going ok and my hubby told both of them that he was not happy about the pork shoulder.  But nothing was offered, no substitution, no refund, nada.    I don't remember the last time my husband complained in a restaurant.   That is usually my gig, and even I don't often do it.  Today I had a feeling any complaints would fall on deaf ears. We had to wait quite a while for a food and during that time  I saw several customers going to the counter making non-positive gesticulations and being met with a response that I could lip read as "So sorry."  I also saw four very frustrated cooks who spent quite a bit of time looking at the ticket items while very little food was coming out of the kitchen.    We felt bad for everyone:  the cooks, the owners, the patrons, and us.  Such a downer for a brunch.   From our table, I ate the most food in hopes of eventually understanding the concept from each dish.  (If it matters, I wear size 0 pants and am not prone to just eating anything and everything.)   In the end, while my daughter looked at me in disdain, I told her I just needed the calories to make up for the effort in getting there, for the wait, and for the money spent.  Supporting local businesses is a must, but it shouldn't be painful. I think Vovomeena could be good someday if it works out its kinks.  But I'll wait a long while before I risk another downer of a brunch again.

Absolutely delicious breakfast, and some unique choices on the menu as well. Not just your typical eggs and toast kind of place.   I went with 2 friends- I got the Johnny Cakes which were phenomenal, and a huge portion too. It came with 2 sausage links and fresh strawberries on top, a side of the most incredible homemade rice pudding I've ever tasted, with syrup on the side. Soooo good! My friends got the Pain Perdu and the French toast. I love how they do the cold drip coffee as well and U can see the drip system up on the wall.   The line moved quick (you order at the register and then they give you a number and you wait at a table). Also they do not permit you to hold a table while your party goes up and orders and that's something they enforce. You choose your table only after ordering. They bring the food out to you. Service was great as well. Will definitely be back!!!!
Wicked fast service.  Cold brewed coffee is a nice change.  Good variety of menu choices.

Heard about this place on Check Please.  The program is always positive, so you have to be aware that their recommendation might be oversold.  Although, it is not very classy and upscale place, the menu and coffee is really good.  Arrived later in the morning for good seating.  It is very popular.  I wonder why?   Their BMOC is a special dish; they were out when we ordered. But it gets rave reviews. Not to worry, there are many good choices on the menu.  Very frustrating when you want to order almost everything on the menu.  Their Japanese cold-brewed coffee is also a special attraction.  Nothing quite like it.  You order and find a seat.  They bring food to your table.  Parking is a little tight in that area.

The menu is honest and clear: no substitutions. That being said, I couldn't help it. My heart wanted the one omelette option on the menu to be a chorizo omelette instead of a potato omelette. When I asked for the change, the portly hipster behind the counter gave me that look. The one that says, "dude, we're so popular right now we don't have to give you anything."  He told me they aren't able to change a thing. I ordered the waffle, bacon, and potoatoes, with a side of scrambled eggs. The waffle wasn't my favorite kind (I prefer one that's crunchy on the outside and soft and delicious on the inside). This waffle was just soft, like a pancake. The eggs were typical. Not fluffy air goodness, like I always hope eggs will be. Bacon was limp and fatty.  Sometimes I feel like a breakfast spot like this gets its high ratings mostly because it tries very hard to be unique and trendy, less than because the food is actually delicious. But I'll be honest: I've never craved a pork chop in my breakfast, and this place isn't changing my mind on that front.   If you're wanting pancakes and the like (basically dessert) then you're going to love their options here. But c'mon, you could go to a million hip places in the valley that offer a carb-rich, sugar filled pancake and be thrilled. The real posers of breakfast are revealed in how they do the non-carb options. Sorry Vovomeena. For me, you're nothing more than a hipster poser. Great coffee though.
Fantastic brunch.  It was busy but got a table in 5 min.  My waffle with pork chop was amazing, and my sons biscuit and gravy was the best he has ever tasted.

What can I say about this place..AWESOME! The food is so freaking good there is nothing i haven't tried that I didn't like, it can get pretty packed but it is definitely worth the wait, reasonably priced. I guarantee you won't be disappointed.

We're from Buffalo, NY, so we are here based solely on reviews. Vovomeena did not disappoint! Our food was extraordinary. I had the johnnycakes with spuds. Oh. My. God. Make sure to ask for the Chilula, the green hot sauce with the wooden top.

Cold coffee, cold donut, flies EVERYWHERE, biscuit was hard as a rock, plate was so loaded with gravy it engulfed the egg on top, items listed on the menu that staff had to apologize are not "yet" available, patio seating so 1 person is directly in the sun, and one's in the shade, I won't be back, very poor experience.
This place was suggested, and I'm glad it was. The food was amazing and so was the atmosphere. The menu is short and simple. Tried the Mexican benedict. It was love at first bite.

The banana bread French toast was amazing. The chorizo in the Mexican eggs Benedict overpowers the dish but it wasn't bad - just not the best Benedict I've eaten. Just avoid the coffee flight - overpriced, bitter and undrinkable.

I am always out for a good breakfast place so I was happy to have a new one near our home in downtown Phoenix. Unfortunately my husband and I were pretty disappointed with our food. The Coffee was awesome but the food was way too greasy and way too salty, I felt sick the rest of the day. This all coming from someone who typically likes salty food. I realize breky can be a greasy treat but this was too much fat and salt for my taste.  We tried it again to give it a second chance and went with a friend who happened to be a Vegan. There was nothing on the menu she could eat. It's 2013 ya gotta be a little accommodating to other peoples food restrictions in a restaurant. So, two strikes and you're out in my book.

I went there for the first time and I have to admit it was pretty good. I had the Pain Perdue and it was delicious. It could have used a lil more sauce, but it was good! This place is kind of hidden and can easily be overlooked. Its definitely a must try place!!

I LOVE this place! I just wish I lived closer so I could go more often.  I went on a weekday after picking up a friend from the airport.  I had the best biscuits and gravy I've ever had and my friend had amazing pancakes that are so delicious, you could eat them plain without any syrup or fruit!  My only issue was that the self-serve coffee wasn't hot anymore.  However that was back in November and we were there around 11 am.  They also have neat Japanese cold-press (or drip?)coffee setup that my barista friend was excited about.

Truly excellent breakfast. Unique and traditional dishes all cooked to perfection. The Tortilla Espa√±ola is divine and the BMOC is as hearty as you can get. Superb coffee bar as well. Inexpensive for the portions. Will be frequenting this establishment for breakfast going forward. So glad we gave it a try today. I had to go straight home and lay down afterwards, so filling, so satisfied. Totally earned the 5 star rating.

Delicious breakfast, NOT low-calorie!  It's in an odd strip mall, missed it our first time around.  Biscuits are delicious.  Self-serve coffee, casual yet efficient service.  We had a late breakfast, but I imagine it's busy early in the morning.

Vovomeena is our 'go to' spot when family is in town visiting (we brunch here as a family of 4 every month or so, but make the extra effort to bring visiting relatives here to show off the culinary delights Phoenix has to offer.)  A few key elements set Vovomeena as the bar for us: 1. quaint menu, quality ingredients, presentation {we've tried 75% of the breakfast menu- all excellent, but we keep coming back to the Pain Perdu & Mexican Eggs Benedict}; 2. friendly & familiar faces : the staff at Vovomeena stick around. It's nice to recognize faces behind the counter & in the kitchen. It doesn't have to be an "everybody knows your name" kind of place to feel just welcoming enough; 3. location & atmosphere. It's nestled in a perfect location just off I-10; to add, the outdoor seating is lovely & indoor decor & 'space' gives a great vibe even for family dining (we usually need 2 highchairs at our table).  Thank you, Vovomeena, for a consistent, thoughtful & enjoyable dining experience in the Valley!

I hate to do this, because I don't want this place to be busy for selfish reasons, however I have an obligation to uphold. It is of no surprise that Vovomeena is anything but fantastic, coming from the flavor dense minds from Tuck Shop and Astor House.  This morning I got their signature Japanese iced coffee and the Espanola which was kind of an egg, potato, spinach and cheese pie with a chunky red sauce that is bursting with flavors.  The decor is sustainable and hip, chairs were comfortable, lighting is good, staff is friendly and personable as well... Can you tell I like the place?

Well if your looking to bring a group or family DON'T! You order from a small menu first pay and sit wherever.  It is clean quaint has a contemporary look. This place is nice for a college student or two people in a hurry. The food was okay but nothing off the charts! The coffee is put in thermal pumps you get yourself I was not too jazzed up about that  being that I seen a review for top 10 Phoenix breakfast spots. The cashier guy was a little snooty when I asked a question stated its right there pick two of those choices. The manager did come buy ask if it was okay, but who wants to complain when your trying to visit with old friends. The staff was nice who delivered our order. I ordered the chorizo benidict which looked good but they left all the grease on my plate! Will not be back!
The best coffee I've ever had!! I also had the French toast w honey, marscapone cheese and grated apple. So delicious and the atmosphere is trendy and everyone working there was so friendly

I have been here about 4 times.   Originally I was excited about their eclectic menu and decor, but now things are just not adding up for me.    My eggs were over cooked, dry and bland, while the potatoes are thick, not cooked enough and starchy (others may enjoy this).   I also am weary of standing in line to order, then another line for drinks, then another line for a table.  I sat outside and while I was being attacked by flies and not enjoying their iced tea which to me is do bitter it tastes like coffee got blended into it, I realized that the tables are so narrow that I couldn't read a magazine while eating my food.    I wondered was I just being a cranky pants that needed more caffiene or was the original hope and promise that I was enticed by just not working for me at vovomeena.   I think you can tell what I landed upon.  Sorry vovomeena.

Thank you vovo! Everything I've tried is delicious. The manager here is wonderful and really wants to make sure every customer is 100% happy with their food and experience. The kind of customer service I experienced here today makes me want to come here more often. And I will! Thank you!

This is a great place for breakfast. The staff and manager were very accommodating for our party of 10. The food is excellent and was enjoyed by all. They worked with me on my order since I have to eat gluten free.  The coffee is the best!!! We will be back!!!

Place was OK. For having to seat yourself and get your own beverages , the taste of the food and the price was not worth it. The place is deafeningly loud and small. It is not large enough to seat very many. This place doesn't make me want to come back.
The Blackstone Scramble is amazing - the pork is incredibly flavorful and the portions abundant. Perfect spot to meet friends and relax on a Saturday morning.
Every single dish is perfect.  Our only problem is deciding which ones to get this time.  Enough said.

The coffee flight, and the tortilla espanola are a must try. Three different kinds of herb/spiced infused (tea-like) iced coffees, all delicious. The tortilla espanola looks like it would be a greasy, heavy meal but it was actually very light and refreshing! I like the casual setting and ordering at the register. It helps a lot that there a lot of nice, charming, and cute boys working there. Definitely Glad to have this place in the neighborhood.

Really like their spin on breakfast.  Dishes are a little more adventurous then your typical breakfast fare, which is why I like them.  Food is cooked well.  I love the Johhnny Cakes for breakfast and the warm rice pudding it comes with.

I was excited when this breakfast restaurant opened up in my neighborhood as I love to go out for breakfast almost everyday.  I have eaten there 3 times now but I only order 1 thing on the menu which I do enjoy quite a bit because their other items are a little unusual for me.  I went to eat there again yesterday and I was very sorry to see they have removed all side items off their menu. So I cannot order an omelet or 2 scrambles eggs with bacon, or a side of toast. Its one of the nine items or nothing. That does not work for me so that is why i have given this restaurant 3 stars. I hope they reconsider offering the basic breakfast items or I will probably not be back.

Food was excellent, service was so personable and cashier woman so nice and they were just so great on top of everything, bmoc was great and so was the banana french toast. Coffee was strong and they don't deny that at all but well worth it with the food, no question I will be returning.

If I could give 12 stars on the Moonshine Cold Brew alone....I would, and hard.    This gold establishment takes cold brew coffee to a whole new realm of  "MORE Sir, YUSS'PLEASE!"  Mouthwatering and mind-bending combinations like chocolate-basil and lavender-mint fresh flavors IN MY CRISP COLD BREW???     Clearly, the fella behind these masterful concoctions deserves a nobel peace prize and about 64 high-fives for his exquisitely crafted cardiovascular-zapping efforts.       Me:      *Sip*   *makes O-face* The Scientist:     Creme? Me:     No thank you, she's perfect.  *Golf clap*  The food....maybe later, I'm so gushin'on the Moonshine my food is going to get cold :)

Awesome coffee. Amazing food (mexican benedict). Good music.   Though for a first-timer, like I was, the ordering process is a little different. It is a counter-order resturant but there are no "order here" signs which makes you feel kind of lost when you first walk in. But the staff is extremely helpful and always willing to point you in the right direction without making you feel like a dumbass.   I will definitely recommend to others and come back for more coffee!

Best breakfast spot in Phx / Scottsdale. Normally, there's only 1-2 two things on a menu that grab your eye. However, here there's always 5-6 things my wife and I have to decide over. Probably prefer the Mexican benedict the most. Actually, the only thing that disappoints is the Portugese donut that Howard raved about. Almost don't want to post this as concerned it will just be more popular. Nice kids menu options as well.
Love this independent nestled into the corner of chain eateries. Not to be missed!  Thrilled to live in the 'hood so I can walk here.

They have local coffe that is awesome! The Service is really fast and the food is yummy. Im not really a breakfast person but the food was fresh good. I think my favorite this is the coffee and the homeaid jam for the toast. Awesome cute place.
This place was recommended by friends, so glad I decided to try it out. Good food, great atmosphere, I highly recommend it, stop in for delicious food!!

Had breakfast here the other Sunday morning and the food was amazing. Great flavors and a fantastic variety for carnivores. If you are in the mood for some comfort food and have a few calories to spare this place is great. We also had a little breakfast/dessert the banana bread french toast was really good. It was a little small and the coffee bar set up is kinda weird even still amongst all the good places to have breakfast these guys still stand out.
Great bfast, a little bit pricey. Its hard to find a seat over the weekends but the food is really good.

Wilcox Avenue and fresh OJ were delicious! The only thing I don't like is the order first and then wait to be seated ordeal. The place is great, rustic modern and small at the end i will still be returning.
Excellent service. Here from OC to see Ohio State- New Year's Day. There are open today! Great cold brew coffee. Fantastic breakfast and they have kids meal too. Thank you- I love my coffees.

I'm so excited about the latest restaurant opening from the folks that created Tuck Shop. Vovomeena is a perfect addition to the 7th Avenue and McDowell corner, which is mostly occupied by chain restaurants. They serve up incredible Japanese cold brew coffee, which makes me wonder if I can ever go back to a plain ol' Starbucks drip. The coffee has great, bold flavor and not bitterness. They have a few varieties and even offer a coffee flight.  The star of the menu is the B.M.O.C. It's a Man Vs. Food-kind of dish -- Schreiner'ssmoked pork chop, waffle two eggs and a Portuguese donut tower with apple-maple syrup. And yes it can be finished in one sitting. The 3 Sister Strata -- a egg and cheese casserole, with zucchini, black beans and corn, is delicious, hearty, yet light. It comes with a side of meat, bacon or sausage, both of which come from Schreiner's Fine Sausages on 7th Street. I love that they source local ingredients, from meat to coffee.   I'm eyeing the Pain Perdu --banana bread pudding french toast --for my next visit or maybe the johnnycakes, made with corn and chili. You really can't go wrong with this menu.

The food was "fine" but not worth the price or the service. A couple of smiling faces amongst staff, but we could have done without the snootiness. Breakfast is a competitive game, your money is better spent elsewhere.
Price - reasonable range Service - prompt and friendly  Atmosphere - parking kind of hard but has a nice outdoor area . Overall neat and hip Food - flavorful :) pretty decent overall.

My hubby and I have a standing ritual of having Sunday brunch together.  This week we decided to go to the independent standout, on what I call "chain restaurant row" on 7th Ave and McDowell.   And for those who live in South Phoenix/Laveen area, like we do, the trip took us an easy 15 minute drive in Sunday traffic to downtown.  If you are going for Sunday breakfast, being an early riser has it's advantages.  I recommend going between the hours of 8:30 and 10:30 am.  We arrived at 10:15am and witnessed  the place fill up quickly at 10:30am.  We entered the restaurant from the 7th Ave parking lot.  Vovomeena's has an entrance via the patio.   When you enter from the patio, it's a bit confusing orientation.  To the right you will see the kitchen and that's where you start by grabbing a menu off the wall, stand in line, and place/pay your order at the cashier.  They will give you a number and the server brings the food to the table when ready.   I recommend looking over the menu online prior to your visit, because frankly, I imagine this process to be backed up when the place is crowded by the newbies trying to decide what they want to eat -- there isn't much space to move, so the pressure is on.  I noted there were quite a few family with kids.  While my husband and I have a son, we were on a "date brunch" so we chose to sit AWAY from the families :)    I do imagine the patio - during nice whether - to be a perfect spot to have a family breakfast so don't be afraid to bring them along.  But let's get to the food!   Vovomeena's serves up such creative concoctions http://www.vovomeena.com/menu.html  I enjoyed the "Johnnycakes", described  on the menu as two chile corn hotcakes, prickly pear maple syrup, served with a side of  sweet rice, and choice of meat.   Layman translation:  sweet corn tamale (with chile) pancakes, rice pudding, and either bacon or schreiner sausage.   I loved my meal - but was not a fan of the prickly pear maple syrup (so much that my husband was reminded of a scene from the Tom Hanks movie "Big" when he chews and spits out his food.)  On our next visit, I look forward to trying the "Mexican Benedict" , poached eggs, hollandaise sauce, served on sopes.   This is the kind of interesting culinary twists you can expect to see on the menu.  There is plenty on the menu to keep me entertained and no negative experience to be critical of.     Check it out!

The food was great, the coffee rich and delicious, and even though our party was larger (10 people) and the inside seating is pretty tight, the staff was very accomdating and helpful arranging seats for our whole party.  I'll be back!

I came here because of the high reviews and was thoroughly disappointed. I ordered biscuit and gravy and I was very surprised how salty it was-- I tolerate a lot of salt, and it was way beyond acceptable.  I also shared BMT? Which the ham was again unbelievably charred and salty. I looked for potatoes to go down with the rest of the salt and refilled water 4 times.  Waffles were okay, no better than most places I have been to.
This was a really chill spot with friendly staff and yummy eats making it a nice place to stop in & out.

Best breakfast I've had in a long time! We went on a Sunday morning around 11 am. You stand in line, order, then are seated by staff. The line went fast and food came pretty quick too, considering our mouths were watering just from seeing what others seated around us had ordered. I ordered the Wilcox Avenue which came with 2 eggs cooked to order (I got over medium and they were perfect), breakfast potatoes (well seasoned chunks and perfectly cooked with nice crispy bits), choice of toast or biscuit (GET THE BISCUIT!!!! SERIOUSLY!!! ), and choice of breakfast meat (I got bacon and it was thick cut and nicely cooked, not too crispy and not too flimsy). The biscuit was buttery, flakey, just melts in your mouth. Also comes with side of FRESH strawberry jam. I added a side of the homemade gravy to dip my biscuit in, which has nice chunks of shreiners sausage. Well seasoned. Creamy. So good. To say it was delicious is a huge understatement. My husband got the Blackstone scramble which came with sliced pork shoulder (think nicely smoked really good thick ham pieces), 2 eggs scrambled with onion, garlic, tomato and peppers. This was served with a delicious homemade mouth watering tortilla to wrap it all up in, breakfast burrito style if you desire. My 12 year old daughter got the 12 and under kids choice called the Primrose Hill with choice 3 items: pancake or waffle (she got the waffle which tasted so slightly sweet yummy vanilla malted butter-so so good), eggs, and bacon or sausage. She couldn't even finish half of the waffle it was so thick! We opted for waters which was self service by the coffee area which was also interesting. I would definitely return just for the biscuit and gravy. It was all so filling. I didn't get any pictures because we ate it so fast!

I love the indie restaurants that fill up old buildings and provide a delicious meal in a warm, inviting space.  Brunch at Vovomeena was also enough to fill me up for the whole day.    Two of us had a BMOC and a pain perdu.  It was a nice combo, hearty, savory, sweet.  The BMOC's tender waffle is a counterpoint to all of the other goodness that smothers it while the smoked pork chop is in small pieces to make the eating easier.  Pain perdu is a luscious excuse to eat bread pudding for a meal!  Ask for the syrups and sauces on the side so that you can customize your sugar rush.  The ginger morning moonshine was good, but I'll probably pass on the next trip and there will be another visit in the plans soon.
Nice atmosphere. Great coffee. Interesting options for food. Had the Mexican Benedict. Very good, but could have used more hollandaise. Slightly on the hipster side.

A couple of my friends wanted to take me out to breakfast today.  I wanted to try this place.  They're locally owned, and the menu looked good.  I got a combo of pancakes, bacon and potatoes.  It has a place name, which I don't remember.  Everything was so dry.  I HATE it when a restaurant parcels out the syrup in little containers.  Just put a pitcher of syrup on my table, please.  Extra syrup could not render the pancakes finish-able.  The potatoes were also likewise very dry.  I only finished the bacon.  I didn't order, since I was the birthday guest, but it looks like you order your food and coffee at separate counters.  Is that the case?  And if so, is that necessary?  Do I really want to stand in 2 lines for my breakfast?  No.  I don't even want to stand in one line.  Unless that line is at Matt's.  Around 11:00, the music got so loud I had trouble hearing my friends talking.  And there were a LOT of kids there, if you're into that thing.  Also, I have had TERRIBLE reflux all day.  And that's all I've eaten today.  Just saying.

The tortilla espanola is the most delicious dish I have had! The arugula salad pairs perfectly with this Spanish quiche- like creation. The Johnny cakes and the sweet rice are phenomenal. The manager was very accommodating on busy Sunday morning, while the line is out the door! Everything here is on another level; the aesthetics, the Japanese cold-brew, and the open kitchen. I am proud have this local spot in our community.

Excellent food at this out of the way place. Portions  very large and fresh. I want to try everything on the menu. Plan to go back every weekend until I've tried all menu items. Coffee was also delicious and friendly servers

I had a chance to sit down with the owner of this spot today.  I'm hoping that he'll be able to make some very minor modifications on the menu to account for the vegan population of downtown Phoenix.  Otherwise, I do believe that the owner cares about his businesses and the community.  Fingers crossed.   -- ORIGINAL Review:  Since the corner of McDowell and 7th Ave. is what I refer to as the place where chain restaurants go to die, it makes me happy that there's a local breakfast joint attempting to infiltrate the system.  The first time I ate here was a couple of weeks ago, early on a Sunday and it was delicious.  You walk up to the counter to order, get a number and then sit where you like.  It's small, but there's a nice outdoor patio which should be nice for the next couple of weeks.  Their coffee is amazing and they provide dairy alternatives for those of us who do not use cream in our coffee.    The first time I ordered the BMOC:  a waffle with apple/maple syrup, a smoked porkchop and eggs. (and a portuguese donut!)  Wowza.  Breakfast heaven. The second time I attempted to order the 3 Sisters Strata, but they hadn't received some order or something and it wasn't available, so I settled on the savory crepes.  Also delicious.  Their romesco sauce is delish.  HOWEVER - I can only give three stars.  My vegan friends are simply not able to eat here because whomever wrote the menu just doesn't provide easy alternatives and the second time I ate here my friend's pancakes showed up in 5 minutes while my fiance and I continued to wait an additional 30!  The manager was great about it and very professional, but his excuse about how pancakes are made faster than the rest is ridiculous - when there are orders that take longer, you simply make the longest item first and work your way up.    I'll probably be back, but I'm seriously hoping for some vegan alternatives on the menu and better time management.
Welcoming atmosphere.  The food and coffee are spot on. Employees were on point and attentive.    I'll be back when I'm in Phoenix!

Strange set up but delicious food and great wait staff. Worth your time and money. When you walk in the door, you wait in line against a narrow walk way to be seated. The line goes quick but it's awkward.

GLUTEN-FREE FRIENDLY! Oh, and delicious.   It was my first visit and the guy at the register (possibly the owner? manager?) pointed out at least 4 dishes that were either totally gluten free or could be adjusted. I went with the Mexican Benedict and I was pleasantly surprised with how crunchy the sopes turned out to be. The chorizo was delicious and the poached eggs were perfect. The potatoes could have had some crunch and/or seasoning, but... obviously not a deal breaker since I still cleaned my plate.   The possible owner/manager also walked by and asked each table about their meal. I know a lot of places do that, but it seemed really genuine here.  I know they have fancy coffee here, but I just got a regular ol' cup. Loved that they had raw sugar cubes. I'll be back for sure!

Oh My Gosh this place was delicious! I was only in town for the weekend and a friend recommended this restaurant. I had the johnnycakes and I loved every bite! I drink coffee on occasion, but I had to have two cups that morning because the coffee was that yummy! All of the staff I spoke with were really nice and I can't wait to go back again!

Perfect local spot!  I've been hoping for something locally owned that strays away from the same chain offerings to be found elsewhere and was not disappointed.  (5)The service was exceptionally friendly from the greeting to the ordering.  Even the bussing of the table was done with a smile.  The owner/manager checked with us several times to make sure everything was ok.  We went early enough that there was no wait and the food was served within 10 min.  (4)We ordered the boxty and the piperrada with iced Japanese Brew.  I agree with Michael U that the boxty was a tiny bit greasy, but the sweet savory flavor with the added texture of apple crunch was a great mouthful.  The crunchy thick bacon on the side was perfect! The piperrada had good flavor.   I was hoping the pork shoulder would be slow cooked and shredded, but it seemed more like a chopped cured ham type flavor/consistency.   Thanks Vovomeena for a great early breakfast.  Will be coming back until we try every menu item, especially can't wait to taste the portuguese donuts someone else raved about!

This place does NOT disappoint! I saw this place on Check Please so of course had to try! We walked in on a Friday morning at 9am me and my 2 trusty co-worker/friends. We greeted by the very friendly very helpful manager. I wanted coffee ASAP! So I got the iced cup of Japanese cold brew. Which I enjoyed very much! You order at the counter and staff brings your food to the table, finding a table at that time was not too bad as everyone was eating and leaving pretty timely.   For breakfast I had the Wilcox Avenue which was 2 eggs, the best potatoes ever, biscuit and sausage! And yes I added the Portuguese donut!! Everything was amazing! My friend had the pancakes bacon and spuds which was delish as well! My other friend ordered the same as I but with a side of gravy for her biscuit which I normally do not like but she had me taste it and it was the best gravy! The whole place reminded us of our grandma's kitchen! This is REAL comfort good food cooked right to order! It is a nice clean classy diner feel to it! I told the manager we would be back soon, as we were.. the very next Friday! We are calling Vovomeena our little secret and getaway from work!
The food here is phenomenal!!! Service is GREAT, very prompt and friendly. Definitely coming back here!!

Great breakfast! I read the great reviews and I'm definitely glad I came here! I had the pancakes, potatoes and bacon. The meal was wonderful. The pancakes look thin, but they were so filling that I could only eat one! The meal is the type you think you could make at home, but it's waaaay better than anything I could make. It's simple with a twist. I'll be back and this time I'm going for the tortilla espanola!

Started watching this place when they opened as I am a fan of Tuck Shop.  Went here for the first time in January after I had seen them post their special on FB of their sausage gravy and biscuits.  Served with fried eggs on top, this single dish made me a loyal fan.  It is amazing as is the Japanese cold brew.  Husband ordered the BMOC which was good and kids had the pancakes - SO light and fluffy!!  The barristas at the coffee station were very nice and explained the process of the cold brew.  They took time to give me samples - great service for sure.

Full disclosure: I'm not a pretentious foodie.  But, I do enjoy a wonderful meal and we found one today at Vovomeena.  The pain perdu (banana bread pudding french toast with whiskey caramel sauce) will be a contender for my last meal.  The service, simple atmosphere and price point were equally delicious.  Vovomeena management, get yourself to Chicago!

This restaurant came highly recommended to us and we were hugely disappointed. Be forewarned there are no substitutions in the menu. Service was not good. Very overpriced for the food so they need to offer more; maybe biscuits with the meal. You have to buy them individually. Now to our food, I ordered my eggs over medium and the yolks had been broken and overcooked to the point of being burnt - they should not have been served.  I ordered bangers and they were not bangers just some kind of sausage. Biscuits were hard and overcooked. Because of our bad service we were offered a free meal but we will not be back. The food is just not that good.

Wow! I had a great breakfast! The BMOC. Who would've thought that a pork chop would pair so well with a waffle? It was tied together perfectly with apple compote and maple syrup. Topped with two eggs sunny side up, it was the perfect combination of savory and sweet. I was pleasantly surprised that the pork chop was smoked,  which really made it pop! On the side was a warm Portuguese donut, which is like a fritter, only less dense and sprinkled with powdered sugar. Although very oily, it was sweet and delicious. The coffee was excellent, roasted locally in Cave Creek.   The atmosphere of the restaurant was modern and traditional fused together. It's small, but well lit, and family friendly. I was intrigued by the walk up format and the tiny front kitchen. It is a wonder that they work so efficiently and quickly there. The service was fast and friendly. The prices were good, nothing more than $12, and the majority of the small menu breakfast entrees were $8-9. A great value.  I do believe I've found my new favorite breakfast diner!

An awesome time with my wife, she loved the potato and orchard French-toast. My eggs Benedict was well seasoned, a little intense for me. I did not have the eggs runny, that might have taken away from overall intended taste. We sampled six flavors of coffee, all good. Reasonable prices and friendly hosts.

THE BEST BREAKFAST PLACE IN THE VALLEY, hands down!    I've tried almost everything on their menu.  There's nothing I didn't like.  The only negative thing I can say is that seating (self-seating in this place) can be a little difficult and annoying during busy times, not fun when you have kid/s in tow.  Even more annoying is seeing people lingering over their completed meals and empty cups of coffee, chatting away like they have nothing else to do all day, while there are people waiting for a table to open up.  Not Vovomeena's fault, but the seating issue has factored into my decisions when I find myself wanting to eat here late morning on a weekend.   Anyway, the food is great, the staff is great (I LOVE YOU KAI !!!)  Eat here.  Eat here often.  You won't be sorry!

Came here a while ago when my friend worked here!! The restaurant is so adorable and the patio is beautiful. I went back in November when it was really nice weather out so the patio was packed already.   The food was so delicious. You just walk up to the counter and order, and then they bring your food to you. I got the johnnycake and they were amazing! It was a huge plate of food...so it's a good deal for the price. The pancakes were huge, and you get a couple of sides. I remember having this rice pudding with golden raisins that was really good.

This was the best breakfast place I have encountered by far. The food was out of my world. It had the best authentic flavors, quality ingredients, and spectacular ingredients to enhance the savory food together as a whole.
Eclectic and trendy ambiance with delicious choices. It's the place to introduce a friend to and enjoy a brunch that offers more than the "same old" options.

The outside patio is relaxingly gorgeous in the mornings (though maybe it won't be so much during June, July and August).   The interior was very modern and cozy. The had a display of vacuum coffee makers, which I thought was really cool-- I'm pretty sure the employee I talked to about them made them. The coffee bar is off to the side and is nicely setup.  Had the eggs benedict-- it was southwestern style. Ridiculously good. Boyfriend and I are eggs benedict fiends.  I remember all these other goodies on their menu I wanted to try-- will return for a second round!

Want to talk about the heart of a restaurant grand view of that here, as you wait in line for your fantastic meal you get a up close and personal with the line here watching them work hand anD hand together is amazing

The cold press Japanese iced coffee was delightful and the biscuits and gravy was tasty and not too salty which I often find with this dish.  The sausage may have been turkey but I'm not sure.  The Mexican Benedict is good the first few bites but the fat/greasy in the chorizo over powers the dish and soaks the sopes.   Perhaps less chorizo could improve this dish but The flavor was acceptable and the potatoes were a nice pair.  The breakfast potatoes were Cooked well and seasoned perfectly.   I enjoyed the decor, coffee bar and the service was well above average.     I will visit again for lunch next time.

I must say this, I love the food here. Absolutely delicious food and have never been disappointed w the food quality. However, I am rating this place 3 stars because of one particularly rude staff member. Nothing ruins a good meal/experience more so than rude food servers.
I had the savory crepes, which were outstanding! The hubby had the banging pocket, which looked impressive but the pita bread was too soggy for him. I, on the other hand, actually liked them!

The best place in Phoenix for breakfast. It's this tiny little spot with kitschy decor, fresh flowers on every table and great food at reasonable prices. Best staff, too. There aren't enough good things to say about this place. Self serve coffee bar  and everything prepared fresh every day. I love it.
This place is awesome it serves good food, memories of home with awesome decor loved every bite. Will be on a mission to try every plate :-)

First time here! Amazing food and coffee. This coffee was legit! I've come back several times now... won't mention how many visits.  Food is worth the wait. You will not be disappointed. It does get really busy so go in early.

I am big on breakfast, I mean it's super important. I like to think of Vovomeena as inspiration for me to open a breakfast restaurant in the future. I LOVE this place! I've tried almost everything, everything is so so good. Of all the times I've visited, never been disappointed. Ice coffee is bomb! Tortilla espanola, bmoc, waffle, pain perdue, everything is great! The staff is also very friendly. When I took my dog to the patio, they came out with a bowl of water and offered that I buy her a cold protein snack! Always looking forward to my next visit!

This is one of my favorite places in town. The kitchen is clean, the staff is friendly, the food and coffee taste fresh and delicious. What more do you need? I have been here with quite a few other people, and they all have seemed to enjoy it as much as I do.

The awesome thing about this restaurant is the front of house staff. They are always friendly, attentive, and just fun to talk to. They make you feel at home.  The food is wonderful, and the decor is just as wonderful. The parking, however, is impossible after 10am. Go early.  The kitchen area is a little disorganized and disheveled, but the kitchen staff manages to crank out quality and good tasting dishes at a good pace.    I'll definitely be back. The food and service is superior. I'll just avert my eyes next time I'm standing towards the kitchen. OK I'm lying: I always look and cannot stop.
great neighborhood spot! Friendly, accommodating staff and food is consistently good.

The slightly overpriced Mexican Benedict definitely fulfilled every tastebud craving. The portion was just right, and I ate it all without feeling overwhelmed afterwards. The service was good and the ambient was great!! Good music. Perfect decor. Quite satisfying.

Everything here was delicious. At first walking in, it was a bit confusing until we realized that it was a walk up counter ordering system but the food and the coffee was amazing. The staff was incredibly friendly as well. Can't wait to go back

The bmoc was okay. The only good about this place is the smoked pork. Waffles were soaked in syrup so very sweet. The donut is the most failed part of this. Doesn't taste fresh. However the smoked pork was tender and juicy.

I really appreciate places like these, where they put a lot of thought and creativity in their foods. I wish I could give it a higher star rating, but I have to be honest. I tried it on two different occasions because I always want to give a place a review after at least visiting it twice. The food is well done and thought out, but maybe the execution is bad or they are trying to doing too much.   The first time actually was a while ago, since I am not usually at this area of town at all. I tried the BMOC which is their signature dish or most popular. While I admit it is very impressive looking, it is very difficult to eat. The pork chop is just so dominating and so salty, that it takes several tries until you can find a right balance. I understand what they are going for, since a lot of other places are always trying to balance this sweet-salty flavors. It is almost impossible to balance and sometimes it comes out bland, because the flavors don't compliment but cancels each other out. I do like complex flavors but I like consistent well define flavors where every bite is the same. It was kind of a let down  The second time, I tried the grillades, which is their take on biscuit and gravy. The beef was nice and tender small pieces, but the sauce was too spicy(heat wise). All I could taste was the heat, it again just dominated everything. I also think that everything is in the details in the dish, the biscuit was dry and chewy and had a weird artificial flavor to it. I had a side of potatoes which were done well , but was cold, I could not believe that they would do that at a place like this. This is a self serve type of place, so as far as service is concerned it is what you expect.   Lastly I really would have given this place a 2 star for its food, but I raised it to 3 star because they were trying to be different and the quality and thoughtfulness of the food is good, just  the execution does not work here.

No breakfast comes close to filling up my boyfriend then Vovomeena's BMOC. At around $10, how can one go wrong? A waffle, pork chop, 2 eggs, little cinnamon with apples and a Portuguese donut to top it all off. He can't wait to go back for seconds on Sunday. Order was called in and ready within mins. Workers were friendly and courteous, definitely a plus especially for such a busy place.

Came for the first time and brought 4 friends visiting from out-of-town.  Seating can get a little hairy; order at a counter and get a number and find a table.  Since we were a bigger party, someone helped us grab a table after a few minutes of waiting to the side.  I had the Mexican Benedict, which was delicious but with the sopes and spuds, was a little too much carb for me.  My iced latte with almond milk was perfect!   My friends had the bangers and the tortilla Espanola which they enjoyed as well.  My vegan friend was also able to find some options and they helped my friend with her two-year-old with an egg option on the side.  The service was prompt, even considering how busy they were at the time.  We all enjoyed brunch and i will definitely be back!

Service was excellent. Fast and efficient. We ordered the Mexican Benedict and the pain perdu. Mexican Benedict was delicious! The pain perdu was a little too sweet for breakfast but it was really good, tasted like my mom's capirotada!

Just the eggs with potatoes, toast, and sausage were great, and I enjoyed the coffee too. Over easy eggs were cooked perfectly and who doesn't like Schreiner's sausage? The whole grain toast was hearty and came with nice butter and jam. The manager here is super nice and very accomodating. Well done guys!
Absolutely delicious food and great service! Very unique menu items and cool atmosphere.
B.M.O.C is just amazing!!! If I could, I would just order a dozen portugese doughnut

I have been searching for a great little place that's not too out of the way to just sit and relax for quite some time now. Vovomeena is one of the best in Phoenix. Not to mention, the food and coffee were beyond ordinary. They were something to brag about.  The service was excellent and I am now going to be a regular here.  Perfect.

There food was delicious, try the banana french toast with whiskey caramel. It seems as if they are still getting organized, I'd love to try it again in a few weeks. I had to wait for coffee in the coffee line, was told to wait in the brunch line, and then move back over to the coffee line... Overall food was great!
Went with 3 other people, once we figured out the ordering process, we were good.  Food was great, service was very friendly and professional, we will be back!
Special of the day awesome. Will return food is amazing staff very friendly and fast service. Coffee is excellent No downside to this place. Worth the drive from. Scottsdale fo a wonderful breakfast.
Excellent and creative menu across the board.  Not epic or life-changing, and maybe not even indelibly memorable, but excellent.  4 stars!

Quaint atmosphere, definitely a spot that you could easily pass up but after reviewing other Yelpers I'm glad that we stopped by. The food was fantastic with unique twists to some favorites. Space is limited inside so get there early otherwise they have a small dining section outside in the courtyard.

My husband and I ate breakfast here while visiting in Phoenix on Wednesday, May 18th. This place is so quaint. The menu is creative and interesting. We ordered a blackstone scramble, a pain perdu with two iced cold brew coffees. Our total was a little under $30 but it was worth every penny. The pork shoulder in the scramble was savory and the french toast was sweet so it was a perfect combination. The coffee was great to boot! We'll be back again.
This place is pretty good. Menu is not overwhelmingly complicated. Pretty tasty food, but the coffee is much better. If you are a fan of coffee, definitely the place to go.

Pros:  Goodfood and diversity on the menu.  Awesome space and great outside seating Parking is accessible  Service was nice GREAT MUSIC. Ha! 3/15/16 whoever made that playlist deserves a metal.  Cons: Weak coffee Small portions for price  The ordering system is annoying; you order at the counter like its a coffee joint and then get your own coffee refills, etc. I don't care to eat out for any meal besides breakfast and I guess I'm a bit of a diva because I love being served -- I recognize I am probably not the majority, but it's a con for me.
Amazing food but horribly cramped! Not enough place to eat comfortablly and would.not recommend big groups since it has no space. Food wise, amazing and perfect for a small date brunch!

After an awesome lunch at Astor House, we took the recommendation from the owner to try out their new breakfast place, Vovomeena.  This is still new and has a few kinks to work out.  Overall, it's a great breakfast place.  The food is delicious and something different from your usual egg benedict and pancakes.  We got the boxty and grillades which was delicious.  It did take a while for us to get our food and the set up is a bit confusing.  It's counter service so you'll need to order first and then find a place to sit.  Also, if you order coffee, you need to go to the coffee counter to pick it up.  Once you get the hang of it, it's a pleasant brunch experience.  The Japanese coffee was good as well.

A great place for breakfast. Minus one star for the coffee not being that great. I had the johnnycakes, which were quite delicious and filling; a great way to start the day. The cappuccino I got was sub-par. Lots of natural light and you can sit outside too.

Really liked this place. Food was delicious and relatively quick even though it's super busy. I recommend getting the BMOC and/or Mexican Benedict.   Didn't get a chance to try their coffee but looks like they had some good options. Will have to try next time I'm in town.
I love this place. Extremely creative menu and quality filling food. The atmosphere is comfortable, light, and community oriented. Bring your appetite! The staff is wonderful!

You will receive everything, expected. This establishment is warmly operated from beginning to end. Will return again and also bring extended family. These recipes are delicious to seasoned travelers and to eat at home families.The normal annoying pits of service found elsewhere are no where here!

This place overall has a good vibe and the food is different but really good. It can be a little pricey but your paying for the quality of the food. As you wait in line you can watch them make fresh food from scratch. Recommend it if you're looking to try something new and open to modernized Mexican food.
Best breakfast in Downtown Phoenix and perhaps the World!!!! If you love someone bring them here.

The service is great! The sausage is excellent too!! If you're wheat/gluten intolerant or need gf then good luck. I had Johnnycakes since it was advertised as being made with corn: and wheat... grrr.    Walking into this chic locale was fun, and had enough different textures within to lure us in. We drove over 20 miles to specifically to eat here.  Coffee is excellent too and very unique: I love their variety of cold drips.   The big negative (or a positive spending on your perspective) is that this place is too NOISY! This is primarily why I am giving 3/5 stars. If it wasn't so stinking loud in here I would easily give 4-4.5 stars.

I'm from Rhode Island so the minute I saw the menu I started laughing. I also called my grandmother vovo - so I immediately felt like I had to try to this place. I mean, Portuguese donuts? Say no more. YUM! They have a delicious breakfast selection. I just had the coffee and a donut today - but we are going back this weekend for the breakfast. The staff is friendly and the decor is wicked awesome (Inside Rhodey joke). I just wish they served Portuguese linguisa sausage. :0)

The food (johnny cakes and pain perdu) was good, and the service was exceptional. At least 4 times someone stopped by the table to see how our food was and if there was anything they could do for us. We were also asked how our meal was on the way out the door. The staff were really awesome!

Wonderful breakfast place with delicious, unique dishes and great service. The savory crepes are amazing!!  I really can't say enough about them. The manager clearly cares about guests and makes sure they enjoy the meal. Good coffee, too!

Great atmosphere and people. Smaller location so make sure you come early to get a good spot! Had the chorizo sopes which were a tad on the spicier side. Other than that great overall experience. Price was reasonable for downtown Phoenix.

Really good food and some unique choices. The place however is a tad too expensive in relation to portion size to be honest but I'm willing to pay a little more from time to time to enjoy the food here. Parking can be an issue since there are a ton of places around this place. If you are looking for something new and in the mood for brunch give the place a try.
Lucky to get in before the Easter (Sunday) crowd.   Amazing ambience delicious items. Very hard to decide on just one. There is a party going on in my mouth. Thank you Yelp for showing me this.
Super efficient counter service, friendly and helpful staff, and a unique delicious menu
YUM YUM YUM!!!!!! Food is absolutely delicious! Its weird to figure the place out at first but the staff is great at walking you through it.   BRING CASH TO TIP.

A cute local breakfast/coffee place. I really enjoyed my Mexican Benedict. My kids gave two thumbs up for the 3 sisters omelette and the kids meal. You order at the counter and pay then take a number to your table. We got our food quickly which was good because we were hungry. Yum.

Start with their Coffee is amazing! We are visiting the area from Ventura CA an love to eat breakfast in an outdoor environment. This place has outdoor seating which is great. Service, nothing short of amazing! We ordered the scramble and the tortilla. The scramble with the homemade flour tortilla was fantastic! The Spanish Tortilla was just okay. Since we have been to Barcelona and my best friend is a Spaniard, I have had some amazing Tortilla. This one was not close. Sorry, but outside of the so-so Tortilla, everything else was excellent!!!

Love the laid back chill decor.  Easy to order your food at the counter,  pick up your barista coffee, at the next counter, and help your self to refreshing lemon water.   I ordered the Mexican benedicts.  They were served over a sope, which is a thick round mini tortilla.  Gluten free of course.  There was chorizo in the sope and the perfectly Poached egg on top with a light hollandaise sauce.    Delicious!

I may never eat Breakfast again, I think I am still full.  This place is owned by the same people who own Tuck Shop- Maybe my favorite restaurant in Phoenix.  The place is smallish- but cool.  Tables can be hard to come by, but if 2 people are sitting at a 4 top, ask them nicely, and they will switch to your 2 top.  It is worth the wait, because the food and coffee are awesome.  I had the BMOC, it was perfection on a plate- sweet, smoky, salty, runny, savory.  It was also about 2000 calories, but it was worth every bite!  I also did not eat again for 10 hours.  I ordered just coffee, it was good stuff.  My girlfriend got a Caramel something or other- she really liked it.  I'll be back.

This place is absolutely amazing! A girlfriend of mine mentioned we try it out a few months ago and now we cannot get enough of it. The food is organic, fresh, and just simply delicious!! If you go on a weekend get there early! It is a smaller space and fills up fast. The staff is amazing and super nice! I just wish they were open on mondays....my day off

Went this morning took my mother, we were on a search for a great breakfast near the downtown area. This place didn't disappoint. Great service and awesome menu and coffee! We got the Cinnamon apple French toast with marscapone cheese and the Tortilla Espanola. Amazing!

We are in town for spring training and this morning I was looking for a nice breakfast spot. I actually found Vovomeena mentioned in an online article listing the five best breakfast spots in Phoenix. We drove up and found quick parking and noticed that they were a fast casual restaurant in that you line up, order at the counter and seat yourself with a number to wait for your food to come out. This actually works very well for this restaurant in that they have a fairly small but eclectic menu (no substitutions please). We got there right in time as we only had one couple ahead of us in line and as we waited I saw an order of their biscuits and gravy get served up. My mind was made up, biscuits it would be. I chased it with their Japanese style ice coffee. The food came out quickly and it was delicious. The gravy had a rich peppery taste to it complimented by the big chunks of sausage generously smothered over a delicious split biscuit. As we ate the line at the counter grew to extend itself out the door. Now for those of you thinking that fast casual means little to no service, Vovomeena will prove you wrong. The food was brought out by a friendly food runner and as we were wrapping up our meal, I believe it was the manger, stopped by to ask us about our experience and chatted with us a while, answering my question about the name of the place. Meena being the nickname of the owners grandmother and Vovo being short for grandmother in Portuguese. It was an awesome breakfast and I would highly recommend it.
The breakfast was great, good quality and quantity of food, relaxing atmosphere. The ice coffee was perfect for this hot morning.

all I can say is wow the minions different from anywhere you can go things that you rarely see like my tortilla Espanola it's kind of like a egg casserole with tortillas very creamy text sugar tortillas perfect like the fact that they give you a greens with a light acidic dressing and balances out the eggs since I don't eat pork this is one of those very few places that has chicken as an option or any non pork meat would recommend getting this download waffle on the other hand was just one step above Eggo waffle very Bland very soft not too good another one of those places you get really good food that you order at the counter no tipping required so I could save money for more delicious food can't beat that I think next time I'm going to try the French toast saw them making it look very good will be back very soon

I've been here twice so far and both times have left stuffed and happy with the food and service. I've tried the Mexican Benedict and the special of that day, the huevos rancheros. Both were so flavorful, and those potatoes complete the meal. I've only tried the regular brew coffee, which is also very good. My friend ordered a cappuccino that was just about the frothiest coffee I have ever seen! I like that you can order your food and pay before being seated, and I appreciate the little coffee bar to the side where regular brew coffee is self-serve or they make specialty/espresso drinks to order. Staff is also very friendly and accommodating.

This is definitely a go-to when in Phx! The ambiance is great, I love the coffee bar they have. They have food for those that like to try new things and for those who just want good simple breakfast! The place is clean, refreshing, and the staff is friendly.
Mexican Benedict was delicious!! The orange juice is fresh! The place was clean and music was nice!

The Service, Atmosphere and Breakfast - all top notch! I had the Orchard French Toast with brekafast potatoes and it was delicious. All the flavors melted together on the french toast and the potatoes were crispy and soft, just how i like them. I held out to eat here on my 4 hour drive from California and I am so glad I did. Breakfast Heaven!

Yummy breakfast that is quicker than most sit down places. You walk in and the place is bustling on a weekday. I had the chorizo Benedict and it was good. Everyone else in my group enjoyed their breakfast and were all satisfied with the speed and quality. Will be back when in the Phoenix area

After a few years of service, they definitely got the ordering and table seating down pat!  Don't worry if you see a line and zero empty tables.  You WILL get a table, just line up by the coffee area and the manager, who has been there forever, will seat you well before the meal. Do not try and steal a table, they will catch you!   I ordered the Three Sisters Omelet and my DH ordered the pork chop with Portugese donut.  Everything was very tasty, with the exception of the side of bacon.  One piece was fairly crispy and the other very limp and fatty.
This place was busy but we were able to get a table.  The food was delicious and everyone was very nice.  The pork chop and waffle was amazing!!!

I came here for brunch and tried their biscuits and gravy, Mexican Benedict and their banana french toast. I was really excited for their biscuits and gravy, but it was just okay. I liked their sausage gravy but it wasn't as flavorful as I expected it to be. Their Mexican Benedict was just okay as well. Their french toast was pretty good, but very sweet. If you like banana bread, you'll probably like this dish.

Was in town for Spring Training and was downtown to eat at another establishment recommended. The other establishment had a long line so we searched Yelp and found Vovomeena. Their menu is outstanding!  In fact we came two days in a row. Had the Mexican Benedict the first day and the Biscuits & Gravy the next. Great flavor!  My son had the B.M.O.C. which is a pork chop on a waffle with two eggs on top. I tried the pork chop and it was tender and had a great smoky taste to it. Would recommend this place to anyone traveling to or through Phoenix!
really good it would have been 5 stars if they had food for a person who doesn't eat pork or eggs lol. yet their one vegan option was good.

Been here 3 times and the food is amazing the 3 sisters omlet is super fantastic and the bacon is the bomb! great americano / coffee beans too! This by far is my favorite breakfast spot, place is busy on the weekend but with food like this I understand why. It's why I come during the week! Lol

I was a little thrown by the bleh strip mall location at first... but then, that's pretty normal for Phoenix overall I guess.  The place is set back into a little courtyard, so the outside seating is pretty relaxed with no cars whizzing by or anything.  This is a popular place, for sure - for good reason.  So prepare for a wait.  It's the type of place where you walk in, grab a menu, and stand in line to order - then they bring you the food after you order.  I've always been a fan of that style, so when you're done eating, you just leave, but it took so long that I was wishing I could just relax at a table instead of standing in line for over 30 minutes, but whatever.  I loved the menu.  Short but sweet with creative breakfast options.  So many things I wanted to try.  I loved the biscuits and gravy.  Coffee was meh - made in mass quantity instead of to order.  My girlfriend liked her breakfast, but didn't love it.  We'll be back...

When a midweek brunch can bring back fond nostalgia of flavors from a childhood you never had, it's a big win. First, let's talk Mornin' Moonshine, shall we? Truly a stellar coffee product that is created with care and precision that you can taste. It's as artful as it is delicious.   I knew it was more than I could eat, but I had to order the b.m.o.c., which is a waffle topped with a pork chop and eggs. This dish is also garnished with a Portuguese donut. My husband ordered the savory crepes, which were topped with a red pepper sauce that replaces ketchup in my book.   Truly satisfying, tasty and the service was top-notch despite the order-at-the-counter-and-pick-a-seat setup.

OMG, for sure, a MUST do for breakfast.  The Banana Bread French Toast was amazing, especially with the Caramel Whiskey sauce!  GREAT atmosphere, good service, yummy food.  I will be bringing friends! Thx

Me and my husband went on a Saturday morning around 930ish AM and it was little busy. From outside, it is a pretty small place, walking in one can smell the wonderful aromas coming from the restaurant, they have small outdoor seating here, not good for summer months with the way temperature has been, there is no mist or fans out there. Upon entering the restaurant, there is a sign to take the menu and order and manager will seat you. We ordered the special for that day, which was Steak Rancheros. My husband loved the special, for me not so much. The salsa on the steak was very good. Their coffee was great. Their servers were really good and polite. The man at the register was very impatient and just wanted to be done and move on to next person. We told him that this was our first time coming, what do you recommend, he did not have anything to say. So we asked him again, what do you think about the special? he said- "it's good!". That is how we made our choice, we did not want to hold the line. My husband ordered Orange juice, which is nothing spectacular, it has the taste of a regular grocery store juice. I ordered waffle as extra and it was okay. When it came, it looked like it was already sitting for a while. I have posted the same pics with and without flash. They do not have much sitting area inside, their high tables and chairs are very uncomfortable to sit in. I am not sure what all the hype is about, or may we just ended up coming on the wrong day. I have no desire to go out of my way to visit this place again.

Great little breakfast/brunch place with cool chairs and ropes hanging from the ceilings.  We got the Pain Perdu with sausage and a coconut macaroon.  I thought the main dish was a bit too thick and heavy, though my girlfriend liked it.  Neither of us thought much of the sausages. The macaroon was fine, but felt a bit under-cooked.
Busy little brunch place in Central Phoenix.  Portions are HUGE.  Great food and coffee!  Will definitely be coming back!

I ordered the blackstone scramble and my brother ordered the pain Peru. The blackstone was good but the tortilla was dry and crackly. Potatoes were cool and tasted like they were cooked hours before we got there and were just barely warmed up for us. Coffee was meh and so was the tea.
This is our favorite neighborhood restaurant! We come here far too often. The service has always been personable and the food is always a great way to wake up!

GREAT spot for breakfast and coffee! WE decided to try something new in the area, and Vovomeena is about the only place we haven't tried yet. I'm SUPER glad we tried it, as we'll probably be back this coming weekend. The menu is very simple, straight forward and to the point. they have close to 10 different menu items, a mix of omelettes, meats and breakfast dishes. I went with the Biscuits and Gravy with over easy eggs and a Vanilla latte. Wifey had this omellette with feta and a ton of veggies. My daughter went with the kids pancake and eggs, HUGE pancake that was easily enough for her to share with her daddy haha The sausage gravy was the perfect consistency, and the biscuits were done just right. Wifey LOVED her omelette as well. Teh coffee was also done just perfect. All in all, just a great meal at a cool little spot. we'll for sure be back!

Ate here yesterday with a friend for breakfast.  They had good friendly service and the food was very good also. I tried the Mexican Benedict and was impressed, It was original and had good flavor. My friend and I both really liked the potatoes they serve here, they were really good.  They serve a very good cup of coffee as well. Parking can be annoying in this location but I went at an off time so I got a good space without any problems. It can be crowded at the rush times as there are many places right together.   Overall I was very impressed and want to go back and try some of the other items on the menu.
We've become regulars and love it here :) Always consistent with food quality and service. Coffee is delish. Great brunch spot

Big portions.   Enough to share.   Unique taste combinations.   BMOC was tender and the waffle was great.   I liked how you order and pay self serve beverages.     Will come back to try different dishes
Such a beautiful place. I feel like family when I walk in! Mexican Benedict-- ridiculously good. My girlfriend and I usually split that & the savory crepes. So delicious, & consistently executed!

The food hasn't been very impressive. However, they have the most amazing cold brew which you can get a "jug of" for $12 or so and fills up 4 full glasses of cold brew. They have a walk up and order line, and from there you are seated and your food comes within 10 min- which is SO refreshing for a breakfast place, which can sometimes take 2 hours to get through. That said, 4stars!

Although the menu is relatively limited, there were a variety of food options for me, being vegetarian. The atmosphere is great and the weather was nice enough for me to sit outside at the community style table. The food was made so quickly and with great quality. My only debacle was the request to not modify menu items when ordering.

Food was pretty good. They didnt have alot of variety and they also dont allow substitutions so that was a bummer. Kind of pricey for not really having that much variety but staff is super friendly and nice which is cool.

Cool little restaurant. Parking is tight but free which is nice. My husband loved his cold brew coffee and I had the refreshing passion fruit iced tea. The biscuits and gravy are hearty and filling, the tortilla was nice and light yet incredibly savory. Knocked a star after watching a cook rub his nose with a gloved hand and keep working. That's pretty hard to shake as you're already finished up.

I really dig this place! There's plant of outdoor seating, the Mexican Benedict was delicious, the coffee is delicious and they have honey and almond milk sitting out. I like those subtle touches of class.

The only reason this place received 4 stars instead of 5 is because there are no substitutions.
