As someone that doesn't prefer to eat meat but loves eggs Benedict I was sad to hear they don't make the meals on site thus can't manipulate them.   But their coffee is amazing and the food is delicious!

I like the vibe here, and I've found the staff responsive and friendly. The menu is sort of a mixed bag: unusual combinations, some of which really work and others that really don't.  The main thing that keeps me from going back more often is that the food is generally very heavy, and the menu doesn't have the flexibility one usually expects with breakfast. For instance, you can get bangers in the one dish that features them, but not as an option in place of the breakfast links that come with one or two other dishes. No building your own breakfast here. The menu hasn't changed in the few years since they opened, so things are pretty much set in stone.

If I could give this place 10 stars I would! My husband and I shared the Orchard French toast and the Wilcox Avenue. Both were out of this world.  I am from Rhode Island and I loved seeing the menu offerings named for things from back home like Blackstone, Three Sisters, Pawtucket, and Johnny cakes.  We sat outside to enjoy our breakfast which was a great start to a beautiful day.  This place is just great and you must try it out ASAP!

In Phoenix for some baseball Spring Training. Craving a good breakfast on our way to the game. Holy smokes! Our craves are satisfied beyond our wildest expectations. Excellent breakfast sandwich. Excellent scrambled eggs with onions, peppers and pork. We ordered a pancake style dish that has corn in it - terrific and original.  Excellent customer service. Wonderful coffee. Nice people. So awesome.
Very yummy breakfast...love the atmosphere and the location. I'll stop by next time I'm in the area.

It's been a while since my visit here but it still stands out as a sweet brunch spot. Walk up and order kind of place. There was a long line but it went quickly. My group had the bangers and mash, biscuits and gravy, omelette, and French toast. For whatever reason the toast came out cold and the staff was happy to fix it for us. He even comped it. Really good gesture. They featured coffee from somewhere in phoenix locally but I don't remember the name. Anyhow, I'm definitely hoping to try this place again.

I've been wanting to check out Vovomeena for a while, so when my mom and I found ourselves in the neighborhood, we stopped in for Sunday brunch. We both got the basic Wilcox Avenue which came with eggs, toast, potatoes, and bacon or sausage. I got the bacon and my mom had the sausage. We both agreed the potatoes were awesome. I liked the bacon and tried some of my mom's sausage. It was the real, fresh kind of sausage and cooked perfectly. The best part is they have a cute patio area they share with the other restaurants in the section. Made for a cute and relaxing dining experience! Service was good though they did run out of the Sunday special, chicken and waffles.

I ordered the Mexican eggs benedict and it was decent. The sopes which replaced the traditional English breakfast muffin were kind of tough and super dense. Maybe they were just overlooked. The chorizo filling was ok, with a bit of a kick in spice. The eggs were poached just fine, but they apparently didn't drain them enough before they were placed on top because there was water on top of the chorizo that spilled out when I cut into the egg benedict. The one redeeming point was the iced cold brew coffee. It was very smooth.

We have become brunch lovers so it was exciting to see unique menu options at Vovomeena. The have a convenient setup so when patrons get there, they can get in line and order prior to being seated. While it's not the biggest restaurant, we were able to order & get seated immediately at one of the tables outside. Our food came out in just a short while.  I chose the 3 Sisters Omelette & my husband chose the Banging Pocket. It was nice that multiple menu options were served with your choice of bacon, sausage, or potatoes. When we were in line, we had the full view of the kitchen; I had seen them cooking up potatoes and they looked delicious so I got those as my side with the Omelette!  My husband loved the Banging Pocket which came with the potatoes. It was a pretty sizeable breakfast but he was able to eat the whole thing. The Omelette was tasty with the black beans, corn, zucchini, & cheese. The only thing I wasn't a huge fan of was the feta that was on top. It felt like there was too much & the strong flavor of the cheese overpowered the others flavors. The Banging Pocket came with a side of salsa which I actually think would've gone well with the omelette as well. I'd ask for that next time ... and no feta!  If I were looking for something different, I'd come back to Vovomeena. It probably wouldn't be my #1 choice but there are other options they offer which I'd like to try!
Amazing food and atmosphere with a friendly staff. A little small on the inside but it's still really cute.
Delicious food!! Get ready to wait for it but definitely worth the wait. Johnny cakes are amazing!! Try the pork sausage as well.

A new favorite for us foodies! We are always on the look out for new and different and Vovomeena delivered! Between the Mexican Benedict and the B.M.O.C my BF and I were beyond satisfied. The Japanese cold brewed coffee was spectacular....try the lemon jalape√±o and the green tea mint flavors, you won't be disappointed

Lovely place. Can't tell how busy the place is from outside but once you get in, you'll be amazed by the decors and vibe. Friendly staff and good service, and the food was uniquely flavored with a Mexican twist. Recommend the three sisters omelet with potatoes!  Ps they have a parking lot and patio seating.

Really nice cafe for brunch. There's ample seating inside and outside the cafe. However, you have to go up to the counter yourself to order and pay. Everything on the menu looked delicious so it took me a while to pick what I wanted! The price isn't bad and the portion is pretty big. I wasn't able to finish my food haha

I just passed through Phoenix on a road trip with a friend and we stopped here for brunch. I had a banana bread French toast dish with whiskey caramel, it was delicious (though overly sweet). Their bacon was another big up. My friend got the pork chop, I tried a bit and it was excellent. I'll definitely come again if I ever pass through.  Edit: Came through a second time and got a black bean and corn egg casserole (three sisters I think). I was equally impressed this time around, though it seemed that the bacon was not the same as what they used the last time. While the bacon wasn't quite as amazing as the last time, it was still perfectly cooked.
I was here on labor day and it was a bit busy, i ate a delicious chorizo burrito. The coffee was also good. I recommend vovomeena.
I've had the Mexican Benedict and the Pain Perdu both were excellent. The atmosphere is really cute and chill. I'll definitely be back.
Amazing breakfast, lovely people, and perfect iced coffee! I (heart) you, Vovomeena!

I work at the Zoyo next door to Vovomeena - Today was my first time ordering from them. I truly had a wonderful breakfast, I ordered the Wilcox Avenue which is a traditional breakfast - i wanted to play it safe.. lol And it was amazing. as i was waiting for my food i saw a few other dishes that looked amazing. The menu is small yet the options have so many items it seems bigger. The best part is the coffee bar which is all "locally crafted" as it states on their menu. They can make u just about anything!! Ben the Barista was a super sweet guy and gave great service!! The decor is beautiful. Check it out!! u will not be disappointed!!
Friendly people, neat vibe, great food. Super breakfast experience. I had the banana bread French toast.
This place is really good and different at the same time. I'm not from the area but if I was I would definitely be a regular

Great place for breakfast. Everything I've ever had here is good. My favorite is the Mexican Benedict. The corned-beef hash special today was wonderful. You order at the counter, get a number, and the food is delivered, always quickly, to your table. The small kitchen is extremely efficient, and the front-house workers, including the owner, are very friendly and helpful. The restaurant also houses a small coffee stand with excellent cold-brew percolating through giant glass beakers overhead.

Wow, this place was amazing. I'm really glad that we decided to pick this place.   When you first come in, you order at the register. If you get a drink, you wait at the drink bar. To assist in finding a seat, a manager is there after you put in your order. I decided to get the classic egg sandwich and Japanese cold brew. I highly recommend the cold brew. It's so good and strong! The classic egg sandwich was amazing too. It's on an egg bun, my fave. The chipotle aioli goes so well with everything on that sandwich. The potatoes on the side were perfectly crispy. Everything was just amazing. The service was great and they kept checking to make sure everything was okay.  If I ever go back to Phoenix, I'd definitely go back here!

Came here for a lunch meeting. Pretty close to downtown and my office, wasn't too difficult to find. The parking here though is a bit hard to find - you may end up needing to park next door. I had to park in Zoe's kitchen because parking lot was full.   I ordered the tortilla espanola with the sausage. The food arrived pretty fast! The tortilla espanola was interesting - first time having it. It had a soft spongy texture - looked like savory cake! The sausage was good, and the salad that came with it was a little greasy for me. Not sure what they put on it but overall the entire dish was good.   Definitely recommend for brunch in youre in the area!
Our family loves to have our Sunday breakfast here. Classic cafe style, with excellent food and coffee is superb. Any option on the menu I've chosen has been delicious!

Can my review consist only of row after row of heart emojis?  No? Darn. Alright then.  Oh Vovomeena. I came for the coffee, I stayed for the breakfast. I saw the cold brew flights on yelp so this easily became a weekend destination. Unfortunately I work most weekend mornings but finally had the opportunity to stop by this previous weekend.  I ordered the waffle with bacon and potatoes. You have NO idea how happy I am that there is a place that offers a breakfast dish with no eggs. I'm not the biggest breakfast fan (because I despise eggs), and unless you feel the same way you don't realize how they are in just about every breakfast dish. Aaaannnyyyyyway, my waffle was awesome (with strawberry jam because I can't stand maple syrup either) and my bacon and potatoes were good too. Got a Portugese donut, because duh, and I was super full after that.  My cold brew flight was good. They use Roastery of Cave Creek coffee which is excellent coffee. This flight consisted of the Black & Tan (a Roc2 roast), vanilla coco-something (vanilla bean and cocoa nibs), and lemon jalape√±o. The first two, yes. The last one....not for me. We chatted with the barista when we were leaving about the brewing system they use, as well as espresso drinks. He was very knowledgable and came across somewhat passionate about coffee.  The only downside was that on a Saturday morning, it was a little difficult to relax while eating. It gets pretty crowded and they are quick to clear your table after you have taken your last bite. Service is quick though, and we had no issue getting a table.  We'll be back, for sure.

This is closer to a 3.5 review but I can't quite nudge it up to a 4.  First off, the food is really good.  We had a Benedict and Johnny Cakes.  Both were tasty,a s was the coffee.  The menu was diverse and interesting and the food arrived quickly.  We were lucky enough to share a table  with some friendly people .  The place was packed, with people walking back and forth looking for seating.   Now for the stuff that needs improvement:  I am not a fan of the stand-in,-line, serve-yourself format in small spaces.  The coffee stand is awkwardly placed and, combined with the lack of seating, makes for a lot of unnecessary congestion.  I get the need to turn tables quickly but would like to be able to linger over a cup of coffee, especially at these prices.  I wish you well , Vovomeena, and know that you have a lot of fans.  I may try you again on a weekday but you're a little too claustrophobic and hectic for me on the weekends..

Came here with a group of 4 for breakfast. The most popular items were the biscuits and gravy, 3 sisters omelet, and Mexican Benedict. The banger pocket was just ok. Good outdoor seating and unlimited coffee!
Always fast a friendly. The bangin pocket and tortilla espanola are amazing! The patio is nice for kids!

Yes its a hipster place, but the food is fantastic!  You all know I love my Biscuits & Gravy, this place gets it right! Homemade gravy with chunks; Chunks People! Not that doctored up stuff from the can that other places like to pass as "homemade!", nicely poached eggs and fluffy biscuits! The coffee was great, service was good, the only complaint I have was the food was not that hot.  Grab a menu at the end of the rope wall and pick your passion by ordering at the counter. Fast and friendly service is waiting for you here so check them out!  Second time I had the Banging Pocket and it was a flavor explosion (does all that sound right?)! Piping hot and a nice fluffy pita, can't beat this thing, I was full half way through, but kept on eating.  Check this place out for sure as its a hidden gem in Phoenix!!

This is a good spot. Very tasty breakfasts. The guys at the counter is alway very nice to me and is very informative about the menu selections.  Speaking of the menu. The food here alone would have gotten this review 5 stars. This menu is a mixture of southwestern Midwestern American classics. I give the food 6 stars.   The problem is signage. You have no idea where to end and where to begin in there. Am I supposed to order coffee here? My meal here? I'm confused. The process  layout gets 2 stars.   Overall this is a quality restaurant.

This is what downtown has been missing. A quaint, reasonably priced, good energy place that is all inviting.   This place is just plain good. Great food, great service, great atmosphere, great time!   And they have tabasco sauce!! So many breakfast places now don't have tabasco sauce. The young girl who served me said "thats all we have...".   I'm hooked. I'll be bringing people to eat here.   Impressive joint.
The manager Kai was amazing, made sure we enjoyed are breakfast and the staff is friendly. The food was great and the bacon was delightful!!
Great concept in downtown phoenix. They have a separate coffee bar for people who want to order and run. The dining room is open and airy. The food was top notch, home-style cooking. I will return.

I have mixed feelings about this place. My companion ordered some sort of a chorizo-heavy situation that was pretty tasty; I, however, went with the mexican benedict because I'm a sucker for poached eggs. Well, the eggs were poached pretty solid, and I discovered that chorizo is not a meat I want in my benedict, so I did not eat much of my dish (stole a lot of my friend's, though!).

My favorite meal of the day is breakfast.   Today was my first time at Vovomeena and I was so impressed. The entire experience was amazing!  The atmosphere is just great. Very chic ambiance, nice art, wood detail on the wall....Loved it.   The service was great as well. Everyone was really nice and helpful.   The food, I must say was my favorite part. I had Savory Crapes and I will dream about them tonight. They were amazing. My boyfriend had BMOC and he was really happy with his order as well.   This place is just one more reason for me to love breakfast even more so.   I am so glad we found this place and mostly glad we live in the coolest part of Phoenix that is full of cool new local places like this one.   Thanks Vovomeena and thank you Mid/Central Phoenix!

I have heard great things about this place. My husband and daughter had the waffle and pancake, respectively. Both of them loved their meals. I tasted the pancake, and it was light, fluffy and delicious! I had the biscuits and gravy, which I did not enjoy. The biscuits were flat and dense, and I had a hard time cutting it with a fork. The gravy was okay, not bad, but not wonderful. I will definitely give this place another try, I'll just choose a different item next time.

Went in for some breakfast.  I ordered their Pain Purdu which was amazing.  The carmel whiskey sauce was good and not overly sweet.  The staff was very friendly and the place has a great look.  Nice to have a good breakfast place close to home.  Definitly want to try something else off their menu.

This is my favorite breakfast place in Phoenix. It's never empty and even on busy days the line moves along quickly. I always leave satisfied but never feeling "heavy" if that makes sense and The coffee is awesome

Amazing place we first saw on Check Please.  Went here with my wife for a surprise pre-Valentine Day brunch.  We got a jug of the Morning Moonshine which gave us enough to take home and get a few more servings out of it.  If you like coffee, you must get.  My wife had the 3 Sisters omelet which she totally loved.  I had the Pain Perdu, which...I'm not even sure if I can describe right.  If you don't like sweet things, avoid.  But me, I'm all about it.  But it's literally Banana Bread Pudding as the bread for the French toast (I thought it'd just be a flavoring :) )  And we got the Portugese donuts because of course we did.  Highly recommend!
The creeps are light and fluffy and the Mexican Benedict were amazing. Not to mention the coffee is so good. The cold press coffee is so amazing will def be back

I saw the yelp photos of the Banana Bread Pudding French Toast, which made the decision to visit. But they didn't have those at the time, so I ate the Mexican Benedict which was delicious! My girlfriend ate the apple French Toast, and loved it. Quality craft food with a nice comfortable, urban farmhouse design. I normally drink coffee with creamer, but the Japanese cold brew was so tasty it didn't need anything else. Menu is short and to the point, not overloading with options.

I ordered the savory crepes and a latte and I was so impressed. The portions were great, the food was elegant and delicious, the staff was kind and attentive, and the atmosphere was relaxing. Will definitely be going back.

We had the Tortilla Espanola and it was delicious! Recommend getting it with the pork sausage. Staff was very friendly and attentive; restaurant has a relaxed atmosphere. Coffee was great! Would definitely return.
Unique food option. Kind of expensive and I wouldn't consider these healthy food options but it sure was delicious. They also have cold press coffee that is really good.

Vovomeena is located on the SE corner of 7th Ave and McDowell in the same center as how you roll sushi.  The place is very small and has a patio with a few tables as well.  The inside is modern and hipsterishly decorated.  You order at the counter and take a number and have a seat.  You can see the two cooks at the counter in the tiny kitchen preparing your food.  What was awkward was the barista is also the server.  So I found myself waiting for my drink while she was running around serving and bussing tables.  This place was packed so there is no reason they can't hire someone else to serve and bus tables.  Unless that person called out this is something that should be addressed.  I ordered the Mexican Benedict.  My dish was a pair of sopes with chorizo and poached eggs on top with hollandaise.  Along with country potatoes on the side.  The sope tasted store bought, the chorizo was okay but a bit greasy.  It also didn't taste homemade.  The eggs were both overcooked.  Poached eggs are by definition runny.  These egg yokes were rock solid.  The potatoes tasted good but were cold and needed lots of hot sauce.  My wife ordered the tortilla espanola with a green salad.  I literally had to laugh because the green salad was just plain arugula tossed with a vinagerette dressing.  The Spanish omelet was basically a slice of a fritatta that consisted of egg and potatos on top of a red salsa.  It was all very plain and simple but not in a way that showcased the ingredients.  The highlight of both our meals was definitely the bacon.  It was nicely smoked and tasted delicious.  If I had to guess it was bought from Schreiners  The meal was about 25 bucks with a tip.  I personally won't recommend this place and wouldn't drive across town to try it again.  I feel confident after the two meals I've tried there is not much else more to offer.  Very hip, very trendy, tad over priced, and poorly executed on several levels.  I will give them the benefit of the doubt and three stars but I would strongly suggest you temper your expectations.

I've been twice and the food is very good. The service is excellent as well. The atmosphere is nice inside. It's busy and there's a lot of bustling around, but I like that.  I got the Mexican Benedict the first time and biscuits and gravy the second time. I enjoyed both items very much.  If you like cold brew I recommend the cold brew sampler. Nice addition to a nice breakfast   Just keep in mind the prices are a little more than most breakfast places. The quality is worth it in my opinion.
Everything I've eaten here is a mouth orgasm, so whatever you're pondering, just do it. The coffee is great and the man-staff is hunky.

It's always a good sign when you want to order everything on the menu...  I was a little annoyed at first for having to wait in line to order, but once I got the menu, I was thankful for the extra time to decide what I wanted (I needed it).   b.m.o.c.: honestly, I don't even like pork or pork chops, but this sounded worthwhile and I'm really glad I went with it. the porkchop was delicious af and went super well with the waffle and poached eggs. It was kind of like an eggs benedict but with a better quality meat and carb substitute. They could probably top it with hollandaise and make it work tbh. I want it again...and again...  orchard french toast: challah? a million times yes. and the grated apple? actually might be the best french toast dish I've ever had. I'm surprised I finished 80% of both of these plates tbh. I was full the rest of the day.  cold brew flight: I learned afterwards you can actually pick which coffee options you want, which I wish I had known beforehand. everything I got was still good but also all kind of tasted more or less the same. I wish I could go back already and try the other options!  my favorite thing about this place was actually the decor. everything is super cute and photo-worthy. I love the signage and the coffee lab wall art. even the framed art prints in the bathroom were adorable.   congrats on winning brunch.

This is an update to my pervious review, I got a pm from the manager stating that they did have the mexican benedict but their warmer was out (idk what that means), it's even more disappointing that they did have it and refused to serve it, i don't get to downtown phoenix often and made a trip just to try this place, so disappointing

Grab a menu and stand in line to order. After you order you can take a seat & they'll bring your food to you. Cute spot to have coffee, breakfast or brunch.  I'm not a huge coffee drinker, but I liked their little coffee bar. It looked like a nice selection.   The menu looked good, and I ordered a potato omelette it comes with your choice of sausage, or bacon I chose sausage. I wish the meal would've been good, but it was bland.   Parking is either right off McDowell which is behind the building, or you can park on the other side off 7th Ave.   They have patio seating, or indoor. They close early afternoon so make sure & check hours.   I may try it out again & order something sweet next time. Enjoy the pics

Went here yesterday for breakfast. I got the b.m.o.c. As a recommendation along with a caffe latte and a cinnamon roll. The b.m.o.c. Was a good combination with he sweet component balancing out the savory. The pork shoulder was a little bit salty for my taste and the eggs were prepared well. The coffee was pretty good as well (I like a place that serves latte art :) ). The service was phenomenal. The employees were super prompt and polite and definitely friendly. Overall I would return to try out other menu items :)

I can't believe this place serves tortilla espanola! Its one of my favorite dishes from traveling in Spain but it's too simple for American dining (just eggs and potato). Served along side an arugala salad and their homemade papas bravas sauce (not actual papas bravas sauce but a tasty slightly spicy tomato sauce). It was a fabulous find on my vacation,  wish I could eat here more than once.

This is a great little hide away for a wonderful breakfast. Service is amazing and everything is served very fresh. Kaj is a very engaged manager and the rest of the staff are equally as engaged making sure their product is served at perfection. 5 stars is not high enough for this place

My sister and I decided to grab breakfast together today since I had taken the morning off work for our grandmother's burial. This place was bookmarked a while ago and it has 4.5 stars so we decided to give it a try.   The place was a bit hidden for us since we didn't see it from the street. Parking seems to be limited but we didn't have trouble getting a spot.   It's a quick place for breakfast/brunch. You order at the counter, get a number display and you grab a table. I went with the Savory Crepes - they were just okay. Nothing stood out and I wished I had ordered the orchard french toast that I was eyeballin on the menu. It wasn't that it was bad, it was just so plain. Maybe it was my sweet tooth that made me feel guilty.  My sister went with the banging pocket (I think that was what it was called). She said it was enjoyable but also was not impressed. She did enjoy the fresh squeezed orange juice and I managed to steal a few sips of it. Not a bad way to start a Friday after a funeral service. No complaints about the food and service was quick & friendly.

It has been way too long since I've been impressed by a meal at a restaurant. It seems that lately if I go out to eat I leave feeling unsatisfied and that I could have made the food better, quicker and for way less cash myself than what I just experienced dining out. Enter Vovomeena!   This place knocked my socks off! Wow! Great atmosphere, good music, friendly staff and the place is so clean and comfortable (even the bathrooms here are relaxing and beautiful). And talk about the menu! Johnnycakes oh my! Corn and chili pancakes with prickly pear maple syrup- what?!!! DELICIOUS! And the coffee from Morning Moonshine, a roaster I'll admit I'd never heard of before but am SO glad I've discovered! That's coming from a Portland, Oregon food capital foodie but thank goodness my mom lives in Phoenix and I can count on visiting Vovomeena each time I'm in town. Granted I have only tried the breakfast here (after all it is the best meal of the day is it not?) but I'm certain if you chose anything from the menu it would not disappoint. I highly recommend grabbing a meal and cup of joe here.

Was in the area and decided to give this place a try. Parking was a bit of a pain as there is shared parking with other franchise food joints such as chipotle, Pokie and so forth. There isn't a waiter but a nice gentleman walks around making sure all is well. Basically, walk in, order your food and have a seat. They bring the food to your table which was nice. This is more of a cafe spot but very urban and comfortable feel to it. Very modern with some chic added if that makes any sense. Any-who. Perfect place for brunch date with some girlfriends or partner. Food was tasty as i ordered the Mexican Benedict because this is Sonoran dessert and why not order Mexican right. Definitely recommend.
It was ok nothing special. Mine was rather bland (tortilla espanola). Coffee was a little strong for my likening as well.   It was new to try however. The process of ordering I have never done.
This place rules! I can still taste the banana bread pudding french toast...so good! Great brunch spot with great Japanese cold brew coffee.

Brunch porn. Soft yolk dripping all over the place...ohh baby. This place is amazing and the cold drip coffee is to die. The menu is small but mighty. Very cute little spot that looks like the inside of an instagram. I love coming here on Saturday mornings for a quick bite.

If you blink or sneeze while looking for this place on the south east corner of Mcdowell and 7th Ave. you will miss it. You grab a menu prior to being seated, get in line to order with the cashier. Once you pay, you'll be given a number, then you can sit at a table.  I had the pancakes, with sausage and two eggs. Delicious!! The syrup is so tasty. You serve your own coffee but juice can be grabbed right before paying. No servers to wait on you, they just bring out your food and you aren't bothered again. It's a bit loud due to poor acoustics and folks chattering. I do not recommend bringing kids, more of an adult restaurant.

Such a cool little place.   I'm not from Arizona so I accidentally drove past the place twice (the entrance isn't on the direct main road).  The staff was friendly and the guy at the counter seem to genuinely enjoy answering questions.  The ice coffee is strong and the flight is a fun way to try new flavors that you wouldn't find at any ordinary coffee chain.  I ordered the Mexican Benedict and the flavor was amazing. I like that it was ground chorizo and not just a patty. It was so filling and a large portion for being Eggs Benedict.

Excellent, excellent!  If you're a fan of the trendy cold brew coffee, they've got a whole wall of it.  You can even get a jar to take-home.  The jar is allegedly for four iced coffee drinks but if you're like me and you like a little coffee in your almond milk, it'll go a lot further.    Because of the rave reviews about the pain perdu, that's what I had to get.  It's essentially bread pudding disguised as breakfast and as far as I'm concerned, that's brilliant.

The banana nut muffins taste like Cap'n Crunch! Their muffins are baked with love. Soft, moist, fresh and flavorful.   3.5 Star review.  I've seen nothing but great reviews and recommendations for this breakfast joint.  It was quite busy the morning I came - looked like some business meetings even took place here. A wait was understood but the lines died out and it got to a point where we thought they forgot about us. When I went to check on my table's order, the guy at the counter let me know that it would be right out. And it did come to us within the next couple minutes. Everyone was super apologetic and a gentleman (perhaps a manager? Owner?) even came by and checked up on us, apologized, and gave us three muffins on the house. Such a kind and appreciated gesture - not to mention those muffins are fantastic! Might even be the best thing we had on the menu!   I ordered the classic egg sandwich. The bread was really soft and you can never go wrong with eggs and bacon. Overall I enjoyed my sandwich. I would order it again.   My boyfriend ordered the Wilcox Avenue which was just eggs, a choice of meat, and toast. Again, simple, he also enjoyed his food with some Tapatio.   My brother and his girlfriend on the other hand did not have too pleasant of a breakfast. He got the Blackstone Scramble, which he said was barely seasoned and had an overwhelming amount of bell peppers.. And she ordered the Mexican Benedict. She is a lover of all Benedict's. That is, until today. The chorizo was not very flavorful. Again, the meal was just pretty bland and the eggs were over poached. There was such high expectations as everyone raves over them but it did not deliver in the least bit.   It made sense why my boyfriend and I were happy with our meals because what we ordered doesn't require seasoning.   What really made me disappointed were the spuds that are served with every meal. Now, I don't know if it's a thing to just kind of boil potatoes and call it good but I was not a fan! The amount of time we waited I feel like they should've sat on the stove top a little longer to get at least a crisp if there's absolutely no flavors added. Not even copious amounts of pepper or ketchup could save those.  Aside from that - if I were around the area, I would probably stop in for a muffin and some tea or coffee.

I found breakfast here a mixed bag. My friend had an egg sandwich, which was really tasty, but I had the Mexican Benedict, which was pretty disappointing. The poached eggs had runny whites, the chorizo was a bit too spicy for a breakfast meal, and the hollandaise sauce was flavourless.  Having said that: it's a funky building, the coffee was good, and the staff were friendly.  I'm going to assume the Benedict just sucks.

I've been here several times and always get the Pan Perdue.  It's excellent.  The staff is friendly and the food is prepared quickly.  I don't drink coffee, but my husband said their iced coffee is the best he's ever had.    My only complaint would be the various signs posted all over the place mandating that you do not sit down at a table unless you have placed your order.  I've never seen such a rule and I've certainly been out to eat many times.  Seems like an odd thing to enforce or care about.  What if your feet hurt or you are old or you have kids with you?  Ridiculous, especially given I've never witnessed a time where someone is standing around with food and no place to sit.
Well a Nother great you'll find quite a simple menu but very good I would go with the banging pocket or the Mexican Benedict!

I enjoyed this spot. First off you grab a menu and seat yourself then decide what you'd like to eat after which you head to the area where you order you food and drinks. Grab a number and they deliver your food to you. There is a coffee bar where you go to get your coffee. The coffee was good. My food came out fast and was fresh and hot. I ordered the pudding bread French toast (Pain Perdu), it was very good. Very inexpensive place to eat and conveniently located in central Phoenix. Enjoy!!!

My friend and I stopped by here for brunch based on their Yelp reviews and we were not disappointed! I highly recommend the Mexican Benedict! The people there was super friendly! We're visiting from NY/NJ and we're asking for recommendations and everyone was so helpful! Thanks for a great meal and the recommendations!

Really great breakfast! And equally important, the service (all off the employees) were so nice and helpful! I had the b.m.o.c. and my husband had the biscuits and gravy. We both got coffee and a cinnamon roll to go. Very satisfying meal and experience!   We will definitely be back!

Check this delicious breakfast and brunch spot out! My husband and I both ordered the BLT sandwich which was served with potatoes. My sandwich was served on a wonderful multigrain bread. In between the two pieces of toasted bread was crisp bacon, a blue cheese mayo which I was nervous about, but was the perfect condiment, lettuce and tomato. The sandwich was only $7.50 which is more than respectable for a great sandwich and side. Definitely worth trying!

I agree with the other reviewers who are reluctant to give a good review because they don't want this place getting "too" popular and crowded. However, I had such a positive first experience that I must spread the good news.  This place is unique and a welcome addition to the other cookie cutter restaurants @ 7th Ave & McDowell. The menu is also unique and a refreshing change from the typical breakfast fare offered at most other places. The ambiance is modern, and comfortable. The portions are plentiful and I had no chance of leaving the restaurant hungry because the chef skimped on anything. I will definitely be returning to this restaurant with friends.

Such a cute little place, very clean. Came here on a lunch date. There wasn't very many people at all (later in the afternoon) so we were able to get in and out pretty easily. The food was very delicious, ordered a sandwich (forgot which one) and enjoyed it way more than my date :-0   My only complaint, is the parking sucks as it seems they share a small lot with other businesses.

Unfortunately, I was not a fan of the Mexican Benedict. The chorizo was very greasy and the sopes were stale. I was missing a perfectly toasted, crispy English muffin to soak up my poached eggs. My eggs were perfect but my friend's eggs were overcooked with hard-boiled yolks. I also sampled stale biscuits and gravy. Honestly, KFC has better biscuits. Maybe it was just an off day.   I DID enjoy the outdoor patio and order-at-the-counter/seat yourself nature of the place. Very causal place to hang out with friends over food and coffee.

Eggs Benedict where over cooked but they made them right, pulled pork is NOT Pulled Pork it's the ends of a Dried Out Ham slice, eggs on pulled pork were over cooked as well! Potatoes were half cooked and half burnt, not sure why??? Muffins and Coffee where excellent!

We werent sure about this place before trying it, it was a random find and not typical to our normal choices. From start to finish it was great --- great service, delicious food, reasonably priced! My husband eats a lot and was full from his BMOC and I had the best waffle I have ever had! Great twist on breakfast. Can't wait to come back again!
It's THE place to go get Brunch! So delicious! I got mexican benedict eggs and they were fantastic! My husband got the spanish tortilla and it was yummy too!!

In my opinion, it was difficult to figure out where to order at first, and then was unimpressed by the small menu, especially on a Sunday brunch time.   By the time we got there they had run out of half their menu, and I ended up getting something that looked nothing like how it was described on the menu. It was basically an egg and potato quiche.   The coffee was good but overpriced. The food itself was average at best. The bacon I got was tough. One good thing was the arugula salad, the dressing was delicious.   I would go there again maybe for coffee, but probably not for food.
This place is real close to our house. Love, love, love the cold coffee options. Great food with unusual and delicious menu items! We will be back again for sure. :)

Great food!  Very nice atmosphere. Pleasantly surprised by their unique menu. They also honor active duty service members and give a military discount. Highly recommended.  Will definitely revisit if I am ever in the area again.
Great food,  great service, great atmosphere! Delicious!  Found this place on yelp and was so glad we ate their today.  Park on 7th ave behind the restaurant.

I work in the area and this restaurant is my go-to for fresh breakfast/brunch. Atmosphere is perfect for a bite to eat with friends, co-workers, even clients.   Staff is friendly and food is always consistently amazing. Truly a hidden gem in Phoenix.

AMAZING! Came on a Saturday morning, the atmosphere right when you walk in is very urban, but comforting. The food was amazing, you order first then sit down and they will bring the food out to you. The owner greeted us and helped us find seating. Food was wonderful, I cannot recommend dining in enough. We were also able to get out coffee to go, which was also wonderful. If you are contemplating something in the menu, ask the staff, the are knowledgeable about the food and ingredients.

Totally surprised by this place. Having just moved here not too long ago I had to find the best French toast spots. DID NOT disappoint. I'm currently waiting to invite people and go again. I probably can't tell you enough how good it was. Everyone in my party of 4 was highly impressed and wouldn't stop raving about the food all day. Kinda weird walking in but plenty of help once you're in. Take a look at the menu and anything you pick you'll be satisfied.

The french toast, waffles, omelets, the orange juice, the employees, the coffee, and the set up. All top notch! Probably the best french toast I've ever had. If you go, get the orange juice. Nothing better than freshly squeezed juice with your French toast, waffles, or omelets!

Really?!? How have I not reviewed you, Vovomeena? This is my go-to brunch place. I just love it. The decor is perfection. The food is delightful. The biscuits are DIVINE. Do yourself a favor and go here ASAP.

This is by far one of my favorite downtown hipster vibe restaurants for breakfast. Affordable and delicious with large portions. The turkey sausage links are a little dry, but the Portuguese donuts and pain breaky are amazing. It's a sweet spot during the cooler months to just sit outside and enjoy the delicious food and coffee. Great concept, great food.

Very good French toast. It was so good we had to go back the next day for more. I was a little disappointed in the Portuguese donuts but that was most likely just because they weren't the Hawaiian style I'm used to but my wife enjoyed them.

This is by far my favorite breakfast spot in Phoenix. Every time I have family or friends visiting, I take them here and they love it. My savory recommendation is the Mexican Benedict. It's a fabulous balance of creamy hollandaise sauce and kicky chorizo. Also, the potatoes on the side are phenomenal. A sweet dish I can't recommend enough is the Pain Perdu. It's banana bread pudding french toast covered in a whiskey caramel sauce and bananas. This is the stuff dreams are made of. Additionally, there's hardly ever a wait. Even when there is, I think the most I've waited is 20 minutes.

The food was fantastic. Everything else was subpar. The setup of the restaurant on a busy day left us confused and in everyone's way. Very cramped and disorganized. As we placed our order, the man taking our order walked away mid-sentence for 2 full minutes with no explanation or reasoning given to us. After we got through placing our order, we were told to go stand by the wall and the manager would seat us. About 90 seconds later a man walked over and just said "Seat?" to us. We said yes and were seated at a table that was halfway in the walkway from the kitchen. Due to this, both kitchen staff and customers who had just placed orders bumped into the back of my chair and head constantly. In the end, we won't be returning. Not due to the food, which was very good, but the service and environment were too strenuous to entice a return visit unfortunately.
Such a fun place. Casual atmosphere and great food. I loved the coffee tasting! Very fun and unique flavors.

I have been talking about trying this place for nearly two years. I am so happy to report that my personal hype was well rewarded!    I ordered the BMOC.. Oh.. My.. Goodness.. Yumm! I'm not a huge pork chop fan, but this one was cooked to perfection. The mixtures of the sweet and savory fulfilled all of my breakfast cravings. The sweet waffle, apple-maple syrup, and Portuguese doughnut paired perfectly with my poached eggs and pork chop.   The portion for the price was incredible. I definitely could not finish my meal, and I like to eat.   I also had the Japanese cold brewed coffee which was refreshing on a warm Phoenix morning.  I was surprised how strong the coffee was. Next time I will try the flight of flavors.   I will be back!!
French Toast is amazing.  Actually everything here is from the coffee to entrees.

We love Vovomeena! We have been there 5 times now, and the food is always great. I order the Mexican Benedict and my husband orders the biscuits and gravy. We are always pleased with our food... the best part are the spuds! Be sure to order something with the potato spuds!  What makes this place special is the cold-brew iced coffee. We bought a glass jug and bring it to fill it every time we visit. It's delicious! We highly recommend the coffee.
Plain and simply: The biscuits and gravy were to die for. Well worth the quirky ordering system.

I came here for breakfast last Sunday, and I will be back. The cold drip coffee was delicious and the vibe was cool here without a doubt. I ordered the bananas foster french toast- it might have been the best thing I've ever put in my mouth. I heard they close early so get there by noon.

The food tastes great but if you have small children it's a nightmare! You have to stand in line to order food, then wait for a table to become available as it's a small establishment that's quite busy. For adults it's great, with small kids... never again!
Always great food. Good service. Good coffee. I would go there more if it were a little easier on the wallet but their prices are not outlandish.

$30 for breakfast for two...  No table service.  Order at the counter, find a seat and they'll bring the food out to you.    We had the BMOC - this was supposed to have a "massive smoked pork chop"  but really it was a thick piece of brined pork that was over brined: too salty and had the texture of lunch meat.  We were excited to try the famous portuguese donut, too bad it tasted greasy like cold fried fair food.  Ugh.  The best part of the breakfast was the savory crepe.  It was tender and cooked perfectly.  The chicken and scrambled egg filling was a bit flat though.  I did order it without the fontina cheese, perhaps that was supposed to carry the dish?  Each ingredient should stand on its own, and they didn't.    There are way too many other places that have GREAT breakfasts.  Try Melrose Kitchen on 7th Ave/Indian School instead. chilaquiles, huevos rancheros, and bottomless flavored lemonades.  Breakfast for two closer to $20.

Delicious classic breakfast sandwich with a spicy kick of chipotle aoli. The Japanese cold brew is also delicious and very smooth. It is made on very unique system using gravity to drip water into a canister.

Well, I gave Vovomeena another shot and I'm glad I did. From the very beginning the customer service was pleasant and attentive. The restaurant was bustling with smiling people enjoying their meals. I tried the pawtucket west: two LARGE fluffy and yummy tasting pancakes with choice of meat, (I had bacon) and skillet potatoes. My hubby had the BMOC: which was beautifully done and tasty: waffle, pork chop, eggs and a freshly made donut on top. I had this coffee, they seem to specialize in, and it was really good, really. Sometimes we have to give places another chance, I'm glad I did for Vovomeena. (Random: the decor everywhere is well done and intriguing, even in the restroom. hahaha).

This is a great little gem. The atmosphere seems a little chaotic at first, but they have a great system in which you order, then line up near the coffee bar and the staff finds your table. We went Sunday morning and it was packed, but the system just worked. The coffee is excellent. We ordered the Spanish tortilla and a burrito, both of which were fantastic. Huge portions. If you are a light eater you could easily split any plate. There's lots of local art, natural light, and attentive management.

Finding Vovomeena and parking there are a bit of a challenge.  Accept that challenge!  This delightful, locally-owned place offers wonderful food, ample portions, and high quality at very reasonable prices.  We're vegetarians and Vovomeena makes ordering non-meat items extremely easy.  Have out-of-town guests?  This is definitely a "don't miss" for visitors.

I'm not one to give 5 stars, but VovoMeena deserves it. Incredible food, incredible staff. The quality of food was exceptional: fresh, perfectly cooked and thoughtfully presented. Their coffee is excellent too!  Add the donut to your order!!

Great brunch menu! The weather is so beautiful in phoenix right now sitting outside for brunch is perfect.   .....They were out of the banana bread pudding French toast so I had an traditional breakfast which was still delicious. I will be back for the French toast sooner than later.

So I've lived downtown for over a year now but only just now got around to trying this place for the first time.  Yeah, I know, fail on my part.  But better late than never.  I've always loved Tuck Shop and found out the same owners also run this little breakfast place.  So up early on a Sunday morning I decided to venture in.  I wandered in by myself right at opening.  The restaurant is packed into a cluster of restaurants on the southeast corner of 7th Ave & McDowell.  You can enter from the courtyard patio area on the west or the parking lot on the east.  The interior is cute and comfortable with enough seating for probably around 40-50 people, though it still has the feel of a small tucked away place.  There's a couple of counter areas inside.  One looks like it was strictly for selling their in-house Mornin Moonshine coffee brand.  The main counter is where you put in your order.  No waiter service here as you just order your meal at the main counter and find seating on your own.  Easy enough for me since I was by myself and the bulk of the morning crowd didn't stream in till later.  Looking through Yelp and perusing the menu, the BMOC seems to be the star here so I decided to give that a whirl.  Meal came out to me about 10 minutes after I ordered.  Long story short, this is a breakfast that eats like a dinner.  The layers from bottom to top are as follows:  Waffle, smoked pork chop, apple maple syrup (with actual diced apples), 2 eggs (any style you want), and a fried donut with powdered sugar.  I can promise you won't go home hungry after eating this.  Lots of flavor in this thing.  I especially loved the apple syrup as it helps mellow the smoke flavor of the pork chop and goes excellent with the waffle.  The pork chop itself is well cooked and hearty, though the smokiness of the pork chop might have been a little bit overpowering for my taste.  But overall, good solid chop.  The best way to attack this dish in my humble opinion is to try and get a fork full of all 5 layers at the same time.  You get a little of everything.  Total tab for the BMOC as well as an OJ came to about $15.  Pretty reasonable for the amount of food I got.  I think next time I come here I might give the Mexican Benedict or the Johnnycakes a try.  Overall a pretty solid and unique breakfast and brunch option downtown.  My first experience wasn't perfect, but more than worthy of another visit (and next time it won't be a year in the making).

I'll start by saying we had a terrible time our first time here.  All too often these days when someone makes a mistake they refuse to fix it.  Vovomeena and the manger Kai did just the opposite.  They made it right by offering two complimentary meals.  We returned, we had great service, amazing food (biscuits and gravy + pain perdu) and will certainly be back again.

Vovomeena is hands down one of the best Breakfast spots in the Valley! I've had moments where I'm dreaming about breakfast there the following morning...I promise it's that good! The biscuits and gravy are probably the best thing on the menu, followed by the Orchard French toast. (Ok I admit, I often get a Portuguese donut on the side because #treatyoself) The waits are often not too bad, even when the line seems out the door, once you get to the register and order, you grab your drinks, grab a table and then the food comes out super quick.

I've been wanting to try Vovomeena for a while now, and finally got to a few weeks ago with my brother. He was a bit apprehensive to take "little sister's advice" on where to go eat, but I know he liked it -- even though he won't tell me so. Lol.  My brother and I were both wanting a breakfast burrito, but since it was a Saturday, we had to choose something else (they only serve the breakfast burrito during the week). I opted for The Banging Pocket (mostly because that's what the guy at the counter recommended) and my brother got the Tortilla Espanola. I also ordered a latte, my brother ordered the cold brew. Now I'm not much of a fan of cold brew typically, but theirs is amazing! They infuse the cold brew with different flavors so it mixes it up a bit; it's not your normal cold brew, I can promise you that!   Since it was a beautiful Saturday morning and not too hot out, we sat outside sipping our coffee while the food was prepared. It didn't take long for the food to come out though, which was surprising considering they were busy (thanks for being awesome kitchen staff!) The Banging Pocket was, well quite bangin' -- extremely flavorful with the mix of scrambled eggs, Schreiner's banger sausage and smoked gouda (my fave!), with a side of roasted potatoes on the side. Definitely hit the spot with me. My brother devoured the Tortilla Espanola, and said it was amazing (the clean plate would've told me that, though, hehe).   I loved the atmosphere, the food, and the absolutely kind and informative staff at Vovomeena. I just wish it wasn't so far from me. I will definitely drive out here again soon though. It's so worth it!

Cool little place. Food is good. Service is good. Cashier' default answer is "no".   So far, my customer experience is that "you cannot have onion in your eggs unless you order the omelet with onions mushrooms and avocado."   I have the biscuits and gravy. Biscuits are average, gravy is ok and very meaty.  I won't be back.

We stumbled upon this place while searching for some breakfast/lunch places in Phoenix. This place was pretty busy upon entering. There were only a couple of tables open. The food was amazing. The biscuits and gravy were top notch. The biscuits were soft yet had a crispy texture, and the gravy was creamy and had delicious sausage pieces in it. The all-you-can-drink coffee was very good. It didn't taste like cheap drip coffee. It was bold and full-bodied and went very well with our food.   The environment was nice in that the doors were open to a nice patio area with outdoor seating. The only thing is that you can't sit where you want. You have to wait until after your order and then they find a table for you. A positive for this method is that you don't have to scramble to find an open table (like you do at In-N-Out!).   We will definitely return to try the other items on the menu. So many menu items that sounded so good. But they are a bit pricey for breakfast, so we can't return very often.
Great food, great service, great ambiance! I had the mexican benedict and my boyfriend had the wilcox breakfast. Even the coffee was good. Will definitely be back.

Delicious, fast service and amazing staff You can order at the counter and pick your own table. The food is fresh, clean and tasty. Their coffee latte is really well prepared too. Really liked this place and hopefully I can stop by again when I'm in the area.

Phoenix is literally littered with restaurants.  With a pizza places opening up on every bloody corner saturating the market with tomato sauce and charred crusts, to concept restaurants taking over the world, there seems to be a new "hang out" brewery or up and coming hot spot on every corner.  I have been coming to Phoenix now for 6 years back and forth and have tried a multitude of the culinary prowess here in the land of cactus and hipsters mixed with pretentious yoga moms who talk incessantly about their new diets and fired trainers.  It seems unlikely that the boom is ever going to end.  Frankly its a bit daunting and pretty stinkin hard to keep up with them all opening and closing.  But......it is good to know that there are a few places that seem to never loose their food edge.  I apparently stumbled on one today.  Vovomeena is a quaint, ugh...what a stupid word quaint, little gem of of 7th Ave and McDowell tucked behind some of the more annoying chain spots that surround it.  You have to get a menu first and decide what you want before you sit down, which I think is brilliant as it only makes me want to punch the jerk faces in the nostrils when they walk into a small spot with their whole family and their stupid dog in a bag and plop down just to "save" their seat.  You people deserve to wait.  You are no more important than the people who are going along with the restaurants rules and regs to keep the flow.    Once you decide off their beautifully minimal menu of about 12 or so items you make you way to the counter, order, grab your number and THEN sit down.  The service is also minimal.  I happen to like that.  They take your order, bring you your food and leave you the hell alone.  They ask if you need anything else and go away.  You are left to get your own coffee and water, which is right around the corner basically from anywhere you are sitting, unless on the patio.  Again I like that.  It cuts down on all the hoopla and stupid speak which, truthfully, unless you are obsessed with yourself, you don't really want to talk about anyway ESPECIALLY AT BREAKFAST!!  I drank to much last night and I want food, good food and coffee and some bloody peace and quiet, so thank you staff.  Not to say they lack anything as they will hop right to if you do, but you are pretty much left to fend.  I ordered the waffle and pork chop with poached eggs and a perfectly crisp beignet plopped right on top.  Whoa doggy it was delicious, every last bite, because I destroyed it like fat kid at Christmas.  I wanted to high five the cooks but they were busy so I gave a verbal "brilliant" to the one who was eyeballing me to see if I liked his food.  Seriously people this place is really quality.  My normal haunt is Matt's Big Breakfast or Dicks Hideaway but I have officially got a new fave in the valley.  Thank you FOH Staff and Kitchen of Vovomeena, I will be back to try the rest of the menu and bring my appetite for more of you yummy goodness.  Cheers.

Uber'd my way here from a downtown hotel. Here for work and decided to spend my morning off at this joint. No wait and lots of seating on a weekday (around 10ish). Ordered the first scramble on the menu that includes fried pork shoulder. YUM. Strips of pork shoulder with red and green bell peppers, onions, etc. served with side of tortillas. Was originally going to get a cup of their special Mexican coffee but I saw they had tropical juices and decided on the blackberry tea. All in all delicious food, laid back and friendly atmosphere.

After having missed a particular Vovomeena special posted on Facebook twice I was finally able to secure a taste for myself!  The Pumpkin Spice Pancakes special included scrambled eggs and two links of Schreiner's sausage.  I applied my Five Star offer of $2 off $10  which basically paid for my OJ:)  Before diving in, I Immediately, packed up the bottom of two pancakes, with 5 of the 10 pecans and a touch of the pumpkin spice butter, mmmm!  The sausage was top notch too, even though I'm not really into sausage. And of course, the eggs were made to order.  The pancakes had a balanced sweetness to it, not overly sugary, which made me happy.  Tastebuds were definitely happy with breakfast this morning!  Vovomeena remains a local gem for breakfast and brunch!

Really enjoyed going to this place. The staff were all friendly and professional. So nice to go to a place where they connect with their patrons.   We got the award winning banana French toast. It was super rich and sweet. If you like sweet this one is perfect. It's pretty much like dessert. The bacon we got with it was yummy, thick cut and perfect for the sweet combo.   The coffee was also spot on. They have the Japanese drip system which was just the perfect jolt for the morning.   I liked the decor of the place and the natural light coming in. And they have an awesome mural at one if he entrances.   Looking forward to going back to trying more of their interesting food.

Finally!!!!!! A breakfast I can rave about. While the menu might not be ten pages of omelets, what they do have is delicious and unique. I got the pain perdu which was phenomenal. No odd dry parts, flavor was incredible. Sauce was perfect. And I got the sausage...yum! Done of the best links I've ever had. Perfect snap and delicious flavor. Hubby got the Mexican Benedict which is fabulous. I'm not a huge chorizo fan nor am I a big corn meal(masa) fan, bit this was epic. My husband who is pickier than a toddler loved it. "Make sure you give them a good review" and for him to say that..well it means something. I thought he would be overwhelmed buy the noise, counter order, trendy factor, but in the end none of the discomfort of those things was a problem because the food was that good. Very quick service. I do wish someone ran around and filled your coffee, but it wasn't a big deal to get up and get my own. I'm full, happy, and will for sure be back the next time I'm in town!

I was in Phoenix recently for the WWE Royal Rumble. To kill some time that morning, my friend introduced me to Portlandia on his iPad in our wretched hotel room. Around 11AM, we were hungry and ready to check out, so we consulted Yelp for brunch options and settled on Vovomeena.  Upon arrival, I wasn't sure if I was still in Phoenix, or somehow had been transported into a Portlandia sketch. As others have noted, it's THAT hipster. A "flight" of Japanese cold brewed coffee - really? Even more amusing was the proud barista describing the cold brew process and the different coffees. And I have no idea how he could tell the different coffees apart ... it's easy with a flight of beers, but coffee all pretty much looks the same. But after pinching myself and realizing I was still in Phoenix, I went for the flight of cold brews. (When in Rome ... err ... Phoenix, right?)  The food options were equally hipster, with a selection of a dozen or so breakfast/brunch offerings featuring fresh, locally sourced food. The only thing NOT hipster about the food are the prices. I typically expect places like this to be a bit pricy, but Vovomeena is a VERY good value. Most of the selections are in the $7-9 range. I ordered the most expensive selection - the b.m.o.c. It featues a smoked pork chop, waffle, two eggs, and a "Portuguese Donut Tower" (basically a funnel cake) for $9.95. My friend got the "pain perdu" - banana bread pudding french toast with a caramel glaze and choice of meat for $7.50. Both portions were ample, and everything was delicious.   And even though this is counter service, the service was great. I joke about the barista, but the kid (he looked like he was 17) was really nice and knowledgeable. It reminded me of talking to a brewer (or beer nerd) at a brewpub - he had that level of knowledge. And when I went back for a 16 oz cold coffee after I finished my flight, he admitted he accidentally made an extra flight, and asked if me and my friend wanted it. Thanks dude! Needless to say, between 1 1/2 flights and the 16 oz coffee, I was amply caffeinated for the day.   Of all the places we went to in Phoenix, this was my favorite by far. I doubt if I ever will be back in Phoenix ... but if I do, Vovomeena is a must stop for me.
Absolutely excellent food. The biscuits and gravy were incredible. I can't wait to come back!

This place has amazing breakfast food! I have tried something different every time and have loved every bite of it all. Their Portuguese donuts dipped in their strawberry jam is out of this world. You definitely have to try this place out. It's pretty busy on Saturdays, but if you go early enough on Sunday you can beat the crowd. They had these ooey gooey butter bars and they were amazing, but I haven't seen them in a while, so that's my only complaint.

Terrific breakfast. Awesome location.   Inside decor is really cool.   Recently went here and took a long time to get my food. The owner took the initiative and checked on our order to see what was going. He came over to my table to advise me that my ticket was lost but they re-entered out order. The owner refunded us our money. Whether this is normal protocol or not, the manager did not have to do it and showed us how amazing their service is.   Even with the mishap, I will still be visiting this place often!

We were looking for a place to eat brunch when we first got to Phoenix, and this place was PERFECT. The food was good and the staff was very friendly. You have the option of sitting inside or out on the patio.

There's nothing like meeting up with good friends on Saturday or Sunday for breakfast or brunch. It's nice to see an additional local restaurant along this strip. The Tortilla Espanola was delicious and I did sample a yummilcious bite from a Banging Pocket entree. The cozy decor is inviting. The coffee alone is worthy to make me a continued patron of this place. I'm happy to add this restaurant to a string of Breakfast joint faves within Central Phoenix. Cheers!!!

We walked up to the patio not sure what we were supposed to do, but they had a guy watching out for such visitors and he came over to show us how the restaurant is set up.  So you order at the counter, take a number and they bring the food out to you - kind of like Panera or Paradise Bakery.  We tried the orchard french toast and biscuits and gravy.  Both were solid solid dishes!  At about $10 each, I think the french toast could have used another slice though.  The lemon bar was also very good, though my friend thought it was a bit too tart.  I enjoyed it though, seems like they included pulp which I liked.  The coffee was also delicious - hot not iced.  Yes, I am a fan, though it lost 1 star for portion size.

Seriously, kind of wish I never tried their waffle because it was THAT good! Urgh, now I'll never want one anywhere else! An additional bonus, the bacon was fabulous! Love the atmosphere and how on top of it the staff was! That in itself, is hard to come by!

Amazing food! Quick,  friendly service! Would definitely recommend! We just landed in Phoenix and were starving, searched the highest star restaurant in the area,  this one popped up.  So glad we stopped!

Every time I visit this spot for breakfast I think why do I go anywhere else ever? Great food, which by the way they will make simple modifications on if you avoid wheat in your diet. Great staff. The Barista who works on Sunday, I don't know his name, but he's always part of a fantastic experience there. Great attitude, big smile, and on top of his stuff! One of the best neighborhood breakfast places in Phoenix.

Such a cute little brunch place the Vibe is great, and so is the food, it's also known as a great coffee spot but to my personal opinion I have higher expectations for coffee . Customer service is amazing and food was looking forward going back and trying other items on the menu.

Orchard French toast is the best French toast I've had.  Decadently sweet but not cloying. Even the regular coffee is awesome here.  We're from out town and sampling different local places but we'll be back here tomorrow
Loved the food. A-little more pricey than the regular breakfast but the flavors are definitely worth it. Service was outstanding. Thank you so much for starting Sunday off so well.

Absolutely love this new place on the corner of 7th Avenue & McDowell!  We went with some friends for breakfast yesterday and had a great experience!  Reasonably priced and very fresh food...highly recommend the savory crepes - yummy!  There were at least 4 or 5 other items on the menu that I want to try, so I will definitely be back!

As soon as I arrived for the first time, I was promptly greeted. The ordering process was fast and my food arrived quickly. I had the "Tortilla Espa√±ola" with turkey sausage which surpassed my expectations as a former resident of Spain. The wait staff was very kind and attentive. I ordered the cappuccino also, which was ok...ended up being more foam than cappucino. So, I'll pass and just get the regular coffee next time. Overall great place!
This is for the coffee only, the coffee here although iced and created via a Japanese method, it did not taste smooth and was slightly bitter as compared to other cold brews I have had.

Super quaint little breakfast brunch spot near downtown. Unique concept- order at the counter, then choose your own seat. We had the three sisters omelette, breakfast burrito and waffle - very fresh ingredients- the side of potatoes was amazing too. Very strong coffee as well. Hard to decipher how the system works if it's your first time, but they walk you through it.
In Phoenix on business and yelped for a good breakfast place. Very impressed with the food, quick service and casual atmosphere. If I lived here Vovomeena would be a fav.

Decided to try this place since it was close to where I was staying on vacation. The set up is different from any other place too. Walk in, get handed a menu, get in line, order, wait to be seated. Once we sat down, our food took less then a minute to get to the table. The food was excellent & the staff was very friendly. I would recommend this to everyone who's around the area looking for a quick breakfast/brunch place. Will go back once I head out to AZ again!
The egg benedict is so delicious with distinct cheese on top. Good English muffin too.

Stopped in for breakfast with some girlfriends last Saturday after reading so many great reviews, we were not disappointed! The cold brew was life changing and we all enjoyed our meals. Very cute spot, great to see a small business thriving amongst large chain restaurants. We arrived just before 9am and that was perfect timing, this place fills up! All staff were friendly and helpful and the patio is dog friendly. I will definitely be coming back! :)

Stopped in today for brunch after keeping an eye out for months. Came in with the intention of eating the Mexican eggs Benedict & the pan perdue but went with the special Apple Cinnamon  crepe & the Jenny instead. Food was incredibly delicious, especially the crepe (first time ever trying one but it was sweet & savory & fresh. Only knocking it down a star because those two dishes put me out 34$ with a tip and it wasn't SUPER filling. Nonetheless I will be back for the pan perdue & B&G.

Awesome!  The food is always hot and fresh. I would eat here daily if I could...  Can't wait to explore more items on the menu. I would give 5 stars if it wasn't counter service and if it was easier to get a table.

FREAKING DELICIOUS! 3 Sisters omelette is lil nothing I've had before. A must try. Also the Mexican Benedict with Chorizo on Sopes, aaaaamazing. This kitchen has it down! Plus the lovely manager is extremely personable and all service well timed. Efficient, nicely  designed ambience, for breakfast/lunch, outside or in, easy parking, gorgeous bathrooms with delightfully scented candles and of course incredible food with new flavors that will knock your socks off! A must go, totally awesome. THANKS!
Staff are friendly and they have great costumer  service. Food is great not greasy. The place is clean and has good ambiance. Their waffle and Mexican egg Benedict are my favorite, very tasty.

Portions were small and the prices are pretty high for breakfast meals. The quality and taste are pretty good. Finding parking is a pain in the rear. A good place to take your out-of-town guests, but we will not return just for ourselves.

We were driving across country and wanted to have a great breakfast. We found Vovomeena in Phoenix - a small boutique breakfast cafe. The decor is contemporary and warm - the coffee is fantastic - piping hot and fresh - the food is artisinal and the menu is well conceived.  There are so many delicious sounding items that we agonized over to what to get. My companion settled upon the biscuits and gravy which he found to be spicy and wonderfully herbal and delicious. The person who took my order was kind enough to give me some a la carte items - so I had the waffle with handmade turkey sausage and two lovely poached eggs on a big white plate. Everything was tasty - with the minor exception that my dish was warm and not hot. The host who made a point of talking to all of the guests came by our table and we talked about the temperature of the food - he graciously offered to change it out and I declined. Everyone there was warm and hospitable. The name of the cafe is based on the Portuguese word for grandmother - and the sense of warmth and family and tradition and breakfast is all wonderfully present in this little place.

Me and my friends came here for the first time on Sunday and let me tell you, this place is sooo good! I ordered the Mexican Benedict which had chorizo and a side of potatoes and it was made perfectly. Amy got the savory crepe which she really liked too and that came with a side of greens.   All in all I really enjoyed the restaurant and environment. The staff was extremely friendly too. On a side note, it would be better if they served mimosas!!

Pricey, but good. I had a homemade biscuit along with their homemade strawberry jam, and it was delicious. My husband loved their banana pudding french toast. The service is mediocre and they don't allow substitutions.

I'm writing this review years after the fact. This popped up as a brunch place to try and wouldn't let me rate without writing something so this is what I remember of the experience which is why I never went back.   Saw this place advertised in the Sunday paper and decided to try it out. My boyfriend at the time and I went and the place was packed which is usually a good sign. However, given the size and arrangement of the restaurant it was very uncomfortable waiting on a line that seemed to be a bit all over the place and confusing to some newcomers such as ourselves. We waited on line for several minutes with the hope that the food should be awesome and worth the wait and hassle. I'm not looking at the menu but I think he got the Perdu something or other (one of there best dish items) and I had the biscuits and gravy. We were extremely underwhelmed. His dish was burnt and my dish tasted only like sage only. I would give the place one star after the long wait and the overly hyped food but decided to give it two because I don't remember the place being dirty.

Went here on a Saturday morning based on the reading the reviews here on Yelp. Definitely did not have the same experience as so many others. The restaurant is fine, it's clean, on the smaller side, but nice. I go up to the counter and ask the guy taking the order "which is better: Pancake or Waffle?" and he straight faced told me "They are the same, just a different shape." That right there I should've walked out. I ended up ordering the pancakes with eggs and a side of bacon and an Iced Tea. Sat down, and they brought my order relatively quickly. As soon as I saw the bacon I knew I wasn't going to dig it. Tried the pancakes, they had a weird after taste. Not sure if it was the syrup or what, but I didn't get through half of them. Bacon was limp and not very good, blah. Eggs were probably the only thing I finished. I was about to take off when the manager was making his rounds and asked how everything was and if I liked it. I informed him of what I thought of the food and he was quick to offer a refund or replacement. That right there was the best part of my experience, the managers customer service(only reason it didn't get a one star).   Needless to say I have no desire to go back or recommend the place to co-workers, friends or family.

We were going to eat here for Mother's Day and we got in line because place was pretty full, it was 3 of us and a baby so while in line my mother already knew what she was going to order since I was going to pay after a minute or two in line so we seen an open table so we figured since we had the baby in her car seat and was hard to carry and wait in line she went to go take the table but apparently you can't get a table until after you order but that's wasn't the big deal because she would of moved the waiter (Jeffrey) came to the table and was really rude and loud and told my mom that she had to get out of the table because of there policy on getting tables before you order and also pointing with his fingers like my mom didn't understand what it meant to leave from the table. If the server would of told us in a nice way maybe we would of stayed but when you are waiting  in  a line with  a car seat they should of at least acknowledged that since it's open seating but the server rudely told u its first come first serve. Ended up walking out and also another couple with a kid left too. Ended up going to The Original Breakfast place on 32nd st and got treated way better!

Definitely going back again!  I got the Mexican Benedict which was awesome.  Wanting to try the Pain Perdue next time.  It looked delicious.  My friend had the banging pocket which was also excellent.  Service was okay which is why I didn't give the full 5.  I ordered coffee and a water and they just handed me a mug and didn't instruct me where the coffee or water was.  One of the food runners seemed a little stuck up and annoyed to answer questions.  Overall a good experience though.  It's fast casual so you don't really need to rely on the service as much.

Seems like a great little breakfast hangout. I tried the Piperrada (pork, bell peppers, onions, tomatoes, and eggs). This was a good breakfast - everything was tasty and seemed like good quality ingredients.  I've heard good things about their pancakes, and I'm definitely interested in trying out several other items on the menu, so I can see myself coming back often.
The best breakfast in the city center. I recommend their breakfast sandwich and pancakes, so good. They provide quick service, and the staff is friendly and attentive. Strongly recommended.

Best breakfast place in Phoenix! Good prices and every dish is delicious. The atmosphere really makes it special. They have fresh flowers on the tables and even a candle burning in the neatly decorated restroom. Definitely better than any chain breakfast restaurants around.

Not only is it kinda hard to find seating, but the meat is very low quality.  The chorizo was undercooked and the sausage lacked much flavor.  Not sure how you can screw up bacon, but the bacon was sub-par and without crisp.  Potatoes undercooked to finish off my meal.

First time diner. Lifetime fan!  Have always wanted to try cold coffee but didnt want to over-invest in a whole cup of just one flavor......Enter the cold coffee flight of 3 ...Love Love Love it!  Good selection on the menu and the serving sizes are generous, fresh and flavorful. Nice seating on both patio and indoor space. Go!

Great breakfast, really enjoyed the breakfast potatoes, that are typically a miss for me, and the biscuit was tender and flaky. I am in the area all the time and never realized this little gem was there. Definitely can easily become a new breakfast fav!!!

I had a good experience here. The Mexican Benedict is great! It comes with potatoes. The service was also good. You go in, place the order, pay, get your coffee while the manager gets your table ready, and finally eat. The coffee was also good too.   I wish they had bigger portions here. Or at least a little bit more stuff in the menu to order on the side. Makes it seem like if you want anything more, you just have to get another meal. Overall good place and I will go back.

I had the Savory Crepes, and it was very good. Portion was generous as well.  I went on a Sunday and the wait was not very long.
