Staff was super friendly, and decorations make this place very cozy, good for meeting up with friends! This place was not so loud that you couldn't hear yourself talking.  Also, they have outside sitting that I highly recommend!

Normally this is a 5-star joint. I've had 5-6 wonderful and delicious meals here. But today was different. Today I ordered the sausage... I do not like their sausage. I'm told they get it from Schreiners, who are sausage kings around here. Others may like it. To me it was overpowering and textually displeasing.   I will return (and I'll order the bacon). The other meals I've had have been amazing. The staff is friendly. There is outdoor seating as well.
Food was DELISH!!! Loved being able got kids eat in the patio and our puppy was with us while we were in town visiting from CA. Thank you!!

Great, great, great breakfast place!  The best I have had since moving to AZ.  The owner is from RI (no surprise given the top notch food) and many of the dish names will make you nostalgic for the Ocean State if you ever spent much time there.  Try the cold brew coffee.  It is great!

I was here last week and finally made a yelp account because this place has one of the best customer service that I have seen.   First, my food order was made wrong, so I boxed it to take home (several hundred miles away) and they literally went all out to make it right, but I had to leave to start my journey home. Back home, family enjoyed the chicken fijata pita. So I would say, it would be a good food to take home.   Second, wow, the customer service is amazing. Everyone was super nice and accommodating. I would totally visit here again.  Lastly, this place made my Phoenix trip worth it. I would recommend this place for breakfast and to try out, because they have the most awesome customer service I have seen.   So give it a try and judge for yourself.   Happy breakfasting.

Love this place... Atmosphere is great, very friendly,  but parking is sometimes a little crazy.  Great food, coffee orders are sometimes a little slow,  but those donuts make it all worth it!  Yum, just like the ones I had in Maui.

Good concept and great space.  The menu is small but has some potentially exciting dishes.  Expect to wait in line, as a lot more people are becoming aware of this place and the only have one register to pay at.  Once you have ordered and are seated, don't expect to get your meal right away or even at the same time as other people at your table.  I think once they iron out the kinks it could be a really cool place for brunch and to hangout for coffee.  I am not sure it will be on the list of places to return to any time soon.

My boyfriend and I love this place. It's definitely our #1 choice for breakfast. Service is great and so is the food. The owner always acknowledges us, says it's nice to see us. I get the 3 Sister's and my bf gets the Wilcox Avenue. Also, if you sub a veggie for meat they take a dollar off. Two thumbs up!!!

I've eaten here once; I got their food to go once; and I walked out without eating once. My first visit was odd. I ordered the staff recommended Mexican eggs Benedict. The plate was way overpowered buy the taste of chili. Chili for breakfast is not appealing nor tasty.         For the takeout "I went back to give them a second chance" I ordered scrambled eggs, sausage, and tators. It was good.           Then came my final visit. I arrived on a weekend with four family members including my wife. When we came in my wife sat at a table while I went up to order (it's weird but you order at a counter NO servers here). While I was waiting to order a manager or staff member went over to my wife and told her that she "couldn't squat at tables, that the tables turn over fast and that she could only sit down after ordering". Odd right? My wife got up feeling unconformable, told me what happened and we left.          To be honest their food isn't that good. I just wanted desperately to find a breakfast place to go to regularly. Phoenix is missing good breakfast places.

we went to Phoenix for a show and our son found this place.  Being in the restaurant business myself  I am not so easy to please..... however I found this place so very refreshing with dishes out of the wall. The pricing is right and the food is homy with no pretention to be out of this world. Just VERY good homemade food. My wife asked if she should have the biscuits or whole grain bread. DUH.... the newly fresh baked biscuits were sitting right there in front of her. For those who have all those ideas of what they should do my answer is that those should open their own restaurant and make it better. Easy to talk and critic.... put your money, experience, knowledge and ideas where your mouth is. In my opinion this place is a go. When it come to no changes on your orders....,.. I agree. You are insulting the creator of  the concept. Get a life..... do you ask to split a Mc Donald???? with chipolte sauce???? Mc Do doesn't even know what that is. Congratulation on your concept. Great food and Great coffee. What a way to start the day with a smile.

Me and my husband both really loved our iced coffees!!  Thank you for a great cup of cold brew and a yummy iced mocha, we will be back for sure!! I love the atmosphere and I can tell your passionate about the quality of each individual drink you make.

I normally order the Mexican Benedict and my husband gets the Wilcox Avenue but today we tried to other items! They sure didn't disappoint! I had the biscuits and gravy w/scrambled eggs & my husband ordered the pain Perdu. We wanted something sweet and salty so perfect pair to share. The gravy is simply perfect - full of flavor, bits of meat in it and not overly salty. The Perdu had a subtle sweetness compared to French toast (my next item to try). Needless to say we finished both plates!
One word, wow. Amazing food. Pork chop and waffles is a great twist to waffles. Can't see anyone not like this meal for breakfast, lunch or brunch.
Great little breakfast place in Arizona, checked it out when i was there for the Cubs Spring Training.

Out here in Arizona and found this gem of a place! Great ambiance, great breakfast! Great if you are short on time. Definitely recommend to out of towners looking for a good breakfast place with quick and polite service.
The B.M.O.C  with large pork chops was grilled to perfection. Really like the charbroiled taste.  I will definitely come back to try some of the other items on the menu. It's sort of a 70" s theme.

we gave this hip phx spot for breakfast yesterday i had the piperrada satueed vegies with pork shoulder and two eggs i asked for my eggs poached med. unfortunitly they were as hard as rocks the pork was a little dry for my taste my wife had banging pocket which she enjoyed and i tasted as well i thought it was quite tasty service was good and polite the clientele was a young urban mix ...how did i get so old???

I love the blending of savory and sweet things so I decided to order their B.M.O.C. It's an apple maple syrup topped waffle that comes with a  smoked pork chop ,  2 eggs any style (scramble this time since I was eating with my 1 year old) and a bonus Portuguese doughnut. I really liked how they smoked the pork chop, it was juicy almost like a ham, but not nearly as salty which I prefer. Normally I always get sunny side up/over easy since I love the ooey gooeyness of the egg yolk, but their scramble didn't disappoint. It was light and fluffy and not over cooked at all :). The doughnut was a little too sweet and oily for my liking and by the time I got to it I was already pretty full from the rest of the meal. Also one note, the place starts getting busy around 10:30 on Saturdays, we got there at 9:30 this time and no waits at all.

Absolutely delicious food and coffee. Highly recommend the johnnycakes and add on the donut. You probably won't eat for the rest of the day, but it is worth it. Limited seating. Outdoor patio is cozy. Coffee flight is fun and unique.

It was a warm after thanksgiving Friday. I was one of the lone people at the office, my hunger grew and at each attempt for food I was foiled as many places were closed for the day. However I lucked out and found this place. Cute little brunch ish spot.  Most of the menu said "your choice of meat" so that meant for me as a veg look elsewhere until I found the roasted veggie and egg burrito (to go only) for ~5.50   I raced back to my desk and tore open the bag. It smelled great maybe beacuse it was also close to 1:30pm and I was starving, but it was a bit small, the tortilla was a bit too soft and moist for my liking the eggs were well cooked as were the veggies the cheese added a bit too much grease for my liking.  The included salsa was unique as it was hot more like a chunky tomato soup.  If you are not veg maybe you will find a few more options than I.
This place is a gem close to downtown Phoenix. Saw the stars and reviews and had to check it out. It was awesome. If you want am incredible breakfast or brunch this is the place.

Food was average. Wifes omelet had a distinct flour or corn meal taste. The biscuits are dry and hard. Manager was not very responsive when asked about the funny tasting omlet. Better places for breakfast if you are looking for food quality.

Awesome breakfast. Every time we go the breakfast I get something different and iris delicious. The biscuits and gravy are awesome. I had the bmoc which was awesome as well. My wife loves French toast and the pain perdu hits the spot. You really need the banana though cause otherwise it's too rich. The food is awesome but the coffee is a lil much. They really sell the cold brew but I wish they upped their game for all coffee.

Yum! the waffles and pancakes are the bomb.  Great food and coffee.   I would say what really impresses me if the staff.  They are always very courteous and welcoming.  I won't go back to a place that has good food but the staff sucks so the spirit of this joint is refreshing.    Good job Vovomeena.
The breakfast crepes are amazing! Same with the cold brew. It is possibly the best coffee I've tasted in my life (try it with Irish cream). Overall really great place.
Fast paced service for how busy it was. Food was delicious and coffee great as always. It's not a huge place but it has a good lay out and overall style.

I had heard that this was a great breakfast spot and it did not disappoint. We went on a Friday morning and it wasn't busy at all and was easy to get a nice table outside for our entire group. You order at the counter and they then deliver your food to you. I had the biscuits and gravy and they were delicious. The biscuits were not my favorite, but they were good, and the gravy was wonderful! I also tried their Japanese Cold Brewed coffee which was very different, but really good. I will definitely be going back!
Loved my vanilla latte, and my husband and I  both loved everything we had for breakfast.  Small, unique spot with outdoor seating as well.  We'll be back!
Friendly staff and amazing food! I always leave here with a smile and a stuffed belly.

Breakfast with a friend is what brought me here. After the first experience let's say there will be many more dining visits. My breakfast was AMAZING.   The hidden gem has the cutest decor and layout. You can walk in through the patio or the front door that leads to a tiny coffee shop setup. I'm not a BIG coffee drinker but my friend is. He loves the variety of fresh coffee they offer.   In a fast pace moving line I ended up ordering the Portuguese Pancakes, passed on the meat and had the breakfast potatoes. They are called something else but they are potatoes. I will put it to you like this I am a pancake person. It is one food I could eat daily. Vovomeena has the best pancakes I have ever had in my life. I repeat BEST! I don't know what is in them but the flavor is so amazing I eat them without syrup and butter. My potatoes were good too but the is one problem. A good problem every time I eat here I order pancakes and fill up on them so I miss the opportunity to try anything else.   I could go on about the pancakes forever but I have to not fail to forget there service is top notch. This Resturant is all about customer service. Every person who works there you can tell they enjoy their job.   It is worth the travel I highly recommend stopping in and of course getting the pancakes. lol!

Came for breakfast while in Phoenix for work.  Like many others, I recommend the Mexican Benedict (add hot sauce to taste) along with the Cold Brew coffee. It's a casual spot with a pretty extensive breakfast menu.  Come hungry.  Oh and you order at the counter!

If you go to Vovomeena, go for the coffee. They have an amazing cold drip system that produces a wonderful iced coffee, and you can tell that the owners take a lot of pride in it. The food is interesting, but ask questions about what you're ordering. The menu descriptions are brief and you may be surprised at what you are actually served.

My girlfriend and I Love Vovomeena. Despite a very casual ordering process, the coffee and food are always impressive!   Very hipster decor but it doesn't take away from the relaxed, breakfast/brunch vibes.   We get Johnnycakes almost every time we eat here. One of my favorite and most unique breakfasts in Phoenix. I could eat this every day. The warm rice pudding on the side is a nice touch. Always enjoy the japanese cold brew but the regular brewed and espresso drinks have also been great. The menu and space is small but there is nothing to not love about this place.

What can I say? The food was delicious. The service is friendly and efficient. The atmosphere is comfortable, positive, and relaxed.  It is a little on the pricey side with most of the entrees in the $12.00 range for breakfast.  With that being said, the biscuits and gravy is to die for!    The food is always fresh, full of flavor, complemented by a cozy environment.

The best part of my omelet and potatoes was the potatoes, and they weren't good. Was advertised as omelet with black beans, zucchini, et al. I didnt see more than 15 black beans maybe a flake of a zucchini rind. Wont be back. Omelet w cheese and 12 homefries. 10$
Vovomeena has some of my favorite food and coffee in all of Phoenix! The best service! The business makes for a fun brunch!

The main reason why I wanted to try this place was for the reviews... and I expected so much more.  It was a Saturday when I went around 10 am and the line was ridiculously long. This is a self serve place, you have to wait in line to order food, then you have to look for a place to sit (very uncomfortable when the place is full, and its tiny too! ), you get your own coffee and refills. The food was not so great, and lacked a lot of seasoning and flavor. The main thing that bothered me was the lack of accommodation of substitutes for their menu. I eat egg whites, and when I was asked how I wanted my eggs cooked, I said egg whites. The guy gave me this frustrated look and weird stare, and told me with attitude " No, you can't get egg whites, we don't do egg whites"  Oh, and they also don't do any sides, you want pancakes? be prepared to pay over $10 for another meal.  Rude customer service, poor food choices/accommodations, and terrible coffee. I've had better breakfast and better experience else where and better tasting coffee too. I will not be returning here, not a fan of overpriced self serve places.

This place was really cute. The only thing I didn't like is that it was not handicap accessible. We literally bumped in to everything but I understand the place is small. The food was good. We ordered the 3 sisters omelette and the Johnny cakes. Johnny cakes tasted like cornbread and it was pretty good all around except for the rice. Not much of a horchata person and that's what it reminded me of. The omelette was perfect, no complaints there. Coffee was great! There was a cute coffee bar inside. Had little jars with sugar cubes, loved it. It almost made me add one to my coffee and I don't even put sugar in my coffee! I will recommend this place. Thanks again.

I landed in Phoenix at 6am, and we were looking for something near downtown.....  We found this place and it was AMAZING!!!  I agree with some of the other reviewers that the lack of servers is strange at first, but it totally works out.    I had a hard time with the menu because everything looked so good.  I ended up with one of the egg options and a delicious buttermilk biscuit.  My wife got the Challah French Toast with apples.  Both were excellent and reasonably priced.  We will visit again for sure.    Lastly, the owner/ manager bussed our table, asked us how the food was, and thanked us for coming in.  This really topped off our breakfast nicely.
Yummy biscuits and gravy at a reasonable price. Clean and cozy atmosphere and super friendly staff.

I took some friends from out of town here and overall it was a good experience. They forgot eggs in my egg burrito but everyone else seemed to enjoy their food! Good quality and the price is what you'd expect for nearby downtown restaurant. The place is small but has a wonderful outdoor patio option and the menu doesn't have too much to chose from but the options they do offer are pretty delish! Cute little coffee station you can pick up your coffee from. I had the espresso.. the coffee quality was ok. A bit sour for my taste but overall not bad.
I love their brunch and their coffee. The food is very unique and it never disappoints. The ambience is "Downtown Phoenix cool."  The place isn't very big but they have a nice sitting area outside.

We love this place, and go there at least once a week, sometimes twice. It helps that we live walking distance away. Fantastic selection of very interesting and well done breakfast dishes, and wonderful Japanese style cold brewed iced coffee.   They have a dog friendly patio around the back, where the waitstaff bring our dogs water in dog bowls without even asking for it.   Even more impressive is the service. We were there today (Sunday) and the place was very busy. My wife ordered her favorite, apple and potato boxty. Some time after we ordered, but before we got served, they ran out of boxty. Kai, the manager, came over and offered her anything else on the menu. And then he did something I had only heard about from my parents, about how fine restaurants used to be run. He comped BOTH our meals in apology for running out of my wife's favorite. I thought this kind of service had gone the way of the dodo. I was blown away.
Have to try this place out. Is refreshing to find authentic dishes and a cool place to hang out. The service is really good, and you'll want to try every dish on the menu. Coffee is superb as well.

Love the atmosphere and location, small and cozy and the staff is extremely friendly. Awarded best in Phoenix for a reason! DO RECOMMEND FOR ANYBODY! Prices are excellent and the food quality is high and reminds me of home! Love this definitely coming back as much as I can.

If you like breakfast food, now let's be real-- breakfast is the best, Vovomeena is the place to have breakfast/brunch. They also serve one of the best coffee in the valley. They get it from a roastery in Cave Creek, AZ called ROC2. They have pancakes, eggs, bacon/sausage, Portuguese donut, daily fresh desserts, spuds... List goes on and on. They are simply amazing. Give it a try and you will fall in love. Guaranteed. Oh they also have a really friendly staff. All in all, nothing but best...

My partner and I have been to Vovomeena three times, and everytime it was great. Full disclosure, though, the second time we went we only got the iced coffee as their kitchen had run out of food! (This was around 12:30 on a Sunday; absolutely forgivable for a restaurant who just opened and is working out the kinks, and if that's the worst thing that will happen when we visit then that's a pretty great sign.)  The space is absolutely gorgeous. You forget that you're in the midst of a glut of chain restaurants and it definitely rivals the Tuck Shop for ambiance. It's wonderful that they're both different yet obviously part of the same family. Another thing those two spots have in common? Gorgeous, uni-sex restrooms. It's a small touch, but it always make a restaurant feel more like home when the washroom is nice and I always appreciate non-gendered restrooms.   Another plus is the counter service; it makes things a little quicker and is smart for the lunch concept. The service itself has been gracious, from the barista to the counterperson to the kitchen staff to the busers, with a special mention to the manager, who has been sincere and nice. This level of service is impressive for a new restaurant. (Stark contrast to the Chipotle 20 feet away, where the staff still acts like it's the first opening day and runs around like chickens with their heads cut off, but that's a whole other review!)  Lastly, the food is fantastic. I had the B.M.O.C. the first time to quench my enormous weekend appetite and the pork chop was remarkable. The waffle got a little lost, but I tried the waffle on its own the last time I was there and I think I'll just get that from now it, as it's really fantastic all by itself. Other items tried and approved, the tortilla espanola and the johnnycakes were really great. (The rice that comes with the johnnycakes was a fantastic complement to the johnnycakes, please don't get rid of it like another review suggests!) The prices are fair, I think ordering a la carte might be the most economical option if I end up going here as often as I want to. Also, the food comes up a little slowly but it's nothing unusual for brunch.  My only critique, although I'm not taking off a star: please get real maple syrup! I saw some fake syrup being walked into the kitchen one day, and the syrup that came with the waffle seemed overly sweet, so I'm guessing that the real stuff isn't being served. I could be wrong, though, as I'm not maple syrup expert, just an enthusiast. All the other ingredients seem top notch, though (thanks for locally sourcing the meat, so this former vegetarian can eat it without much guilt!)

Doesn't quite crack the 'exquisite' barrier for me, but they've got it figured out. It's super tasty and manages to have a unique flavor. I had the weekday egg and veggie burrito with their chunky mild red sauce on the side. I'd eat here again, for sure.
Fabulous European style place! Innovative menu.... Loved it, and can't wait to go back....

This is another Phoenix jewel for breakfast. I love this place. It's cozy and comfortable. Their food selection is gourmet-ish. For example, their french toast is very custardy and is made with Challah bread. Very few places will use expensive Challah bread for french toast even though it's the best way to make it. They also use honey marcapone and grated apples in their french toast. Amazing! My mouth waters just thinking about it. Definitely recommend it.
Loved this place.   Delicious food.  The set up was unique.   Great find during my trip

Incredible. Top two are the Mexican chorizo sope eggs Benedict with a side of arugula and also the biscuits and gravy with schedulers sausage and side of potatoes. I brunch a lot and this is the best breakfast I've ever had in Phx. #native

This restaurant is my favorite for french toast days.  They have an Orchard French Toast that has fresh slivers of green apple and a sauce you could die for.  Delicious!  But don't go on Sundays cause that's when I am there and I need the table.
Exceptional food and service.  The Johnnycake's we're amongst the best I have ever had.  Get the sausage!

Got my family addicted to this place. It's the only place they want to brunch.  Happiness is a cold brew.  I love their cardamom flavored one,  they have plain and other flavors too every day.  I've had their whole menu and I love everything.
How is this place so highly rated. I could barely finish what I ordered. The eggs are inedible and everything else was incredibly salty. Maybe I just ordered the wrong thing?

OMG I love this place . I could eat just about anything off the menu and be happy. (Just about, because I don't eat beef, but seriously anything else) The food is just damn good. Absolutely one of my favourite breakfast places in CenPho and every single trip here has been a wonderful experience. They have enough cold brew here to fuel a zombie army for ever with those massive yama towers in the background. The coffee is fresh and strong and the barista is very friendly and helpful.  The decor is definitely worth taking a picture or two, the place is spotlessly clean every single time and  the portion sizes are generous. Definitely will come back for more !

I had been wanting to come here for awhile so I'm glad we made the 30 minute drive to come! Everyone was so friendly. all of the staff came up to us and made sure we were good and had everything we needed. The iced coffee was really great! I ordered the BMOC and my bf got the banging pocket. They were both really delicious. I would order either of them again. The atmosphere was comfortable, modern, and clean. One thing I did not expect was that it was counter service. We will be back!

My friends and I needed to find a good restaurant on our way to Phoenix Comic Fest in May 2018. We decided to try this place, and we were amazed by the fresh food and excellent staff. We would recommend the pancakes and biscuits and gravy. Although, we were even impressed by the toast and jam with eggs, and the chorizo was just perfect. The coffee is the best we have tasted, and we ended up returning for breakfast for the following day of the fest. Next time I visit, I will bring my family and friends. I cannot wait to try other items on the menu. I highly recommend this restaurant.
Food and atmosphere was very good, Kaj the manager made us feel very welcome and my wife and I will definitely be coming back!

Charming atmosphere and amazingly friendly staff!  By Far my favorite breakfast potatoes in Phoenix!  Not to mention, for a Midwestern girl from St Louis, Gooey Butter Cake!  The Japanese cold brew coffee is sooooo good!

It was hard to go back to Starbucks on Monday morning after drinking the Japanese cold brew here. I got the flight o' 3 and all of them were smooth and complex and resulted in a nice pleasantly sustained caffeine buzz. My wife got the Blackstone scramble and I got the Mexican Benedict, both were amazing, and the kids loved the pancakes and waffles. It was a little pricey for breakfast($70ish with tip for 2adults/2kids), but the food was definitely worth the price. Great spot to spend a leisurely Sunday morning with family. We will be back.
Decent.  Not expensive. Busy. Pretty standard brunch.  Little things hold it back. Biscuit tough. Entrees lacking depth or sides.
Pricey, but great food, customer service is a bit cold and uninterested but otherwise just fine.

This spot got our morning off to a GREAT start! You grab a menu and look at it while in line, but the options are so many you won't know when you get to the register. Thanks to all of the great yelp photos, the winner of my "tournament of decision" was the Mexican Benedict.  From there, I was able to step to the side to order an iced mocha before sitting down wherever we wanted. I think this is a great wrinkle because the food comes out quick and seats for most in line are available, like clock work. NO one was standing around waiting for a seat even though the line was to the door when w got there.  The Mexican Benedict was amazing, with a spicy chorizo along with the usual. I found myself savoring every bite, and the flavor was consistent.   The manager was warm and informative to everyone eating, and we felt so enjoyable while we ate good food. Such a smooth and pleasant time before the day had turned epic.   This is a great place to fuel up with good quality food and brunch energy!   Well done, Phoenix!!

Here's the deal.  The food sounds special but it really isn't, and normally that would doom a place to me.  But... I keep coming back.  Why?  Because I don't come here to eat amazing food.  I come here to hang out in a casually stylish environment with good music and truly good coffee in a dedicated daytime establishment.  VVM definitely owns its slice of the restaurant ocean by sticking to a simple and stylish formula.
Went today for brunch and enjoyed the Mexican Benedict and Bread Pudding.

Went here for brunh a few weeks ago and I've been contemplating on going back sometime soon! The food is delicious, I had the tortilla espanol. Not sure why they call it tortilla since it doesn't have any but either way, it was great. Perfect meal size for brunch. Nice music selectionn! Like I said before, I can't wait to go back!

Me and my alleged better half met some of her friends here for brunch.  I was skeptical walking in as it looked like a very basic coffee shop but I guess I should never get tired of being wrong.  I had a scramble with pork shoulder and it was delicious.  The lady had an omelette that was tasty.  And how can I turn down a donut in any form?  I had the Portuguese donut which was like a beignet and just as awesome.  The staff was really friendly.  However, just be careful if you come during a busy hour, table space is limited.  And don't be that guy who comes in and plops down at a table before ordering.  They have rules about that.

I live in the neighborhood and I have heard wonderful things about this restaurant. I got up early one morning and decided to go down and try their cold brew. The restaurant opens at 6:30 and I arrive at 6:25 with the doors unlocked. I peaked my head in and asked if they were open. I told, who looked like the owner, I just wanted to grab a cup of coffee. The server snottily replied that they weren't and I need to come back after they opened. I thought five minutes was strange but I went back out to my car. Just as I do that I see three people walk in and get seated for breakfast. So strange.  I have heard the world about their  cold brew and had to try it. The wait staff was so cold even after I told them this was my first time there and to tell me about their coffee selections and menu. I, myself, am a culinary school graduate and a past restaurant owner. Customer service is everything. I ended up settling on a six dollar cup of the worst cold brew I've ever had. It was so bad that I told the man waiting on me that the coffee tasted strange, asked for a different kind and to hold the sweetener. I then walked over to the coffee bar to add my own sugar when I look down and see the entire table covered with ants. They did promptly clean up the table. The cold brew was absolutely disgusting, the customer service was even worse and I won't be going back to try breakfast. So sad.

I have never been disappointed while eating here. Every time is a pleasant experience. Yeah, some times when it's busy I can see a little bit of delay with the food but nothing overwhelming. Staff is always helpful and super friendly. And will be happy to add that it is REALLY clean. Big fan of this place and I recommend it to anyone looking for good breakfast with a twist.

Good, but almost too hip for this self proclaimed foodie. Two over medium eggs, sausage, potatoes, toast. It's breakfast, not art. Fifteen minutes to get to me and being picky, no run to the yolks. Not killed, just not perfect. No subs, out there indie music, order and sit. Food was good; it's me vovomeena, not you.
This is my new favorite breakfast place. The food is creative and very high quality. I've had the breakfast sandwich and the sausage pita and loved them both. The place also has a cool vibe.

My husband and I were looking for a cool place to have brunch! And we found this small hip place! Its a gem! The food and coffee were great! The portion was very generous!   -the drinks should be serve first before the food though- just a thought

How about Vovo ya-dont-mean-it  or My best guess at how Vovo used to cook but that was a long time ago and I don't remember!  I'll tell you what, the name implies Portuguese food but having grown up on it, this is the farthest thing from it and a huge disappointment!   Obviously the people who have given it a high rating have never experienced a GREAT Portuguese breakfast and have been fooled into thinking a luke warm grease drenched not fully cooked lump of batter is a donut or treat in the traditional style of cooking..... NOT!!!  I asked the server if they have Lingui√ßa which is a traditional Portuguese sausage and he said he thought they had it once but no..... I'm not sure he knew what I was talking about. ..... Vovo-no-idea!   We all commented on one common denominator of each of our pretty tasteless orders....... The eggs!!!   Real or Powdered (reconstituted) ..... either way, just not very good.  I ordered Blackstone Scramble.  I expected what I read, "Pork Shoulder" and seriously folks, it paled in comparison to a Denny's Denver omelet..... it was a very strange thin finely chopped ham colored meat.... very odd.  I do not see this restaurant lasting.......  This is Phoenix and what we have come to know about eating out there is that, "If it is going to make it, it has to be consistently good"  There are sooo many restaurants there and sooo much competition amongst them that this place is not going to last.  The seating is horrible not to mention Stupid.....  I get the first come first serve thing but we were told to just hold on and not get excited because we would get a great seat...... It never happened and we were three people assigned to a two person table that we couldn't get all the plates on and on the patio between two doors causing us to be brushed up against by every server and patron........    The inside has a neat trendy look and feel but I need more than that in order to appreciate it as an actual eating establishment.  Oh, the coffee was good...... I'll up it a star!  Forgettable!
Food was out quick but somehow 5 minutes into eating me and my friend who both ordered different dishes started to feel sick...dont know what it was but it tasted good while it lasted.

It's been over a year since my last rating, and we still come here 1-2x a week.. sometimes more, and sometimes we stop in just for a coffee to go. :)   If the cold brew float is available, be sure to try it.  The combination of cold brew and gelato is incredible.    I still love the Banging Pocket.. also during the weekdays they have an amazing pita they call the Palmcroft which is scrambled eggs, gouda, turkey and bacon.  The tortilla espanola is so good and one of my favorite comfort foods.    We eat mostly gluten free now (my better half has to for his health) and it's very easy to do here.  Skip the pita or toast and there's easily over a half dozen things on the menu you can have.    Great food, great staff - this is our favorite breakfast place!

Fun little spot for breakfast or brunch with some inventive twists on the typical brunch fare. Had the bangers and eggs which was tasty and filling. The savory crepes which my friend had will be next on my list. Stand in line to order and then seat yourself format is ideal for when everybody can't make up their mind at the same time. It was on the noisy side inside at 10 am on Sunday so we ate outside which was lovely. All in all a fun and relaxing brunch date with friends. Definitely recommend.
This place was pretty good. I got the Savory crepes they were really good except they came with some weird red sauce. Didn't ruin the meal but if I ordered again I would request that not to be on it

This has become one of my favorite local spots for brunch. Nothing on their menu has ever disappointed me! One must definitely try the Mexican benedict and the BMOC. The service is great and the staff is always super nice. Sometimes the place can get crowded and it's kind of small, but nonetheless this place is worth trying.

Absolutely delicious breakfast food, wide variety of food and beverages. I had the apple French toast with bacon which I couldn't have liked more.  The coffee and lattes were standard, not bad but not amazing.  The ambiance is nice, it is a unique trendy place

I really hate to write this but the Mexican benedict meal made me sick... really sick.  First, the pros:  - Clean setting. - Great vibe. - Lots of people. - Friendly staff. - Great looking pics on Yelp.  Based on all the pics on Yelp, I decided to order the Mexican benedict. The chorizo sold me. When it arrived, I started to indulge in the dish and thought to myself that, "this isn't as good as I was hoping." No big deal... I still liked the place and the vibe. The reviews were good and when I'm back in the area, I'll try something else. I'm not one to want to waste food so I finished my plate and started to go about my day. Again, no big deal.    As soon as I got into the parking lot, I started to feel weird. Maybe a little gassy... that happens, right? I just burped it along as my buddy and I were headed to play a round of golf. I'm still a little gassy on the first hole (not even an hour after eating). Then it hits me on the third hole. Not to be too graphic, but it was coming out of both ends and all I can taste coming up was the chorizo.  It's been a few days and my tummy is still a little unsettling from this meal.  I'm not writing this to tell you not to go there because clearly people have enjoyed their experiences but I will be very hard pressed to give this place another shot.

We honestly stumbled upon Vovomeena after a stop at another business down the block.  We turned up the alley and saw Vovomeena.  After a quick Yelp check, we decided to have breakfast.  Am I glad we did! We hate chain restaurants and this is any thing but!  We ordered the BMOC.. smoked pork chop over a waffle....Awesome! The other offerings are different and we look forward to returning. They also have a parking lot ..a plus.  It became ridiculously crowded at noon.  I recommend coming before that to avoid that problem.
Best breakfast ever! My husband and I only come here for breakfast. Everything is amazing especially the iced coffee! That is something special, it takes a week to brew one pot of it. Simply amazing!

A trendy little coffee and brunch spot!  Good coffee in a cute little cafe setting.   Friendly staff. Jeff was super friendly and had a good sense of humor...  Plan on $10-$13 per person for food and $3-5 for your coffee.  The classic breakfast sandwich was really tasty! Good hot coffee Tasty iced coffee too!  Parking is tricky and you will get towed for parking at nearby businesses.

I had the Pain Perdu.  It's a banana bread pudding French toast with whiskey Carmel sauce. My son had biscuits and gravy. I also added eggs and coffee to this and we came out at right around $20. This had to have been one of the best breakfasts I have ever had. Love the option of outdoor seating.

This is definitely a cool brunch spot. Very much worth a visit.  Quick and easy. Order at the register, take your number, grab a seat, and they'll bring your food to you.  I got the biscuits and gravy which were AMAZING. The gravy is seriously to die for. I could have their biscuits and gravy everyday! I had left overs and purposely saved it for the following morning just to savor the gravy. Yes. It. Is. Divine.  My cousin got the waffle with sausage and eggs. The waffle was also delicious!! She's also in loooove with their Japenese coffee!  As for the rest of the menu, there wasn't that much more that was screaming out to me. I knew biscuits and gravy was the right option, and it did not disappoint. We'll probably be back..... just for the biscuits and gravy. Lol

My first time here, and definitely not my last! I ordered the Pain Perdu (bread pudding French toast) and sausage link and they were delicious. This dish is very sweet and more like a dessert than a breakfast, but nonetheless great. Nice ambiance, friendly staff, and a well oiled machine with their effective operation (food order/seating/cleanup).

It was my first time at Vovomeena yesterday for lunch and I must say that I will never come back again due to lack of customer service.  I was sitting outside enjoying my lunch, catching up with one of my girlfriends when the waiter came and took away the patio umbrellas and rudely stated that they were closing early because they ran out of ingredients. It was only 1 pm when this occurred, and the restaurant is usually closed at 2:30 pm on Sundays.   If your restaurant states that it is open for business until 2:30 pm, please do not kick out your customers who have already ordered, paid, and are in the middle of enjoying their meal before closing time..

Good experience at Vovomeena. Hubby had johnnycakes - bacon and sweet rice get 5 stars. Prickly pear syrup was too sweet. I had the special which the kind host made gluten free and switched out the cheese to something not so spicy. It was delicious. The staff was very friendly and gracious. We are looking forward to returning. Vovomeena is the closest thing we have experienced to Marche (for our Nashville friends).

Dropped by Vovomeena on a weekday to grab some delicious brunch fixings with a friend. Parking was pretty easy and we were able to get in and order right away which was great! You put in your order at the counter, walk over to the coffee bar if you got a coffee drink, and then sit down with your number and wait for your food to come out.   I was in a super french toast mood so I went with the orchard french toast and of course got a side of the spuds. I also grabbed a japanese cold brew because come on, you can't pass up on coffee. Now in terms of the food, the french toast was deeelicious. Sweet without being too overwhelming and definitely a good portion for the price. Man the spuds were so good, they almost overshadowed the main dish! They were really well seasoned and tasted great by themselves and with hot sauce! The japanese cold brew didn't really meet my expectations, but I'll probably try out a different coffee drink when I'm there next time.   Service was great and the food was delicious so I can definitely see myself dropping by again!

I ordered the Mexican Benedict and my friend ordered the Breakfast Sandwich, and both of them were amazing!!! The Mexican Benedict is definitely my favorite. This is a great spot for breakfast/brunch!!!

This place was great! Great atmosphere, food was exceptional and staff was super friendly! Also easy to get to. I got Mexican Benedict and if you like chorizo it is amazing. Spicy, but amazing. My friend got the corn and chile cakes which are like cornbread pancakes and they were equally amazing! 10/10 would recommend

Tried this place for breakfast over the weekend and it's definitely not what I expected for a breakfast spot. You order from a selected menu and pay up front; then, they give you a number and you wait at your table. Their coffee is awesome and the staff is super friendly, but I wasn't too keen with having a selected menu. Reading "No Substitutes Please" at the top of the menu didn't help either. The food is okay but nothing blew me away or would make me want to come back.
Breakfast is delish! So awesome, it's really hard to find parking. The first time my kids and I went, line was out the door, but was worth the wait.

Me and my bf have been wanting to try this place for a while because we've seen other Yelpers' reviews and pictures. First off, for first timers, vovomeena is one of those places where you stand in line and order first then get to find a table, which I don't mind, unless there are no tables available by the time you order. We ended up sitting outside. The food came out pretty quickly; I ordered the Mexican Benedict and my bf ordered the Banging Pocket. My food looked good at first glance, until I noticed a puddle of grease under the eggs. Since it was a variation of a traditional Benedict, it came on sopes instead of English muffins, which was not my cup of tea. The Banging Pocket was described to me as cheesy eggs and sausage in a pita.  It was very one-note and just needed something... The food was nothing to rave about and definitely nothing to come back for. We decided that this was one of the few times Yelp ratings and reviews let us down :(

While visiting Phoenix I saw that this place had 4 and a half stars on yelp With 400+ reviews so you know I had to check it out!    All I can say is WOW!  This place rocked, I came with 2 buddies and we all cleared our plates.  I ordered tortilla espanola, one of my buddies ordered the Mexican Benedict, and my other buddy got pain perdu which looked like a brownie with bananas and caramel!    It's an interesting setup, you order at the counter then take a number to your table, the staff was very attentive to us and made sure we had everything we needed (hot sauce).  It's right next to 5 guys off 7th, took a lap around the block to find but WELL WORTH IT!

WOW!! Honestly one of the best cafe-type places i've ever been. The staff is super friendly, the food is great, and the sweet tea is AMAZING. Make sure you try the potatoes and mango iced tea. I was on vacation from Minnesota and we went here for breakfast every single day (4 days in a row). The manager even noticed we were frequent customers and wrote us a coupon for 1/2 off our next meals. I wish I could bring this restaurant back home with me!! If I could rate over 5 stars I would.

This is a solid breakfast joint for sure. The Johnny cakes were delicious, highly recommend it. They are corn based with bits of fresh corn with a hint of chili. They aren't spicy and have a really great complex flavor. We also ordered the waffle with eggs and a bacon. All were solid. You order at the register, take a number, and seat yourself.
Love Vovo. Food and Coffee are great. Cant really go wrong here.

A nice experience. It was fun to watch the cooks while you stage to order. The online menu is a little hard to see but the mystery drew us in. Fresh, filling and flavorful. Pet friendly patio. If you feel they are too busy - put your brakes on and find your patience button. It is worth it!!! Tip: Some people ask questions when they order and that can cause a brief delay.  You'll have the same space and time.

We went for breakfast on Sunday morning, and managed to beat the rush. The decor is fun, albeit totally hipster. There's a great little patio which you'll totally find me on, once the weather isn't so damn miserable. The menu is small, but mighty, and there are oodles of things we want to go back to try.   Now, I realise that I'm one of the few less-than-four-star reviews, but I have good reason! I would have given this place 5 stars, had it not been for two things that made me knock off a couple stars.   But first, let me start with the really good stuff: the food. In general. We got the Johnnycakes and the Mexican Benedict to share. The star was the johnnycakes. They sounded interesting, but neither of us were prepared for the incredible flavours. The cakes themselves are actually pretty savory, with whole kernels of corn, and green chilis. They've got texture, and a little bit of a kick, and by themselves are so good. Pair them with arroz con leche, strawberries, and syrup, and you've got a flavour combination that is enough to wake up any pallette! I made sure to get some of the cake (with syrup), some of the arroz con leche, and a strawberry on to my fork... wow. Just wow. Green chilis and maple syrup are not a combination I would have imagined being tasty, but damn! The savory with the sweet was just the right balance. And the bacon it came with was thick-cut and damn good.   The Mexican Benedict was pretty great, too. The chorizo was the real deal! But, here's where I took off a star... the eggs were overcooked. You can't have eggs benedict with overcooked eggs. The yolks weren't runny, which is the best part! Solid yolks were a total disappointment. I had to take a star off. I was so looking forward to runny yolks, mixed in with the chorizo. The potatoes also contributed to my removing a star or two... they were just blah. Nothing special. Not a lot of flavour. Compared to the flavour of the johnnycakes and the chorizo, I expected something a little more interesting, even if they are "just potatoes". Not a lot of seasoning, and I think they may have been cooked with onions, only one small sliver of onion made it on to my plate with the potatoes. Boo.   The other reason I took off a star: the coffee. They're all about their Japanese cold brew stuff. My lady friend LOVES cold brew coffee, and ordered a coffee float, with vanilla bean gelato. Mind you, the cold brew was one of the main reasons we went there. Sadly, her coffee was so bitter it was practically undrinkable. I'm not a fan of coffee, but even I could tell it was way more bitter than it should have been, when I tasted it. So that was extremely disappointing.   We'll be back, and I may give the benedict another go, but this time if the eggs are overcooked, I'll be sending it back. Yes, I'll be that dude. Same with the coffee. I'd love to see them do something to amp up the eggs, especially since the rest of their food has so much going for it. It's sad to see the potatoes fall flat. We are excited to try the other things on the menu... it's just a shame that the things we were most looking forward to fell kind of flat.   But those johhnycakes though!!!
Try the banging pocket with extra Gouda per recommendation of one of the waiters. Good ambient and friendly staffs.

Based on the reviews I was expecting A LOT more. We ordered the Mexican Benedict and the pork shoulder with eggs and tortilla.  I ate the Mexican Benedict, it was good. I prefer my Benedict to be a little more flavorful and to have more hollandaise.   If we make it back here we will have to try the bread pudding French toast... it sounds delicious.

I use to live in Downtown and loved going to Vovomeena,  Now I reside in Laveen, Arizona There is no place like Vovomeena down here. Vovomeena is just EXCELLENT! Love the Willcox Ave. Hopefully Vovomeena will open more locations throughout the valley.

Little charming caf√©.  The staff is super busy and so you might feel a little hustled as diners stare at you and your table in envy.  The menu is straight forward and contains quality ingredients.  What would have pushed it over to 4 star territory would have been some extra spice or kick.  You could tell that the ingredients were great, the coffee made with care, the jam home made even, but the flavors were missing salt?  A little punch? Even a dish that is supposed to contain some spicy flavors (in the form of an excellent roasted fire salsa on the side) was decidedly okay.  So good if you are in the neighborhood, fun for out of towners who might be picky eaters, but selfishly, it was breakfast that I could have cobbled together had I not been quite as slow moving this morning.

I have a thing for home grown , locally owned ..anything. I think it is important to support the community and its efforts, with that being said.. The third time isn't a charm.  First time was just ok- nothing to report.   Second time my corn cake thing was just gross batter used was from the previous day, seriously .  Third time - not amazing. The omelette was to be a veggie mix, and very few findings of the diced zucchini. The sausage was hard and over cooked. The potatoes were under cooked.  The end

-Pancakes were sweet and buttery, very delicious. -Breakfast sausage kind of tasted like bratwurst, it was a good surprise. -Potatoes were average, mix with grilled onions.   The actual restaurant was very cute and the lady working at the register was very nice. Overall good food and service, but nothing special. I would go back if I'm in the area, mostly because they are local and use local ingredients!

I ordered the banana bread pudding french toast with sausage, it was delicious! The only thing I have to complain about is there was too much caramel drizzled all over the French toast which made it a bit soggy and too sweet. The service was good and I loved the atmosphere. We will be returning!

Why bother with a little side of bacon when you can get a whole piece of pork on top of your waffle? WITH eggs AND a Portuguese donut! B.M.O.C. - just do it.   Cute patio area and relaxed atmosphere. Decor is hip and clientele is very mixed. Great people watching :)

(Lyrics - Lady Gaga - Paparazzi)  I'm your biggest fan I'll follow you until you feed me Vovo-Vovomeena  Bo Bites, there's no other foodie-star You know that I'll be there Vovo-Vovomeena  Promise I'll be kind But I won't stop until I start to dine Vovo you'll be famous Yelp you down until you feed me Vovo-Vovomeena   Vovo Vroom-na!  This place has my heart!  Granted, very hipster-ish, but I can look past that.  I cam here with some friends on a Saturday.  The place was hip and popping with and urban funk.  With an open kitchen cooking up a storm and a barista counter for your coffee.  You need to order at in a line and pick your seating after.  I was looking at the menu; very traditional american breakfast, but with funky modern twist.  I went for the b.m.o.c, Waffles with a pork chop atop and apple maple syrup and finished with an over easy egg with a side of Portuguese donut.  It was sweet and savory at the same time while the oozy egg gave it a smooth texture to every bite.    Service overall was welcoming and quick.  I didn't get a chance to order and coffee, but definitely and next time for me and Bo Bites recommendation! - Enjoy!

This has become one of our new favorite breakfast places in Phoenix, The Vovomeena! They have unique food combinations that are delicious, a very comfortable dinning experience and their name is fun to say ~ Vovomeena.  Say it with me; "Vovomeena" :-)  zee food ~ My fave is the Mexican Benedict or the BMOC.  They both are excellent choices!  The Mexican Benedict has great favor and textures with poached eggs a top of the english muffins with some chorizo and a great hollandaise.  The BMOC is pockchop/waffle/eggies and a portuguese donut (not made by a portugese person nor flown in from Portugal because I asked..) is a flavor-fest!   My son loves the Pain Perdu which is banana bread pudding french toast with the most amazing whiskey caramel sauce and a side of bacon or sausage.  I like it as well! The coffee is great and they provide you with a to-go cup when you're ready.    zee place to eat ~ it's nicely decorated with plenty of seating despite this place is so small.  They have a few larger tables, which provide you an opportunity to dine with others you may or may not know :-)  The staff is very friendly and they are always ready to help you find their morning moonshine.    It's a great little place for breakfast.  I hope to see you there some day soon!  I'll save you a spot at the end of the big table :-)

I only tried two dishes here, but I felt like both were extremely heavy. In glancing through the menu, it seemed that most of the dishes bordered on the heavy, carb-full side of brunch. Not that there's anything wrong with that, and brunch food tends to be heavy in general, but I felt that Vovomeena definitely took that to a new extreme with the dishes I tried. They were very unbalanced, and I didn't feel like finishing the meal after a few bites because of how one-dimensional the flavors felt.   Vovomeena is located in a small plaza with a shared parking lot between a few restaurants. Parking can be insane during the lunchtime rush, but it's not usually too hard to find a spot. Tables felt somewhat sticky to me, and unfortunately there were quite a few flies hovering around (not that that's the restaurant's fault). The mechanism is order first at the counter, grab drinks as they're made at the counter, and then find self seating. Service at the counter was short, although the waiter manning the tables was nice and checked on us a few times.  Iced cold brew: This was a far cry from the fragrant, nutty cold brew coffee that the menu promised. I much prefer the Starbucks cold brew even, and this was very watered down and bland in comparison. The cup was also half ice, which I wasn't a fan of.  HMOC: waffle topped with pork loin and donut. This combination was very interesting, and I hadn't really had anything like it before. My main issue with this dish, as I've mentioned above, is how it was heavy upon heavy upon heavy. The waffle was sweet and syrupy, then on top the pork loin was salty and dense (it tasted more like ham so I was surprised), and finally there's a fried donut on top that was also very rich. I felt that there wasn't a component to alleviate some of the richness of the dish, so it was hard to enjoy after the first few bites. I actually preferred that the pork had been cured or marinated before, as the saltiness similar to ham could combat the sweetness of the waffle and donut a little.   Pain Perdu: I know this is a Yelp favorite, but it was really just banana bread smothered in syrup. There wasn't really anything that suggested french toast to me, and paying $10+ for two slices of banana bread soaked in syrup with half a sliced banana on top didn't feel worth it to me. The banana bread was also really, really sweet, which was then exacerbated by the syrup on top. The whole dish was so sweet that it made the banana taste bland.   I was lured in by the amazing reviews, but I don't know that I'd return for a second visit.

We saw Vovomeena was listed as the best breakfast in the neighborhood by the New Times so figured we'd give it a Sunday morning go. What a great place! It's hidden behind the Five Guys in that center so we'd never even seen it before. We were fortunate that it was not as busy as some other Yelpers have experienced and,showing up during a lull, the coffee bar guy even came over and discussed the menu with us.   Great service, great food, love the atmosphere and coffee. And all just an easy bike ride down 5th Ave. Sinfully delicious but a worthwhile breakfast bookmark.

Vovomeena means Grandma Meena. And if this is how Grandma Meena always cooks, then I would kindly ask to be adopted, immediately.   We came here for brunch to take advantage of the beautiful patio weather. I had two eggs over easy, taters, buttermilk biscuit and sausage. He had .. get this... Banana bread pudding french toast with some kind of whiskey sauce?! Decadence to the extreme. The French toast was delicious, but you need to have a serious sweet tooth to be able to put the whole thing down.   Everything we ate had delicious flavor and looked great too, good portion size and all.   The style of service is very simple, you order and pay at the counter, they give you a numbered card and bring your food to wherever you choose to sit.   There is also a coffee bar where they have Japanese Cold Drip coffee! Exactly what we need in the sweltering Arizona summer.  Keep in mind that they close at 1:30.

Yummy!!! If I could do 4 and a half I would! I had a Mexican Benedict with hot coffee, the boyfriend had waffles, bacon and potatoes. Only thing that was just okay were the potatoes.. I think they should use Yukon potatoes. This is also dog friendly, I'll make sure to bring my little baby next time This restaurant is for sure is in my top 5 for brunch

Finally made it to this little gem that is on the corner of 7th Ave and McDowell.  Wow, it was so good!  I would call this counter service, you order at the register than take your table.  After that your food is brought to you and everything else is just like a regular restaurant.  The menu is made up of the normal breakfast and brunch items and then the other items are things that you normally wouldn't think of but of boy, did they sure look and smell good when they went by us.  Our party had the famous biscuits and gravy -YUMMY; Blackstone Scramble - YUMMY and then the Banging Pocket - YUMMY!!  Next time I'm getting the Pain Perdu because it looked and smelled so good.  The service is top notch and everything was very clean.  They have indoor and outdoor seating available and dogs are welcomed on the patio. I would highly recommend Vovomeena for breakfast/brunch.
Mexican Benedict!!!! It's a must everything about it is perfect!! I have gotten it twice delish!!!

We love this place! The food is always delicious and the coffee is some of the best in town! If you like iced coffee the Japanese cold drip is to die for. Vovomeena is a hidden gem and you have to try it!

Vovomeena lived up to the hype.  I had been eyeballing their menu for some time and was really looking forward to trying the pain perdu (banana bread pudding French toast) and WOW, it was awesome. The only issue I had was that I wanted more and more.  The family all enjoyed their meals and had no complaints to note. I would definitely go back in hopes the cooks make a mistake and make my portion twice the size.

Great coffee. Great food. The iced japanese coffee is something else. I don't know of any other place that has such a thing. The Mexican Benedict is very good. It has just the right amount of spice, and the eggs are runny with a great hollandaise.  Just what I want.

We decided to check this place out after seeing how many awesome reviews they had. We had the Mexican Benedict, Orchard French Toast & iced coffees! Everything was delicious! I'd definitely recommend checking this place out!

Being away from family on Easter isn't always easy.  Missing the home cooked goodness and the niece and nephews hunting eggs.  So I was thankful for my two sistas from other mistas for joining me for brunch.  This place is super cute and absolutely delish! I ordered the Mexican Benedict.  Sopes instead of bread...chorizo, cilantro and a lovely poached egg with hollandaise sauce! Served with their spuds...I added their arugula salad and dropped that on top of the benedict...perfection!    This place is great! I know we will be back and I'll definitely have the banana bread pudding french toast my friend got...that ish was off the chain!

Second trip to Phoenix meant a 2nd trip to Vovomeena. Everything we have had is tasty. Chilis in my johnny cakes? Sure!  Not my usual breakfast but the flavor combos are so tasty. Pain perdu made from banana pudding bread?  Oh yeah!!  The coffee is solid too. My plan is to return often enough to try each item on the menu. It's that good.

This breakfast place is adorable on the inside and tucked away. The food was AMAZING and the service was even better! It was busy when we arrived but the wait after we ordered was short! We will definitely be going back! Order the 'banging pocket'. Absolutely the best breakfast place in Phoenix!  Can't wait to go back!

We were visiting from Hawaii and found this place through Yelp.  We arrived there 40 minutes before closing and it was not crowded. The place is very nice. The menu is simple. You place your order at the serving counter and they bring your food to your table. There is a separate counter where they craft your coffee drink. I ordered  the b.m.o.c. and was not disappointed. The pork chop was tender and tasty. It was a first for me to have it with a waffle and it was delicious. My family members had the Mexican Benedict which was very good; Wilcox avenue and classic egg sandwich which were all very delicious. I would definitely eat here again.
Love this place! The BYOC is amazing! Best pork chop I've ever had. The Mexican Benedict is good, the Banger is good, it's all yummy!

I got in here pretty early on a Sunday morning and didn't have to wait at all. The menu is different from a lot of breakfast places and I appreciate their creativity.  I went with the 3 Sisters omelet. The ingredients were tasty and I really liked how fluffy the eggs were.  Coffee and service were good as well.

First off, the seating here is super confusing. It is not clear what you should do when you enter and no employee helped direct us what to do.  It was cramped and awkward as it was very busy and we did not know where to stand before and after ordering our food, we were basically hovering over the people trying to eat around us. After we got our food, it was not worth the wait.  It was lukewarm/cold, lacking sauce, potatoes were undercooked and under seasoned.  The bread was dry and flavorless. To top it all off, it was expensive.

My sister took me here while visiting from WA and I must say I haven't had French toast this tasty in a long time! It was done with challah bread and topped with sliced apples and honey mascarpone! It was so delightful!

From the whiskey caramel on the pain perdu, the spuds on the side, to the arugula leaves in the savory crepes and the amazing locally crafted coffee, I have to give it Vovomeena!!!! You guys are an outstanding breakfast place. Keep doing what you do! I shall be back.

I got the Mexican Benedict and ordered the eggs over medium. Lets just say my babe and I fought over the last bite and to her quote she did not remember her meal. Which she did not finish and my plate was clean! THANK YOU! And we will be back!

Cold brew coffee was good but I hated the donuts. I was expecting malasadas like I had in Hawaii, but they were nothing like it. AND they were served room temp!  SO disappointed! 1 star for the donuts and 4 for the coffee.

So I came for the first time today and it was PACKED at 11-11:30am. Tip: do NOT come on Sunday mornings around this time (maybe better next Sunday?)  I got my food at a pretty reasonable time considering the amount of guests here. Was told the Portuguese donut wasn't available anymore and was kinda disappointed but when they brought out my food I had to ask if that was it or not. Apparently I lucked out and got it anyhow.   4 stars because of the great tasting food. Solid amount of food to definitely feed you and your girlfriend (bmoc at least).  Come give em a try! But sit inside and make sure you don't have a crowd of over 2 because seating is limited.

AWESOME!!!!! I got the Wilcox Avenue and a waffle....the customer service was top notch, I actually made a mistake and ordered a dish that didn't come with a waffle, and was given the waffle for free....(can't beat free)
Came into town for training and stopped in for breakfast. I was not disappointed. The food was delicious, and the staff was great!
Wow every weekend vovomeena gets lots of love from all the locals from the valley.   Every one is so nice and attentive.  The food is amazing good. Try the 3 sisters is delicious  good.

Great experience,super fast service. My wife and I saw this restaurant on Check Please Arizona last night. Very quiet and quaint place and Super good food and a good serving size as well. If you are a light eater you my want share.

I told the manager I have gluten and dairy allergies before ordering and he recommended a couple options I could do. I ended up ordering the Mexican Benedict with no tortilla. They bring me my plate with my food on top of, you guessed it, tortillas. Because it was on my food, I couldn't eat anything except the potatoes and left the actual dish untouched. Waste of $13.00 on breakfast - who knew listening to someone's order was so difficult?
This is the spot for breakfast or brunch. Highly recommended

This is a terrific breakfast spot in downtown Phoenix if you want somewhere small and cozy with delicious comfort food (and great coffee!). A lifelong Phoenix resident took me here and swore by it, so I came with an open mind despite a difficult parking situation in the small attached lot. Upon entering you wait in line to place your order and I chose the biscuits and gravy as well as the unlimited hot coffee before taking our seat.   The coffee itself was great and worthy of any boutique coffee shop in LA! While I got the unlimited hot coffee (for only $3!) my friend got the cold brew sampler which was a unique experience if you're a cold brew lover! Out of her four cold brews she really liked three of them, so don't go into it planning to love each one but if you want to try new things it's a great option.  When our food arrived I was blown away by the biscuits and gravy. As many here have said, they're incredibly rich and indulgent but are the perfect treat if you're craving something heavy on the carbs and cream! The menu is expansive, as well, so next time I'm in Phoenix I'll certainly come back to try something new!

This is a perfectly fine spot for brunch. The food is good, but I think it's a bit overpriced, and the menu is really limited. I've never been wow-ed by what I've had there, but with every not-so-positive review, I always like to say that I might just not have tried the right thing.  Seriously though, the service and coffee are always good. We'd have to be pretty close for me to tell you I didn't want to eat there.

Oh. Em. Vee.   This was delicious. New favorite breakfast place obsession has commenced with this lovely little gem. Recommend the Savory Crepes (perfect amount of saucy goodness + cheese + egg) and the johnnycakes. Going to try the three sisters strata next.

It was good breakfast, not sure if it is better than Matt's or Snooze, but comparable. The bacon was good. I wasn't wild about the coffee and they only had one, the others were out. It was extremely busy and we sat outside. I am interested in going back to try something other than breakfast.

We were looking for something different for breakfast and stumbled upon this little gem. Very modern decor and clean!  This is a order at the counter and sit type of place. We like t usually sit and figure it out in the mornings..but no complaints. Simple menu We loved our breakfast... so you will see us again sometime soon

My boyfriend and I were looking for new breakfast places to try and decided to check Vovomeena out. The reviews were off the charts, especially for the Pain Perdu.  To make an unbiased assessment, I refused to order the pain perdu the first time. My logic being: how good can a place REALLY be if they only serve one fantastic item? So, I ordered the Blackstone scramble while my boyfriend decided to continue his search for the best biscuits and gravy.  The food was as fabulous as I had read. The biscuits and gravy were some of the best he had ever had and I made a personal oath to come try the pain perdu. That mission was completed today and I concur with all the positive reviews. I was sincerely sad, and disappointed in myself, for not being able to finish what was on my plate.   We will be coming back!

What a great place tucked behind a parking lot on 7th Ave & McDowell.  As you walk in grab a menu and then place your order.    The menu is short and sweet.  The home fries are the real deal with huge chunks of of tomato and cilantro.  We were handed a number as I turned around I saw this cute coffee stand.  The coffee was unique, against the wall were glass cylinders that dripped coffee slowly into larger cylinders.  I was told this is the new wave of coffee making.  Okay, then I need a cup right now...  I coffee was good, not great but good.  Here comes the brunch.... my husband ordered the French toast... wow.... it was definitely delicious! I got the tortilla espinola. It was yummmy....  Vovomeena is a great breakfast/brunch place.  That's what they do and they do it well.....

Good brunch spot in Phoenix!  Went during the weekday, so it wasn't crowded at all. There is parking on both sides of the building, and it's plentiful.   Inside has a nice, relaxing ambiance to it. Again, it wasn't crowded when we went, but I can imagine it may not be as relaxing if it got really busy inside. I must also say that the restroom was really nice, which is always a plus.  The service was fine. Nothing to complain about there.  The food was good. The menu is small, but at the same time has a good selection to choose from if that makes sense. We had the johnnycakes with turkey sausage and the blackstone scramble with flour tortilla. The johnnycakes were really good. Love that corn in them. The sweet rice was also a great side with that. The turkey sausage was a little dry, but had a nice spice to it. The scramble was solid. The pork shoulder was cooked nicely and was a perfect size for the scramble. The prices were also very reasonable for the portions.  Overall, good spot to grab some breakfast/brunch. Reasonable prices, solid food, generous portions.
This place is amazing!! Best French toast I ever had. And the people are very nice. Food is incredible.

I have been here twice now. I anxiously await my next visit !! :) I have been able to try the johnny cakes ( perfection ! Better than mine -pat pat ) the biscuits and gravy (oh my wow ! So sausagyyy and herby and creamy and wow !) the b.m.o.c. (way more that I dreamt it would be, tender smokey pork, sweet strong vanilla waffle make magic together) and the pancakes and bacon (right on). Their potatoes are outstanding. Their coffee is wonderful. The customer service is caring. The decor is nice. Great spot !

If its a difficult task for you to figure out the ordering and seating arrangements at this fantastic breakfast spot, I suggest you never travel. A busy morning restaurant or caf√©s in a large metropolitan city will scramble your hungry brain even more than  a brunch outing at Vovomeena!  My favorite dishes are Mexican Benedict, Pain Perdu, and Wilcox Avenue. All require a large glass of Japanese cold brew, which is the best refreshing coffee drink on a weekend morning! I highly recommend. Skip the usual creamer as the taste is not bitter. Yum!

Nice indoor/outdoor, industrial/rustic, bustling atmosphere.  Very friendly, welcoming staff..with fast service.  I tried the Japanese cold brew flight... A-mazing! The flavors in the flight are rotated..today was star cardomen, orange ginger and Black and Tan. I went with the blackstone scramble for brunch...just the right amount of food, fresh ingredients and a killer tortilla (I don't normally eat tortillas but this one I couldn't pass up).   If you are downtown, I would highly recommend...please build a sister location in downtown Gilbert ;-)

The Mexican omelette is pretty good. It is a little spicy so be aware of that. The bread is also a little different unlike normal Eggs Benedict. Hubby got the pancakes and bacon and it was also very good typical diner pancakes.

B.M.O.C Review  Creamy deliciousness in my mouth with a side of food coma. This thing was the bomb dot com. Be warned, it will end your day. Smoked pork chop topped with a waffle, two fried eggs and a Portuguese donut all smothered in apple maple syrup. I was full about 2/3 of the way through this madness but  finished like a champ. 3 cups of coffee later I was able to avoid the food coma but I was still stuffed from breakfast around 8pm that same day. Give it a go homey!
Great place for breakfast! Awesome combinations, friendly fast service! Omelet was super good and so were the pancakes.  We will be back for sure!

Okay, so we are in Phoenix to pick up  breakfast with our guest who is leaving that day and we are on our way from Peoria, AZ to take her to the airport  and we want her to have the Matt's Big Breakfast experience and..........yep, you guessed it, 40 minute line to wait in, so we fell into this place..........thanks to other yelp users who rated this high and nearby.  Well, we are here to tell you, this should be the place they are standing in line for, it's that good.  From the moment you walk in and notice the delectable dishes on the tables of the customers, you know you've stepped into something very unique for the palate.  Then, you pick up a menu and you know you aren't in Kansas anymore...........the names of the dishes are different, the ingredients are different, the choices are creative, and about the best coffee I've tasted.  It looks like a factory, but it delivers like nonconformity.  What to have?  we tried the chorizo benedict, the savory crepes, and the grilladas and if we had tummy room, we would have tried more.  Sufficeth it to say, we won't be standing in line for Matt's next time ---- we'll set our sights and our gps to this place!  Well done, vovomeena!

Came in for breakfast ordered their Benedict and I thought it was absolutely terrible the owner of the restaurant looked at me like I was crazy cuz he said so many people love it he then gave me an order of biscuits and gravy which I will say were absolutely amazing I did like those my girlfriend ordered some type of corn pancakes and they were very good as well the coffee was nice and strong and honestly we beat the crowds so I can't complain too much it was a great stop on our way back to California

Love the vibe and smell of the place!  I love to smell coffee, but I am not a drinker.  I got their green tea.  Pretty good.  Came with friends and wanted to try the Japanese ice coffee.  I would come back for a bite, next time!
I don't know why, it took me longer time to get the food, but the food overall is great! Coffee is okay. (Not that excellent.) Environment is quiet and lovely.
I wanted something different for brunch. I got the sausage in pita, it was very good. Nice clean restaurant, priced well. I'll be back.

One of the best breakfasts I have had and I have been to many unique places.  The portion was a little slim but the taste and quality outstanding.  Just a cute and unique little place in an older and rejuvenated part of the inner city.  Great and friendly service too ! I will return

I think for those of us who came in on the wknd of 9/30 the place was too busy and they still need time to figure out the kinks like others said. It was busy, which is a good sign, but also they were running short on the menu so I wasnt able to get the grillades just yet. Thats what Ive been wanting to try. I did have the BMOC, but it didnt excite me like some of the other reviews. I did have the pain perdu a week prior when it wasnt crowded, which is the banana bread pudding french toast and I have to say those were excellent and by far my fave thing I have tried there. My hubby had the boxty and mexican eggs benedict(by the way to other comment who mentioned, they had Sriracha and Cholulah the day we came in) Hubby said a piece of toast would go well with the Mexican Benedict to help finish up all the stuff on the plate, other then that he liked it, and hes a big fan of the Japanese Coffee also and said he probably wont go to Starbucks again either. The Boxty was interesting, but I was too busy eating my banana bread pudding french toast with Whiskey Caramel Sauce. The food is very rich and Ive found Im stuffed and cant even finish my plate, so Im usually taking some to go. If you are coming with a large group on a busy day you will probably have to sit outside at the big long counter tables. Most of the seating inside is for groups of 2-4. Very happy to get more variety in the strip mall! And yes the manager is out speaking to customers and was carrying food out along with the staff. We will be back!

Had brunch with a co-worker here today. Food was delicious and flavorful. Excellent for brunch. Mexican Egg Benedict was phenomenal! Their espresso machine was broken but the Japanese Cold Brews were nice and strong. You get to add your own sugars and creamers to your taste at the bar area.  We told the barista it was our first time dining there and he gave us a quick tour and break down of the restaurant. So, you grab a menu and when you're ready, place your order at the register. If you order coffee or tea you pick it up at the bar. You get to pick your own seats and they'll bring your food out to you.  Although quaint, the place has a very unique look; comfortable but sophisticated. There's also a patio sitting area if you chose to sit outdoors.
