The employees were kind and helpful when we asked about their recommendations. They were also attentive in offering/providing condiments/extras and clearing our table.   Definitely going back, definitely a new favorite!
Found this fantastic breakfast on Yelp. Great food, great service. Big fluffy pancakes!! Groovy atmosphere. Loved it. We'll be back to try some of stuff he more creative stuff on the menu.

We found this place on Yelp. It was off the beaten path from the convention center. When in cities for conventions, I like to venture to more local spots for good food. This place didn't disappoint.   I really liked the food here. I wouldn't eat here often because most of the food was on the heavier side, but it was really good. If you want pancakes, this place has really good ones.  They also have freshly squeezed orange juice.   The food came out fairly quickly.   Definitely go here for good breakfast.

GET HERE NOW...NOW!!! Great food! It will look like there is no seating when you're in line on the weekend, but by the time you get your food it will be open TRUST ME. Try the Mexican benedict...life changing. Cinnamon rolls? Fogettaboutit!

Went here with a pretty big group. We had a reservation and the table was ready. The food came out pretty quickly after we ordered and it was all very good. Those who had coffee said it was delicious coffee. My food was good nothing spectacular, I had the Wilcox Avenue. The sausage was yummy, wheat toast was good and the jelly (I assume homemade) was awesome.  I would certainly go back and try more items on the menu.

Our first time here and it was absolutely delicious ! I had the Mexican Benedict, what a unique take on Eggs benedict ! My husband had the Banging Pocket and enjoyed it ! Don't forget to top off your plate with their Portuguese donut !
Great food. Fun atmosphere. Friendly service. This is one of my new Sunday brunch favorites.
This is tucked away and easy to miss but it should not be! We had such a great breakfast here the other day. I think I may have found by new favorite place for brunch. Definitely recommend!!

This was a spectacular breakfast! The line was out the door when we arrived, but I liked how well-organized it all was. I didn't mind standing in line knowing I was going to be ordering at the end of it, and loved how they made sure tables weren't occupied until you had a number for your food. It really kept people moving without worrying about holding a table. Loved their patio seating too.  I had a really hard time deciding what to eat because there were so many delicious sounding, and looking (yes, I was that person creeping on other's breakfasts as we were standing in line). I finally settled on their biscuits and gravy because that's one of my favorite breakfast foods- it was so delicious!! Definitely want to try their Mexican benedict next time I'm in town.  Loved their Japanese cold-brewed coffee as well! Smooth, rich and totally hit the spot!  The owner, I think, was working the register when we ordered and he was so friendly and welcoming- that kind of attention goes a long way. I will definitely be back!
Vovomeena has great food and a friendly staff. The food is very reasonably priced for the quality.

They have done it again.  Great concept, great food, great building, great staff, and pricing is just right.    If you are looking to break the Corporate Food Chain monotony of 7th Ave and McDowell then Vovomeena is where to go.  Delicious local food and excellent coffee selections.  I can not pick a favorite on the menu, but can say that everything will be sure to not disappoint, so you are safe to close your eyes, point, and try it.
The Johnnycakes (corn and chile cakes with prickly pear syrup) were delicious and different. I loved this sweet and savory dish!

Adorable restaurant with great atmosphere. The food is affordable and well made. I wasn't particularly blown away by my breakfast but I will go back to try something else on the menu. Parking is a bit of a challenge but it's a perfectly fine place to have breakfast.
Excellent service, food and coffee/latte were delicious.  Had the French toast and chorizo hollonadaise, both pretty good. Staff is super friendly. Would highly recommend.

Food snob Here in Phoenix from LA. This place, the food, the service, the atmosphere, the lattes, the coffee, the cappuccino - everything was excellent and satisfying.  Will definitely come back when I'm Phoenix again.  Try it. You won't be disappointed.
Easily one of the best spots in Arizona if not the entire US. Amazing food done right, great atmosphere. Amazing customer service. Can't say enough good things about this place.

Strike 1 - Being out of the 'jug-o'coffee'/pitcher of iced coffee, I had to order 3 separate coffees for my group and it was definitely pricier. I was expecting the server to offer a comparable price for the 3 coffees since the restaurant made an excuse about the "pitchers not being delivered" but I guess my expectations were too high. This left a bitter taste in my mouth (not in the good coffee way), and there's also no refill. Since I run on caffeine, there just wasn't enough there to wake me up.   Strike 2 - I ordered the blackstone scramble, and the eggs tasted absolutely bland. I'm always looking for a kick in my breakfast to help me wake up (sensing a theme here?)...it just didn't hit that note for me despite the delicious description on the menu.  I should not need to drown my food in tabasco for flavor.   Strike 3 - I can see the ordering system working to improve efficiency, but in this case, since there were no designated waiters, there was no motivation to assist/clean tables. I didn't see many patrons leaving tip, and this just creates a no win situation on both sides.  And I'm out

Awesome breakfast...I had the The Wilcox and everythi g was cooked to perfection. My husband had the biscuits and gravy and the gravy was very savory and the eggs were cooked just right. The porportions are huge, neither of us could finish. The staff was very attentive and friendly. We loved the atmosphere.

Stopped here with my sis on the way back from the airport. Nice quaint little place. The food wasn't spectacular but nice options and definitely a better experience than the local chains like IHOP and Denny's. A little pricey would be my only complaint - $38 for 2 breakfasts and a coffee drink. Still it's definitely worth trying.

Fantastic brunch spot! We chose this place at random for our group of 3 to grab brunch on a Sunday around noon. It was busy but we got a table within 5 minutes of ordering. Everyone loved the food! My husband had biscuits and gravy - he said it was incredible, he just wished the portion was bigger (much smaller than your typical biscuit & gravy portion). I had the bangin' pocket (essentially a breakfast burrito, but in a pita). It was delicious, and great portion size. Wish I would have tried their coffee. I can't wait to return!

The atmosphere and staff are REALLY nice, pleasant, great vibe, clean, with a well thought-out menu.  The food menu sounded really nice, but honestly the food was just meh.  We are both spoiled because I cook everything from scratch all the time, so the best way I can explain it is that they had lots of great concepts (using banana bread instead of regular French toast, for example), but the food itself wasn't super flavorful.  The individual ingredients like the meat  and bread used in the benedict could have been tastier.  I loved the fried potatoes that came as a side dish for breakfast.  The coffee was just okay and the espresso wasn't good. I think that most people would probably love it, but if you're an extreme foodie, or maybe it was just us, we wouldn't return.

Five stars for sure and can't wait to come back and try something new! Came here on a Saturday morning and the line was out the door but it honestly didn't take too long. Maybe 15-20 min to order. We sat down and got our food really fast there. As you're in line to order you're right outside the kitchen do you can see how fast they're working and getting all these dishes together. They know what they're doing! I got the Mexican Benedict because I saw everyone talking about it here on Yelp. Let me tell you, I was not disappointed!! Perfect portion size and the flavor was so good!! My husband got the banana pudding French toast, the name on the menu was something different, don't remember what it was but his dish was just as good! So much flavor in every single bite. Everything was bomb, can't wait to come back and try something else on the menu!

Always wondered what this place was and I am so glad I tried it out. My boyfriend and I went on a Saturday morning. We didn't have to wait to order, which isn't the norm at most breakfast places downtown on the weekend. The staff was very friendly when we arrived. We both ordered the biscuits and gravy. The food arrived to our table quick, less than five minutes after ordering. The portion was large and it tasted great. I enjoyed the atmosphere and really liked the coffee bar. I would definitely recommend this place to friends. We will be back soon!

Great brunch place and not as expensive as what you would find in New York! My recommendations are the Johnnycakes and the b.m.o.c.  Johnnycakes (Two corn and chile cakes, prickly pear maple syrup, sweet rice) - My favorite of what we ordered. The cakes tasted like thin crispy cornbread with whole corn kernels throughout the pancake. The syrup was on the flowery side. Add a side of potatoes and this was a perfect breakfast.  b. m. o. c. (Massive Smoked Pork Chop, waffle, 2 eggs, Portuguese donut) - The waffle itself was soggy, but the pork chop was juicy and massive as advertised. It was similar to ham and it combined well with apple compote. The donut tasted like a fried fritter. I recommend ordering this.  Pain Perdu (Banana bread pudding french toast, whiskey caramel) - The banana bread was too sweet and too soggy. The whiskey caramel added more unnecessary sweetness. Order this only if you have a huge sweet tooth. I loved the crispy side of potatoes though.   Biscuits and Gravy (Buttermilk Biscuit, Hector's White Sausage Gravy, Two Eggs - The sausage had a somewhat spicy kick. Biscuits were fluffy. Eat this dish while warm because the gravy becomes too thick and viscous.  Order at the cash register and they'll bring you the food to the table. To get drinks, order/retrieve them from the drinks counter. Overall, I enjoyed this place and if I lived here I would frequent this place often.

If you are looking for a hearty breakfast on a Saturday morning because you are going to conquer a 2 hour hike or run, then "hell yes" - go to Vovomeena.    I decided to go with Yelp's recommendations of the BMOC.  This thing was insane!  A waffle, then a pork chop, two eggs, maple syrup and some kind of fruit, and just as a little "cherry on top" for your breakfast sundae, they give you a small donut hole with some powder.    It was quite tasty!  However, it was too much for me to take.  It would practically take two of me to finish it all. Luckily, I was set to hike Squaw Peak right after.  So I didn't feel too guilty getting down with that kind of breakfast.  It actually gave me the extra motivation and boost of energy I needed.   On a side note, the iced coffee was a little too strong for my blood.  I'm sure other coffee drinkers would love it.

Excellent food! You wait in line FIRST, order at the counter, find a seat, and the food is brought to you. On weekends the line gets pretty long, but it goes pretty quickly.  Everything I've tried has been very good.

A bit hard to find the first time as it is nestled behind other businesses.  Drive around the block and park behind in the large common parking lot.  Although the inside of the building is narrow the tables is laid out perfectly and the decor is eclectic.  There is also a very large area in the back for sitting.  They ask you not to barney a table until you've ordered and believe it or not the system works.    Waiting in line to order you can see them preparing the food; yummy.  Small menu but choices I've not seen elsewhere. I got the tortilla espanola and the hubby got the mexican benedict.  Both were cooked well and were tasty.  Not earth shattering but good.  When they dropped our breakfasts they asked if we wanted condiments and it took him a full 5 minutes (while the breakfast cooled) before he came back with them.  I'd suggest they carry the items on their person - only complaint.

Goodness on a plate with a side of love and sunshine. Our first time was amazing. There was a line out the door so we had plenty of time to select our entr√©es. I selected the BMOC and my husband ordered the biscuits and gravy. To drink I had the fresh orange juice and took a taste of my husbands cold pressed coffee flight. My BMOC was salty and savory and sweet and amazing. The flavor a really worked well together, it was a fabulous "cheat" meal. The biscuits and gravy were the best I ever tasted, ever! The biscuits were fluffy and yummy and the gravy needed no additional seasoning, we asked for Chalula hot sauce and decided it was fine without. Cannot wait to go back.

The waffle I had was delicious. Even though I wasn't able to substitute the spuds for something else, I was still left impressed. I want to bring all of my closest friends and family to this place. I'll be at this same spot next Sunday.
Everything was so damn good. My husband order the banging pocket and said "I'm so full, but it's so good I can't stop eating it." Be prepared for a bit of a wait. Very dog friendly!
A very trendy eatery. Coffee is on another level! Food is great but not fantastic as far as flavor goes.
The b.m.o.c was really good. This breakfast was different , fresh, and innovative. Enjoyed it. This place is legit!

You know you found a good place when you wanna come back like everyday and try everything on the menu and this place is just that. The restaurant is really small but still comfy, we were greeted the moment we walked in, and once we ordered and got seated our food arrived in less then 5 minutes it seemed. I ordered the breakfast sandwich and my boyfriend had the waffle eggs and sausage. Everything was delicious especially the potatoes! Such a cool place and I can't wait to go back to try more!

First impressions were good! Excellent esthetics of the place.. Good vibes good music.. Costumer service was not the best. I'm sure they were just busy, but I felt little to no acknowledgment that I was there or a paying customer.   FOOD IS ON POINT.  I would recommend this place to anyone.

Food is great, the tortilla espa√±ola could be improved, it's one of Spain's most popular dishes, yet so simple and it doesn't need to be over elaborated, 5 ingredients: Potatoes, eggs, onions, salt and olive oil, how can you go wrong? They need just a little of a fifth ingredient; passion. Service is confusing, if you sit at a table they move you because you have to order first, it throws people off and it gets annoying, I left my stuff at a table and they sat someone at that table, I understand the rule, but I guess I really don't like that one. Having said that, it's a great spot; different!

I've been meaning to come in since I had my bday dinner at How do you Roll? Finally made it in with the fam!   I was super excited to try the Japanese cold brew. We had heard awesome things and boy, it did not disappoint! We had a flight of 3 different kinds - lemon jalape√±o, med, and ginger cardamom. They were all delicious. The first one you could really taste the lemon, not so much the jalape√±o, the med was nice and bold, and the ginger cardamom was my FAV. Nice and spicy.  Note: cold brew has MORE caffeine in it!  For food we got the BMOC and the Pain Perdu. Both were excellent. The pork on the BMOC was nice and moist and smoky. The Portuguese donut was fluffy and not too sweet. Pain Perdu is just SINFUL. Banana bread pudding French toast with whiskey caramel sauce?! Oh you must. You'll gain 5 lbs but you just have to do it.  My only gripe is that both dishes were swimming in sauce. It was too much. My waffle was soggy on the BMOC because it was drowning in syrup. And it whiskey caramel sauce is so rich, they could really just drizzle it on there and it would suffice. Next time I will order the syrup and sauce on the side! I suggest you do the same.  Overall, really good experience. Customer service was warm and friendly. Mostly hipster crowd but there were families there too so we felt totally comfortable as well. Will return!
Amazing breakfast. The food is really good. Definitely a spot I'll be going back to. And I don't even care for breakfast.

Updated review, I went back per manager request for second try, food much much better, had a grand experience. Not a fan of of the order at the counter and still not a fan of the prepackaged orange juice in plastic cups and odd coffee flight in plastic jugs. Nonetheless the food and drink was spot on.    Great place, almost 5 stars, I'll start with cons then pros:  Cons: Order at bar, my personal preference this takes away ambiance. It causes you to rush your order, keeps you from ordering more, awkward if you are a visitor from Out of town. You can see into the kitchen which could be cool but this kitchen is not the prettiest, looks messy. The place is awkwardly run, folks running around all over, coffee bar has plastic jugs of brewed coffee, be cooler if the coffee was in glass dispensers or something classier. Dirty tables, I wouldn't care so much but if you are required to self seat you have to navigate them Coffee bar is messy, ugly glass fridge showing off messy storage Going back to kitchen which is in clear view, messy messy, bizarre, empty boxes, crap all over floor, food supplies etc. OJ is prepared and stored in plastic cups, I personally would Prefer to get my OJ in a glass. Food although good, seemed a bit messy when served, I saw into the kitchen as mentioned above and the chefs were sloppily throwing food onto a plate. I may be the exception but it was nothing like the Yelp pics. I had to carry a large coffee flight, my OJ, a number, my wallet, phone all around searching for a table  Pros: Food tasted good, I had the pork chop on a waffle, it was soaked to death in a syrup, I've been on a low carb diet so it was heaven but had I not I think it should be a tad drier. The chop was basically a ham steak, it was a bit acrid, over cooked on grill and sugars burnt. Coffee flight was good, unique flavor a Easy parking  Overall, a bit satisfied but more so disappointed, been trying to get here for years. I'm a very frequent patron of Tuck Shop, I believe they own or partnered with this place.  I'll return although with lower expectations.

I think this is going to be my go-to spot for breakfast,  A friend who is a semi-regular at Vovomeena and I had a breakfast meeting there at his suggestion. I had the Banging Pocket and loved it.  The food was delivered quickly and the service was attentive.
Vovomeena is great for brunch. Coffee and orange juice is sooo good, I think the orange juice is even hand squeezed.
Awesome breakfast.  Fast service. Great coffee.  Love the location.  Daily specials! What else do you need for a great local breakfast experience?  Maybe a hot date....

What a hidden gem! We were in from out of town and found this place on yelp. Chef, your food was amazing! It was so hard to decide on what to indulge in. We score with our selection the Johnny Cakes and the Mexican Benedict. Potatoes were to die for. The Arroz de Leche with my Johnny Cakes was the perfect combination of sweet spice and tart with the strawberries. We will definitely make this a must stop when we are in town. Oh I also tried the iced coffee & Caff√® vanilla latt, yummy!
3 visit - first 2 were great / last visit, 3 plates had to be returned ---cold food / might be new cooks / mgmt. did take care of issue . . . .will return . . . .for better results . . .
Amazing coffee! Food is great! Love having this neighborhood spot!
Hidden gem!!! Best breakfast we have had in Phoenix. Everything made from scratch and you can see them make your food. Very reasonable prices too.

Ordered the B.M.O.C.. Found this place via @azfoodie's awesome Insta. The dish was a good balance between sweet and salty; a kicked up version of a ham with the added benefit of bbq grill flavor and smoke. Delicious. Comes atop a beautifully made waffle and apple compote, with two eggs (made your way. Mine were a perfect over medium) on top.  They chose a quasi-fast casual dining model, so you pay first and receive your order via server. Ambience is great for foodies, like myself, who enjoy taking photos of everything, and the service was very responsive, efficient and cordial.
Great food!  Different options than the average brunch. Casual atmosphere, no wait for a table due to their set up of ordering before being seated. Will definitely be back!

I was here for the first time for breakfast and order the only omelette on the menu and it's delicious! I was their with a friend and he order the Mexican egg Benedict he was very happy with it! Nice little place very cozy! I will definitely come back! They serve a yummy local coffee roc2!

The food was great, the coffee was delicious.  One coffee barista who was beyond rude, made this a horrible first and last experience at this restaurant. The rest of the staff is very pleasant.  Being told whatever because I wanted to ask my friend what she liked, and not given the option of a refund, when they gave me the wrong $10 jar of coffee to go, after spending $32 bucks for my breakfast and to go coffee, is why I will never go back to this place.  Mistakes happen, and I was understanding of that, but it was how the guy in the 80s glasses handled the situation or more so that he didn't.  To the girl in the pink hair and the register guy, thank you both for being polite and friendly.

Small spot with good food. I came specifically for the Banana bread pudding French toast with caramel rum sauce, and it was worth the trip if you like sweet for breakfast. But I noticed a lot of savory items being served.
Hidden gem.  The only thing that supersedes the great service were the homemade biscuits and coffee.
I like it here. The set up is kind of narrow, and it is not a big location/space. I have not encountered this place to be busy, it has just the right amount of "people flow" . Artsy feel to it!

Interesting place.  I have been here a few times, generally because there is nowhere else to go.  The food is good (but weird and not in a way that you would brag to your friends) and the prices a little too high.    It's just okay but I like that I can sit outside and it is cozy and quiet.   Shout-out to Ryan and the vegan woman from Astor House -- you guys are the best.

Can't believe all the other chain clones in this little strip mall are busy when Vovomeena is often relatively calm.  The food is unique and luxurious, the coffee is some of the best around (bottomless cup on the drip variety), the baristas are bad ass, the place is beautiful and interesting, and the prices are not much more than what you'd pay for a fast food meal.  But I guess if you'd rather go to Jersey Mike's (tm), the Habit (tm), Chipotle (tm), etc. etc., knock yourself out.  I'll be here, fat and happy!

AUGH that waffle/pork chop/egg combination is So good perfectly meaty, sweet and carby  i hear the service can be a bit wonky  but the food is definitely solid  come by for breakfast just don't order a coffee that was the one thing i thought was wildly overpriced

The BMOC and the Mexican Benedict was nothing short of amazing. The place looks small but they get people through pretty fast. We thought we were gonna be a while because the line was out the door (now after tasting the food I see why). But this was a hit. The orange juice and coffee (morning moonshine) was fresh. Will come back again when in town.

I want to like Vovomeena very much. Their food is mostly good, but there are a huge problem for a restaurant of this quality:  they use LIQUID EGG PRODUCT for their scrambled eggs and omelets. This is what McDonald's uses for their scrambled eggs. Liquid egg product has no place in a high quality establishment. They sacrifice quality for speed. The egg product is one example. The other is that their donuts are fried ahead of time and served cold. They have a cold, greasy taste. Where, if they were fried to order, they would be delicious. Vovomeena wants to be a high end establishment, but their process doesn't match up with that goal. Sometimes there are small sacrifices in speed that are so much worth any extra wait.

This place is not the perfect breakfast experience. It is loud, noisy, small and crowded. At least it was the day I went. However ... upon taking the first bite of their banana bread pudding French toast ... it was as if I was in the restaurant all by myself! It was that good!   Pain Perdu is the name of the dish. I will go back to this place just for another order of that! But it is also fun as the line to order passed directly by the open kitchen. You get to see what all of the dishes look like and even ask the cooks what everything is.  Price: little high Ambience: noisy hustle bustle  Service: quick and friendly  French Toast:  AMAZING!!
Get the biscuits and gravy. It was the best I've ever had. It was worth the 20 minute line and then some. I'd stand in line for 2 hours foe that if it meant I could have it again.

Absolutely one of the best breakfasts I have ever had, regardless of location. The biscuits and gravy are perfect; hearty white sausage gravy that isn't gloppy, excellent biscuit and exactly-cooked egg to your style. Everything else on the menu looks just as phenomenal, don't think you can make a poor choice here. Bonus: even when busy, their system of seating makes things quick.

I was in Phoenix last weekend visiting the fam, which meant we were definitely out and about on the brunch scene. I've had Vovomeena bookmarked for a couple months or so, and my sister, who lives nearby, assured everyone it was a solid choice.  First, the vibe is super hip, as others have noted. However, I felt very welcomed, even with my parents and a toddler in tow.   The coffee is obviously a main attraction here, and the coffee bar side is worked by a couple guys who seriously know and care about what they are doing. I got a tea latte, since I'm not into coffee, which they had never made, but they were very interested in making helpful suggestions for something I would like.  The food was delicious, and I think between our party of 8, we tried most of the breakfast menu. The Banging Pocket (Shreiner's sausage, duh, it's the only sausage to eat in Phx these days!), the boxty (unique, kinda fruity), johnny cakes (loved! my fave!), mexican benedict, something about 3 sisters that was slightly mexican in style, and the savory crepes....all were really delicious. I even loved the link sausage and I am usually a sausage avoider.  On top of all that, a cool location, and I cannot recomment Vovomeena enough!

Manager asked us to come out and try it again.    This time was so much better, coffee was as great as ever. Food was great.  My dad loved his meal. People were so friendly.    I appreciate that they put the eggs on the side (instead of on pancakes). Without even being asked.  Now if they could just get more comfortable seating...dad (79 yrs old) (no padding on his butt) and I (with back issues) both had troubles getting up from the hard metal chairs.   But I'll just bring cushions next time. Lol

Met clients here for a working lunch and everyone was super impressed. Great laid back atmosphere, service was quick and efficient, and all the food was amazing! Will be adding this place to the regular rotation for sure!
Delicious!! Great coffee and amazing food!! If you haven't been here, you're missing out!!
Highly recommend. Will definitely be back to try something else. Great value as well. Could charge a lot more for the quality of food.   The B.M.O.C. is a BAMF!!  Great coffee too.

I'm always amazed by the uniqueness of Phoenix and the restaurants that are hidden in little corners, just like Vovomeena. I love the mismatched chairs, the simple order at the counter set up and the various cold pour coffees they offer.      I went for a morning brunch with a group of friends on the past rainy Saturday morning. I was torn between every single thing on the menu because it all looked amazing, but wound up getting the 3 Sisters Omelette. I grabbed an O.J. from the little deli case (tasted fresh squeezed!) and a hot coffee. When I went over to the coffee counter and realized they do in house infused coffees I couldn't resist. I got the ginger infused coffee and my friend got the mint one..I was on cloud nine--and not just from all the caffeine!       We sat outside and got sprinkled on but it was perfect all around. Our food came quickly and my omelette was sensational. With black beans, corn, zucchini, mozzarella, feta and two sausages on the side it was a filling meal, but not over the top. The blend of zucchini and black beans with mozz were delicious, I couldn't get over how amazing one of my friends' Pain Perdu looked though. Whiskey caramel sauce? I mean c'mon. That's my next victim for sure.     The staff was friendly, but busy, and the decor is homey and old school vintage. You'll want to sit and relax for awhile while you people watch and sip your delicious drinks!

Vovomeena has become a fast favorite of mine... from their coffee to their original breakfast options. The earlier you show, the better, as options can run out towards the afternoon.   The pain perdu is an absolute must. Banana syrupy goodness! I can't break away from the original eggs-potatoes-bacon / sausage breakfast - it's so nice when a restaurant gets it right! (The jam..get the jam.)   Indoor / outdoor seating. Take a menu off the wall and order with the cashier near the kitchen.
The Banging Pocket is by far one of the best breakfast items in Phoenix. No joke. I get cravings for it. That smoked gouda, man. It makes all the difference.

Got the boxty, a jar of coffee (refillable at 10% off), and the day's special lemon tart. The food came out super fast and it was so good. Pancake-sized boxty (2) with shredded apple and a sweet butter on top, paired with two thick-cut slices of bacon.  It's set up where you grab a menu off the wall and go down the line to order at the end. You can see the cooks working without a glass barrier as you stand in line - so don't sneeze.  If you order a jar of coffee at the food counter, the coffee counter further into the restaurant gets a ticket so you pick it up there. It's a plastic-lidded mason jar with a custom label and is filled from jugs in the fridge. It fills about 4 of the ice-filled tumblers/plastic to-go cups and it totally worth the $10. It's super smooth and tasty and not at all bitter. I barely had to put anything into it; I could definitely drink it black and I usually can't with coffee. The boxty was much larger than I expected and the potato vs. sweet apple flavour was distinct from each other and very complimentary, rather than one overpowering the other. The bacon was super tasty too.  The lemon tart was small and plain but still pretty good. I'm not sure what other offerings they have since it said it was the day's "special" offering. They also had cookies on the counter and a little cooler of bottled drinks and orange juice at the check out.  A filling breakfast with amazing coffee for just over $20! I will definitely be back!   PS. All the people writing reviews and complaining about lack of vegan choices - there are other restaurants that cater to your special, self-imposed diet. Never, ever expect people to cater to you. It's such a stupid reason to criticize a public place.

Went for breakfast... It was very good. I also got a Portuguese doughnut, which to me was like a fluffier funnel cake, SO DELICIOUS! I can't wait to go back and try more menu items. The service was great, very friendly workers.
The coffee is so good it doesn't need sugar.  The orchard French toast is so good it doesn't need syrup.  Nice staff, food served quickly.  Great place.

Love that is little local spot is a jewel among the chains that surround it on 7th Ave.  It is always busy with activity for breakfast/brunch.  Even though I am not a coffee drinker the Japanese cold brew is a favorite with my husband.  The hot chocolate we ordered for our kids was "real!" The food is reasonably priced and tasty.  The service was quick and the manager walks around checking on the tables.
Vovomeena deserves 5 stars!  For the food and the amazing staff!  Kaj the manager is wonderful, it's like you are in a dear friend's home eating the best food!

I will admit that the main reason I went to Vovomeena was because I saw the words Portuguese donuts in other yelpers reviews. In Hawaii, there are these little donuts called malasadas but they are technically Portuguese donuts and they are amazing. So I was hoping to get something close at Vovomeena. I didn't but overall my experience was still good.  The boyfriend and I went early on a Saturday so it wasn't very busy. We looked around lost and confused for a moment until someone came up to us and told us the drill - order at counter and they bring it to your table. I went basic - eggs and bacon, boyfriend went for the French toast and of course we ordered two donuts.  The food came out pretty quickly and the portions were large. My food was good but nothing unbelievable. Boyfriend liked his French toast - it was very dense and heavy so if you're looking for something light, the French toast is not. (I know French toast is not usually a "light" item - I'm just sayin' this was exceptionally heavy.) As excited as we were about the donuts, we were kinda let down. They tasted more like funnel cake than donuts - greasy and heavy.   The staff was nice, the food was okay but I don't think we'll go out of our way to go here again.

Vovomeena was really good. We went on a Saturday around 11 so it was pretty busy but the line moved quickly and we were able to get a table almost immediately after ordering. I was worried about parking but there was a decent size parking lot behind the building and another next to it. I would definitely return and try more from the menu.

Had such high hopes but was utterly disappointed...ordered the Mexican Benedict which was drenched in oil and was incredibly salty --couldn't even finish one...orange juice was good, staff seemed pleasant, the biscuits and gravy were good but nothing spectacular-it was biscuits and gravy. A one and done deal, prob won't be back.

I really enjoyed Vovomeena.  The food was excellent and the portions are great.  I would be hesitant to eat there again on a weekend, though.  It was so busy (good for them!)  Hit it up on a lazy Thursday AM for a great, chill, relaxing breakfast.  The Japanese cold brew coffee is very very tasty!
Excellent local breakfast/brunch cuisine and coffee. Friendly management, plenty of seating.

5 stars for a yummy breakfast, great atmosphere and fabulous coffee!  My husband and I were pretty hungry as were looking for more of a brunch option around 11ish on a Tuesday. And this place had some awesome reviews on Yelp, and it did not disappoint!  I ordered the egg and bacon sandwich on a croissant with home fries and my husband ordered the biscuits and gravy. We both ordered a coffee each. After ordering you food/drink at the register, the coffee station is was located next to the register with hot coffee (decaf as well) and they also featured a Japanese cold brewing area, which was very interesting to watch against the coffee bar wall.  After ordering, everything is self serve. Also for any coffee snubs, they also offering lump sugar, either raw or white. As well as, various milks for your coffee. Also have a water area with cups.  Our meal was so delicious, just want we wanted! The vibe was laid back and the atmosphere was hip. They also had outdoor seating. Next time, I'd love to try the pain perdu.
Great neighborhood joint for breakfast and coffee. Fluffy pancakes, delicious coffee, and fast friendly service! Highly recommended!

The food is great. The rest was really confusing. There isn't anywhere to stand to figure out what you want to eat (because you have to order before sitting). The person who took our order left us mid-sentence for a solid two minutes without explanation. Getting seated felt like we were inconveniencing them. Your food is delivered but you have to go to another counter to get your coffee. And we were sat in a location where other patrons and staff kept walking into our chairs. The whole experience was stressful lol I might be inclined to go again if it were midweek and we were the only ones in there but that's not realistic. So they certainly went out of my life with a bang.
Nice little joint to visit- food was decent, long waits so I would probably pick this place on a weekday after the rush.

I tried their biscuits and gravy, I had been hesitant to try it at first.  Needless to say I was rewarded with what I consider to be the valley's best biscuits and gravy hands down.  My wife and I and big fans of this place, they have great food.

My family and I visited this place on Father's Day. It was a little bit hard to find because the location is kind of hidden. However , when we finally did we were helped rather quickly despite of how busy they were. The food was delicious, and a good size too. Their coffee is great and the employees are friendly and helpful   They lost a star unfortunately because it took a bit to find, and it was slightly on the pricier side but worth it! We had a little bit of a miscommunication with one of the workers that left a little bit of a bad taste but nothing that will probably keep us from coming back

Great spot. We came at 10am on a Friday so there was plenty of seating. The owner/manager maybe came to me and asked if I'd been in before, gave me a menu and said to order at the counter when I was ready. I waited for my friend and we ordered our plates along with orange juice.  Food came out fairly quick and everything looked fresh and good. I got the Wilcox Avenue breakfast, which included two eggs, spuds, biscuit and choice of meat (which I declined). I also got a Portuguese donut which came with jam and was tasty. I enjoyed my meal and it was filling and affordable. My friend got the Pawtucket West and her two pancakes were ginormous. She also liked her choices and the juice was refreshing. Definitely recommend this spot, great service as well.

Delicious dishes with nice staff. What else we need? I went there twice. The first time I had banana bread pudding. It is awesome, not too sweet and a bit burn  which made a perfect combo. I had Mexican Benedict on the second time. It is good and tasted totally different from the first dish I had. I cannot believe that them came from the same kitchen. Amazing.

All I can say is that this nice comfortable, neighborhood place is at the top of our list for breakfast!  Get there early, place your order and find a spot (and it's a good time of year to sit outside). Can you say 'tasty' food with an eclectic touch to the menu?  Try something outside the box. You can't go wrong the Banging Pocket (with local Schreiner's Sausages), the Mexican Benedict (excellent) or the Orchard French Toast. Great coffee and juice too.
ice brew coffee! with my traditional mexican benedict and chicken/waffle/pork chop/egg delight  use promo code for first free ride: uberSF8

I'll set another scene for you...in a strange city and foodie breakfast tendencies kick in...Yelpers recommend Vovomeena!  Score!  The most difficult part was choosing savory or sweet.  I had the caramelized banana pudding French toast.  Wonderful!  Coffee, good and strong and they had almond milk.  The bacon was also super-lean.  Yum.  My comrades had the sopes with egg and chorizo and the chicken crepes and loved them both.  Bought some cold coffee with cardamom to go.  Delicious.

The service here is super fast! They have a great system set up. You order your food, get a number, go to the drink counter to claim your drink and wait for the manager to seat you afterwards. It is free seating though so you can easily have someone in your party find a table while you order. The food was good. I love their potatoes, very flavorful. Its a mexican/latin breakfast joint. The chamomile tea was disappointing because it was sweet..chamomile tea is not meant to be sweet/I did not get a disclaimer that it was sweetened. I got the mexican benedict which was good.
If you are looking for an awesome breakfast  you will  need to go here. The service is incredible and the food is perfect
A little busy in the morning at all times, but once you taste they're unique twist on food it makes the wait seem like nothing. Definitely recommended especially when out on girls day or w/ friends!

Great coffee if you like cold brew and fast yet delicious food.    I had the banging pocket which was a delicious pita stuffed with eggs, awesome Schreiner's sausage, and smoked gouda.  I also tried the Tortilla Espanola which is a great take on the traditional Spanish omelet.  In Spain, tortilla = omelet so don't expect any circular discs of cooked masa.  The Portuguese donuts are tasty treats as well.  Basically, they're fried dough with powdered sugar on top.  Simple and yummy.    The line moved quickly and the food came out rapidly and accurately.  The price is fair as you can have a very hearty breakfast for two with coffee for about $25-$30.  There's patio seating or plenty of tables on the interior.  If in the 7th Ave area, this is a great breakfast/brunch spot.

I had heard numerous good things about this place and finally took a day off work so I could stop by during a weekday morning. Since it was a weekday, it wasn't very busy. The parking was difficult to find, but there was plenty of parking once I figured it out. I was looking forward to trying a flight of their Japanese Cold Brew but unfortunately the guy who normally does it wasn't working that day. Instead, I tried an iced coffee. It was very good with the right balance of sweet and strong. To eat, I ordered the biscuits & gravy -  buttermilk biscuits, white sausage gravy, and two eggs on top. My husband ordered the Mexican Benedict - poached eggs, chorizo, hollandaise sauce on an English muffin with fried potatoes. After ordering and paying inside, we sat outside on the cute patio. Our food was delivered rather quickly. My biscuits and gravy dish was very good. The sausage gravy was very flavorful and the biscuits were very fluffy and tender. My husband's dish was also very tasty - the chorizo being the star of the plate. Overall, everything we tried was very good and would recommend others to try as well. Their pain perdu - a bread pudding French toast - looks and sounds delicious. I'll definitely be back to try a few other items.

The breakfast and brunch here was great.  Loved the atmosphere.  We had the special of the day which was a prime rib sandwich.  The kids had pancakes and waffles and all tasted great.  The portuguese donuts were great.  Will definitely come back again.

LOVE this place. Everything we've tried (tortilla Espa√±ola, banging pocket, johnnycakes, savory cr√™pe, and the Providence) were all excellent. The coffee is fantastic. The flow for counter service is a little confusing on the first visit, but on our most-recent trip, the guy at the coffee bar was doing a great job directing traffic and explaining the process to the first-timers with confused expressions. The breakfast sausage is the best around; it tastes like it's cooked in the rendered fat from a slow-roasted pork shoulder--layer upon layer of porky deliciousness that gets Vovomeena a fifth star.

We went here kinda buying into the yelp hype and we were slightly let down. The coffee was fantastic and strong. The food was just alright but I may be spoiled comparing it to other places around town. I tried the bmoc some crepes dish and the Mexican Benedict and all were tasty just not really my cup of tea. I would say the chorizo on the biscuit with a poached egg tasted the best of everything I tried. The service was great and the atmosphere was trendy and hip. This would be a good place to take someone new on a breakfast date. I may give it another shot later down the road and update my review but as of right now I think the stars fit the place.

Not only is the food fantastic, but the service is beyond.   Having moved here from the Bay Area, I was spoiled with great food and quality people, and there are very few places here that can measure up - Vovomeena is one of them!  Came in this morning for the amazing biscuits & gravy and had a side of a pancake - delicious as always!  And the coffee - OMG!   One little snag - the water had a funny taste. Mentioned it to the manager, Kaj, and he promptly brought us a bottle of water! Really above what's necessary, but just a sign of the high quality of customer service.   If you haven't been, you have to visit. If you haven't been in a while, you have to come back!

If your looking for something a little different for breakfast/brunch, this is it. All of their dishes have a slightly different twist to them and everything I have tried there so far has been delicious.

First off, I spent a great deal of time trying to figure out just what in the hell Vovomeena is supposed to mean. To me, it sounds like the name of some badly designed budget-friendly economy car model from the 90s that was plagued with mechanical problems and ultimately had to be recalled due to safety issues. Unfortunately, I was wrong. It's actually named after the owner's grandmother, so that's that.  We've visited Vovomeena a couple of times, with a good two-year gap in-between both stops. The place has both indoor and outdoor seating and is going for the caf√©-styled order at the counter approach. Be warned that if you're visiting later in the day, they will inevitably be out of something - which has happened to us on both occasions.   From what I've experienced, you're fine playing it safe with something like the Willcox Avenue, which consists of your traditional eggs, meat choice (bacon in our case), and a biscuit or toast - although it can be swapped out with a pancake if you wish. The plate also includes spuds, which are potato slices that are only very lightly cooked and served up in pretty small portions. However, everything is very good quality.  If you want to get a bit crazy, go with the B.M.O.C., which consists of a waffle that's topped with a pork chop, two eggs, and a Portuguese donut. The combination is something that people will either love or loathe, depending on how your brain is wired. Personally, I thought it was good, but a bit too heavy on the stomach for someone like myself. I'm glad I tried it, but I doubt I'd order it again.  Vovomeena seems to have its fair share of fans. When studying the menu, they clearly have a nice balance of both unique creations and traditional items that isn't overwhelming. Although I doubt I'd ever put it into regular rotation, it's worth visiting on those Sunday mornings when I'm in the mood to do some brunch experimentation.  Recommended!

Positive  The counter person/severs awesome people!   Cool coffee bar   Poached egg was perfect   Negative   There is a smell of drainage or sewer that hits you in the face once you get towards the back by the bigger tables  Spuds were cold   OJ was in plastic containers for here not eco friendly   No VERY vegetarian friendly   Biscuits were dry

We tried Vovoveema for a second time, especially since it's so close to us, and it was an awesome dining experience. We tried a variety of menu options including the crepes, challah bread and the pita-burrito (the name escapes me!) everything was fresh and flavorful, we sat outside which was lovely and the manager was exceptionally friendly, stopping by everyone's table to say hello and make sure they were happy with their order.The flair and variety made it so whatever mood you were in there was bound to be something on the menu that would hit the spot ;) We will definitely be going again!

Very cool, tasty gem of a restaurant. Went for breakfast & had a very good meal & experience. I had the banger pocket and my wife had the 3 sisters omelette. Both were excellent and more than enough food. In fact, from the plates I saw, most meals were big enough to split.

The best brunch in Phoenix. BMOC was amazing and full of great flavor!  It took less than 10 mins until our freshly cooked meal was ready in front of us, from the time we walked in the door. Best pork chop ever!!!!

So disappointed, the papa espanola wasn't what I expected and the salsa it was topped with was just roasted tomoatoes, I thought it would have some spice to it. The arugula was really plain, not even a salad.  The kids had the tiny, baby pancakes with a piece of bacon.  Nothing impressed me unfortunately and again, this must have been a time I picked the wrong thing from the menu considering how others are raving.......not a place I'm willing to visit again based on the proportions and the taste.  Also, the place was really packed, so be prepared to wait or eat outside.

Amazing food!!! The Mexican Benedict tasted just like a tamale and the coffee was so good. I loved the laid back atmosphere and the waiters were so sweet. If you are downtown, this place is a must-eat restaurant

Reviews is based on the Savory Crepe and Bangin Pocket.  Atmosphere - the wood decor was unique  and love the outdoor patio   Food - both dishes were super yummy and filling   The latte was also very amazing...for sure better than Starbucks   The manager and staffs were professional and friendly.  If I live around here I would come often esp the weekends!

We went here to try something new and are so glad we did!  Food was excellent!  Atmosphere is eclectic but comfortable and inviting.  Super clean and staff is friendly and helpful.  Will definitely be back!!

Strange layout and awkward way to get coffee. I think this place would work better as actual "sit down" service, not counter service.   But I digress, food here is incredible. Got the biscuits and gravy, wow, have not had such good gravy in years! Go try it out!

This was an awesome little "find" for breakfast. The Mexican Benedict for sure next time. All of the breakfast choices were amazing, I couldn't decide. I ended up having the classic biscuits and gravy with scrambled eggs, SERIOUSLY the best! No disappointments there! It's so hard to find a GOOD QUALITY independent eatery! We drove out from Surprise.......totally worth the drive. It's unfortunate we're surrounded by people who find the standard Denny's, IHOP, Mimi's, Village Inn, Waffle House and Cracker Barrel good food.  EXCELLENT!!

This place is AWESOME!!! I have no ties to this place.  We have been try lots of new places lately and striking out all over the place so it was great to find VOVOMEENA today.   Highly recommend you try it!

I went here on a Sunday and it was super busy. There was a line out the door, but they were pretty quick.  The waiter and waitresses provided excellent service and they had a friendly staff. I like the fact that you can watch the chefs cook as we waited in line to make our order at the register.  This place is super cute and cozy with a laid back atmosphere. The food was freshly made and came out on a timely manner. I ordered the tortilla espanol with sausage, and it was fantastic. My boyfriend ordered the toast with strawberries, which was nice because it wasn't too sweet. Would definitely recommend if you're in this area!

One of the other Yelpers mentioned this place was like the restaurant from the "Brunch Village" episode from Portlandia and they were absolutely right! Phoenix has its version of "Fisherman's Porch" and it does what it does well.  That being said, this place is not for everyone. If you are not gastro-venturous and willing to pay for being so, then this is probably not your scene.  I was actually happy to find that I literally beat the crowd Sat around 11am (there was absolutely no one in line when I placed my order and the second I was handed my number there was a line out the door..,?). They have an interesting service setup here, which again, only works for a place like this. It is quasi-counter service in that you order at the counter and are given a number and afterwards can choose your seat. They also have a coffeebar, where you see the japanese cold brew drips hourglassing above, where you can pick up your ordered beverages. Based on your number, your food is brought to your table.  I ordered the mexican benedict (warning, the sauce and chorizo do have a somewhat spicy kick to them) which was delicious. The potatoes in other reviews were mentioned as "mushy" but I did not find them to be so. They were not as crispy as they could have been, but definitely leaned towards the cooked rather than soft side. I also loved that they have a "coffee flight" of their japanese cold brews. The ones I sampled were the "straight", vanilla cocao, and an lemon jalapeno. The latter was the only one I did not care for. I could have had a full serving of the vanilla cocoa as the density of the coffee balanced out the sweetness of the flavoring and was just perfection!   I ended my meal with a portuguese donut, which is, imho, the lovechild of a beignet and indian fry bread, and I will say, their offspring was exquisitely delicious!  The space itself was great and I loved the rustic contempo decor. The patio seating area is a kind of shared space w/the entrance to the courtyard of the little shopping center they occupy. Parking is a little limted, but thankfully I didn't have any issues finding a space.  All in all, a fantastic experience and should I ever find myself in the downtown area (or short drive from Sky Harbor) again, I will make a detour.

My favorite breakfast spot by far. Vovo has an intriguing ambiance and a creative menu. The food is always excellent and the iced coffee rules over all others. Don't go during prime breakfast hours or you risk having a disappointing experience; it gets waaay busier than it's queuing model has the capacity to handle.   Many favor matt's big breakfast over vovo, but I don't get it; matt's is boring by comparison.

Our very first stop in Arizona. If the rest of the trip has food like this, we're in for a treat. Really cute and cool decor with incredibly delicious and inventive menu items. The Pain Perdu is a must...banana bread pudding French toast, whiskey caramel and delicious sausage and/or potatoes. We also enjoyed the Orchard French toast with honey marscapone. The Banging Pocket looks delicious and will make it on our next visit. Delicious coffee, fresh squeezed orange juice, friendly staff and cool jazz music have combined to get our vacation off to a great start.

We came for breakfast at about ten on a Sunday morning. Our table had Mexican Benedict, pancakes, and biscuits and gravy. The food is good, home style cooking but didn't seem outstanding. Everyone liked their food with the exception of the hash browns being a little below average.  Would we come back?  Probably in the winter but it's maybe not good enough to come back, stand in line and then eat outside in Phoenix in July.

The service was great. Every single person who worked here was nice and helpful.  The location right off the 10 was extremely convenient.  The food was good, a bit eccentric, but different and fun. I wasn't a big fan of the mocha but my mom liked her coffee. The beans were roasted in Cave Creek. You grab a menu when you come in and then jump in line and place your order and then pay at the counter then find a table and they bring you your food and take your dishes away when you are finished. It's very well run. I had the biscuits and gravy and my mom had the Mexican eggs Benedict. I'm from Chicago and only like Chicago style sausage, so I wasn't a big fan of the sausage in either, but it's a chorizo so it's different.  Those two meals and the coffee and mocha plus two orange juices was $40, so a bit pricey, but good.  It filled us both up.

This place was great.  They have a nice outdoor seating area as well as plenty of room inside to sit.  The decor is really nice--it felt like I was stepping inside a West Elm catalog.    As for the food, we loved it.  I had apple/potato pancakes and my husband had the Mexican benedict--both were fantastic.  Oh and the coffee is fresh and hot, which is also a plus.    The staff was friendly and helpful.  I'd definitely go back when I am in the area again.

Ordered the Mexican Benedict and boy was it tasty! The sopes soak up the sauce from the chorizo and the meal has just enough spice. Side of potatoes were really nicely cooked too.  Love the location because the parking lot doesn't get too packed and the restaurant is very quaint. Would come back in a heartbeat next time I'm in the area!

The americano here is some of the best i've had. So smooth. Perfect temperature. We came to Phoenix on vacation and went here almost every day!  Food is excellent. Tried a number of things including the mexican benedict, savoury crepe. The pancakes are so fluffy. Perfect.  Highly recommended.

I don't know where to begin.....the service, atmosphere and the food was perfect. I was quickly greeted as soon as I entered the door by a very kind man who I found out was the manager. He gave me a menu and explained a little bit about the process of what to expect when dining here. While you wait in line to place your order you're able to watch the cooks grill up some of the tasty plate options which makes it even tougher to figure out what you want to eat. The aroma from the grill is just intoxicating!! Ok.... focus!!! :) So, the juice if freshly squeezed here too. Talk about every single detail was evaluated here. You are seated after you order your food so don't pick a table prematurely. You can choose to dine in or outside either way the atmosphere is very inviting. So back to the food. I've had the chorizo, biscuits and gravy, waffles and chicken, and the ham. Everything tasted spectacular and was cooked perfectly. The way that they plate the food here is a work of art. I guess you can see that I'm a fan. So fellow yelpers and foodies you need to come and check this spot out if you haven't already, see you there!
It was a nice place but extremely overcrowded. Kind of a funky concept in that you have to wait to be seated but aren't actually waited on. The food was overpriced and our service was terrible.

The Mexican eggs benedict was awesome.  One star off because they don't have Sriracha but I'm pretty sure we talked them into getting some so they can still win it back.  The French toast was also awesome.  The location is cute and a nice size.  I think this was a great addition to the area.  Get some Japanese cold brew.
Johnny Cakes w prickly pear syrup, damn good.

Must try! Being from Los Angeles where there is a ton of amazing food options, I was surprised there weren't a lot of hip brunch options in Phoenix, but thanks to yelp, I found this spot! Great, amazing, scrumptious food! To top it off, the service is phenomenal!! If I'm ever in Phoenix again, this is the one stop I am adding to my list.

I had the 3 sisters omelette and my girlfriend had the savory crepes. The omelette was nicely done and the corn added a nice flavor to it. The bacon was crisp and well seasoned and not too salty. The crepes were also delicious.

Beautiful shabby chic interior. Great cafe style ordering of food. Wonderful service. Food was impeccable! Japanese cold brewed coffee was to die for!  I've been here a good handful of times and tried something different from the menu each time.  My favorite so far is either the Mexican Benedict or the Banging Pocket. Each has its merits.   This gem is from the same folks that brought us Tuck Shop and Astor House. The same staff from what I remember from Astor house, even, if I remember correctly. Everyone is super friendly regardless.  Just one more reason to love breakfast. Thanks Vovomeena!

Couple of things...  1.) Probably the best breakfast food I have had in a long time. Albeit, √ºber sinful, it was very delicious. I would give five stars, but...  2.) They could stand to figure out their seating situation. The seating is organized like a Carl Jr's (ordering food, get a number, then sit). This causes table chaos, because people come in, scope out a spot, then a representative from the table places the order. I call shenanigans, because my wife and I had to order than wait, then literally run to the first available table.   As we finished up, the line grew out the door, and I felt bad for the poor suckers who were going to give Vovomeena their cash, then have to stand and wait for a table to open up.   We were sure to let the manager know this problem, but not sure what's in store for their future.
Great coffee!  My ONLY complaint....why, oh why do you have to close at 1:30 pm?!  That is right when I'm wanting to start heading to a coffee shop to chill and work.  ugh!

Cute small little place with just average food.  Maybe if you come here with no expectations you might enjoy it more than we did.  The staff of very nice and accommodating.  The place is kept clean and tidy.   But in my opinion overpriced.  I don't cook but I think I could have made a better breakfast sandwich and omelet at home.
What a wonderful place for breakfast.   Great concept great execution.  Fabulous coffee.  Makes me wish I lived in Phoenix.
Quick service. Great food!  Even though the line was long, it moved along very efficiently.
Had the amazing Mexican eggs Benedict! I never would have thought to replace the English muffin with a sope, so creative and tasty. The ice coffee was delectable. Thanks Yelpers for helping me decide

I am hard to impress when it comes to breakfast.  The food was alright, nothing to write home about.  You won't find crispy potatoes and the pancakes are thin and soggy.  We tried the donut and it tasted of the dirty oil it was fried in. Everything else was average. The ambience is fresh and casual.  You order at a counter, receive a number and take a seat.  I wouldn't come out of my way to eat here, but if I found myself here through friends, I wouldn't object.

10/25/12  Cool-looking eatery!  Loved the artwork, especially the mosaic pieces, and I liked the twist taken by using recycled twine as a dividing line between the pathway and the tables.  Way too cool!  :)  http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/vovomeena-phoenix?select=lNWXre8YuohFjH0CE08kuA#lNWXre8YuohFjH0CE08kuA http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/vovomeena-phoenix?select=zWLgge2mUuG7i232sb-BOA#zWLgge2mUuG7i232sb-BOA http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/vovomeena-phoenix?select=x3WxOi5yqaNPJsVNdKLaJA#x3WxOi5yqaNPJsVNdKLaJA  I've eaten here twice, once with a friend (see photos taken on 09/30/12).  The first time, we ordered a few items and shared, and we were both blown away by the very-high quality and big portions of the dishes we tried.  My favorites then were the Pain Perdu with Schreiner's sausage, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/vovomeena-phoenix?select=KF5Mrjny8RrmU1wkGEDBNw#KF5Mrjny8RrmU1wkGEDBNw and the B.M.O.C.-- a HUGE bone-in pork chop presented on a lovely waffle, topped with two fried eggs, with caramelized apples in whiskey sauce to garnish.  http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/vovomeena-phoenix?select=9BLumlsGZoBPrBvWRvQDTQ#9BLumlsGZoBPrBvWRvQDTQ  We tried two other items, the Banging Pocket (didn't impress me) and Boxty (I found it too greasy).  On my October visit, I was disappointed in the much-smaller portioned Pain Perdu I received, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/vovomeena-phoenix?select=5Jbb8gMJPv1WlkyySATCNg#5Jbb8gMJPv1WlkyySATCNg and the pieces were so dense, they weren't much fun to eat. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/vovomeena-phoenix?select=DDmVrbDoa7yz2OGsznjbjg#DDmVrbDoa7yz2OGsznjbjg  The coffee was still very good, however.  Five stars for the first visit, and 1 star for the second- great coffee, and free refills to boot, so what's not to love?, so an average of 3 stars.  Will return to try the B.M.O.C. again.  Hope to bump it up to four stars, which is a good review from me, as I'm assuming this isn't a GMO-free establishment...
Great breakfast. You must try Mexican Eggs Benedict ! Sopes are authentic as is chorizo!

Great energy and positive vibes at this pleasant surprise of a brunch spot. Food was excellent as was the friendly staff. Left stuffed to the gills with yummy deliciousness. Will return on the next Phoenix visit...wish this place was in my neighborhood in California. Thanks Vovomeena!

If you have had a night out and wake up with the worst hangover of your life, this place will revive you! My friends and i come here just about every weekend. Today, all three of us got the chicken and waffles special and it was the BEST thing I have EVER eaten in my entire life. Love, love, LOVE.
Awesome food. Many recommended the Mexican benne but I preferred the biscuits and gravy.

The food is excellent, the prices are very fair and the customer service is excellent. Super cute hipster location with an open kitchen. When we walked in we were greeted by a friendly guy who seemed to fit the roll of a manager. He explained how it works, you order at the counter first and get a number and there always seems to be enough open space (tables) once you order and get your number. The server will bring your food out a few minutes later.   We all opted for the fresh orange juice, which was outstanding! We had the Pain Perdu which I didn't care for.  I was thinking Pain Perdu was going to be a banana French toast/ bread pudding type of deal, but to me it taste like soggy fruit cake with bananas over it and a rich caramel sauce.The floating manager guy was super accommodating and recommended the Orchard French toast as a replacement. Yummy. The French toast was perfect with the apple ribbons to provide a nice subtle Apple crunch and flavor change throughout the dish. We had Johnny pancakes with eggs over easy which was my fav. The pancakes are huge and delicious and the eggs were perfectly seasoned and cooked. We had pork sausage, turkey sausage and the potatoes side. All were delicious! The sausage was hearty, a bit spicy and good sized, but most importantly, not oily so the high quality of meat should definitely be noted. This was the best turkey sausage I've ever had. We also got the waffle kid's meal which comes with 3 delicious fluffy waffle sections and a sausage for $4.95.   2 adult meals, a kids meal and 3 fresh orange juice for $33 is a very great deal. We can't wait to go back and try more of the menu.

From the outside this place is difficult to distinguish as a restaurant, I thought it was a woman's clothing boutique forever. We waited in line to order, it went fairly quick for a busy weekend brunch rush. The kitchen is open so you can see where all of the magic happens =-) I ordered the 3 sisters omelet and it was very interesting. A lot of flavors I would not traditionally put together but actually worked really well. My husband got the banging pocket and enjoyed his as well. They have a separate coffee station if you just need a pick me up. Reasonable prices and cute hipster little place to check out if you have not already.

We went on Mother's Day around 9:00 am and they were able to put tables together for the 10 of us. The service people were very nice and friendly. We really liked the food. Among all of us, we had just about everything on the menu. If I had never had Matt's hashbrowns and bacon, I would have thought theirs were great. Still good though. I had the BMOC and it was wonderful. My husband had the Grilllades. He hates biscuits and gravy so I was surprised. He liked it and the fact that it was spicy probably really helped. I tasted the pancakes and waffles that others had and they also were very good. Based on just one visit, we will definitely go again.

This has been our best breakfast we've had since we move here from Pennsylvania. I had the biscuits and gravy. The biscuit was the size of my hand and the gravy is the best I've had. We will be back to try the rest of the menu.

I'll give it a five star! First the place, very unique, nice art work outside the building. Second, the people that work there are very nice. The person in charge or the owner? (not sure who checked on us on how we're doing.) But thanks for checking on us. Third, the food was fantastic! We got the b.m.o.c and the blackstone scramble and i cannot pass the opportunity to try the japanese cold brew coffee, i got the flight o'-  black tea, orange peel & ginger, lemon & jalape√±o. It was very unique! The downside was they ran out of hollandaise sauce for the mexican benedict that's why we ordered blackstone scramble instead. I will come back for sure!

Just finished a truly fantastic breakfast at this place. Egg sandwich was delicious - sauce was very tasty and just the right amount. The Johnny cakes are an experience not to be missed - essentially a pancake with real corn and Chile inside. So so good.

The food was great but the seating arrangement was not so great. Although we didn't have to wait long to get seated it was cramped and uncomfortable. We will return and hopefully go on a less busy day.

Saturday morning trip downtown PHX and our tummies were hungry, hungry for great food at that.  If anyone were to ask me about Vovomeena I would describe them in one word: consistent.  Consistency for years and years of us coming here, I took a photo on IG in May of 2013 and since then they've only improved!   If you want a party in your mouth, dine here.  If you're timid on trying new things, don't dine here.  They specialize in dishes you won't see anywhere else and the menu proves that!  I highly recommend VOvomeena if you are ready to take breakfast up a notch!

What a fun place. Delicious coffee!!  The decor is spontaneously surreptitious and valiant. I liked the rope decor and the folks there were friendly. I had the enormous pancakes which were as cakey as a cake can be. My son, Pogo, had the biscuits and eggs which he described as "voluminous" and "good". My wife enjoyed the veggie burrito which I tried and loved it!  Really good place and delish! Highly recommend this little gem in a gem of a town.
Good eats!  Had the blackstone scramble. Really good. I'd add cheese. Homemade tortillas are awesome.

Food is very flavorful. There service is different as other restaurant but it works. I love their food it's different it tastes home made and the flavor sit has are outstanding . They are a little pricier than other breakfast joints BUT so worth it. Give it a try!

The food was great as well as the cold brew.  The reason for 4 stars is the less than friendly staff. No one was out right rude, but only 1-2 staff actually even smiled. I also am not a really big fan of the order at the counter and seat yourself concept. But I had the Johnny Cakes and was extremely happy. My husband has the Mexican Eggs Benedict and said it was quite tasty.
Pretty tasty breakfast, had the mexican benedict which was savory and spicy.  Ordered a side of pork sausage which was ok but not great.  I shall return for the benedict, very delicious.
After months of eating at Vovomeena, I'm not sure why I shop for groceries any more.  My only complaint?  I wish they were open later.

The gentleman with the glasses greeted us on arrival and he was very friendly. He told us how things work here where you look over the menu, order what ya want, then you sit wherever you'd like. He was very accommodating throughout our entire visit and made us feel at home. The food omg the food was amazing. I had the Mexican Benedict and my gf had the biscuits, gravy and eggs. They were sooooo good the egg was delicious and the chorizo was very good not too salty and everything being on top of the sope I highly recommend this dish. The biscuits were nice and fluffy and the gravy was very flavorful. Next time I'm in the Arizona area this is definitely going to be my go to spot for breakfast. Thank you so much to the man in glasses who I believe was the owner for his hospitality my family and I appreciated it very much. To anyone reading supporting local businesses like Vovomeena are just as good as finding gold I tell ya.

Do you watch that show 'Portlandia'? If so, then you're already familiar with this place. Not because the restaurant itself is featured in the show (it's not), but because this restaurant is the sort of place that they're always poking tongue-in-cheek fun of. It's hipsterish, it's a wee bit self-important, and you'll come up on phrases like 'hand-crafted' a LOT, but the simple fact of the matter is that they've got DAMNED good food, some DAMNED good coffee, a DAMNED friendly staff, and DAMNED adequate seating.  We came here for brunch (oh shut up) and thoroughly enjoyed our experience. You *ARE* going to be surrounded by Caucasian hipsters with children named Schuyler and Harrison, but that shouldn't turn you off too much. This place has gotten some good buzz lately, and I'm thinking that they'll probably just get more and more crowded in the coming months. That's why you need to get out there RIGHT NOW and enjoy some good food and good coffee, so when you take your friends with you you can be all like:    "Oh yeah you know I used to come here all the time before it was popular"  And you'll be a better person for it.

Craving biscuits and gravy and reviewers raved about them here. The gravy itself wasn't all that flavorful, but it was full of sausage chunks that helped. The biscuit was a bit stale; almost like they had used a day-old biscuit in my dish. My boyfriend had the pancakes and enjoyed those, though.

This is the hipsterest place I've been to, I think, ever. And I yelp a lot and consider myself a bit of a food hipster. I think I'm taking off the star because I felt almost uncomfortable eating there, like I might stain or break some piece of art or antique children that was made by the blind albino children of Nepal (but only the ones named Frank). Can a space be *too* atmospheric? I didn't think so... but I appear to have been proven wrong.  The breakfast was great, though, I had the grillades. Nice, rich, buttery biscuits, delicious peppery gravy, and chunks of very tender beef. Only ding was that they could do scrambled, over easy/medium/hard or sunny side up - nothing else. That covers 96% of the requests out there, but hey, I'm a food hipster, right? I like my eggs basted.

Had a day off and thought I'd amble down here today..friends had recommended it.  Had the orchard french toast, bacon and coffee.  The bacon was tasty, the apple slices on the french toast were a good touch.  Nice little place, good decor.  A little unusual in that you get your own coffee (no table service).   Definitely will try again.

This is a great breakfast spot. Terrific omelettes and scrambles with unique flavor combinations and excellent meats, bacon,sausages etc...  vegetarian options as well, of course. The biscuits are excellent, and the Portuguese donuts are simply sublime.

Johnnycakes ($8.50): Corn and chile cakes, prickly pear maple syrup, sweet rice, and sausage. Omgosh, this is soo good! It's like a pancake, but made with corn and chile. The flavor is amazing and I loved the texture (tender inside like a buttermilk pancake with a crispy exterior). The fresh strawberries and syrup was fantastic with it. The sweet rice was a cinnamon rice pudding that was good, but an odd addition to the cakes.  Mexican Benedict ($10.95): Poached eggs, chorizo, tomato, cilantro, hollandaise on sopes with spuds. I just love variations of the traditional benedict and this one really hit the mark for me. The sopes were wonderful and such a great alternative to the English muffin. Obviously, chorizo is always great and it worked really well here; also, its spice was toned down a bit by the hollandaise. The spuds were tasty, too.  You order and pay at the counter and then grab a table. The menu is fun; I definitely have my eye on other items for another visit, however, those Johnnycakes are a must again! Fantastic service.
Delish! I ordered the Pawtucket west and added 2 OM eggs. The perfect mixture of sweet and savory.

Quite possibly my favorite breakfast place in Phoenix.  Working my way through the menu. Don't count out any specials. Love the outdoor patio, flies, not so much. My 1st breakfast was the Mexican Benedict, today it's the special, Portuguese scramble, eggs w/linguica, peppers & potatoes. Very filling!!

I loved the people in here (employees were super friendly)....I loved the patio. I loved the free parking. The design and little kitchy things that made this place unique.   My husband said his espresso was excellent. Seemed like a super popular place.   I feel like the menu could be better somehow. Wish they had poached eggs.   This was my only problem: I discovered a hair in my food.....I was upset. I didn't tell anyone. I was grossed out.   The people, staff were welcoming and super friendly. That part I loved.
Stellar food. Yummm & sooo creative. Had the corn cakes (pancakes). Sooo good. Bacon is flavorful. Top notch ingredients. Eat here!

Shared a Mexican Benedict and a banana bread French toast. I was a little disappointed in the French toast. There were whole slices of banana in the bread that were dry in texture. The Benedict was wonderful and had a kick to it. It was served on top of a corn tortilla type muffin and really added to the flavor. The Devore and staff were wonderful. I would definitely go back and try more items off the menu.
Wow! What a hidden gem! The food is unique and absolutely delicious! I'll be back for sure! I had my heart set on a breakfast burrito.. Try the bangin pocket. Holy cow.. Delicious!

Now this is breakfast! Just landed in Phoenix and my family and me were so hungry. Peanuts on the plane are cool, but I need some substance. And substance did I get. Looked to my trusty Yelpers for a place near the hotel and this was the first place to come up. Didn't even bother to look at the menu, Siri, tell me where to go.   When we arrived, we had to park in a tiny lot, where cars circle in hopes for a spot to open. Luckily, someone was leaving as we were coming. Inside is super cute with seating inside and shaded seating outside. Here you grab a menu, order, then seat yourself. Menus are on the wall, we had a time finding them. Everything had a name that I'm not used to reading. On a whim, I ordered Johnnycakes, which was 2 corn & chile cakes, sweet rice, syrup, and potatoes.  No egg and no meat, the guy put extra potatoes. Ok, sir, you're cool and already know me!  My family placed their orders and we all waited patiently. All the plates came out relatively close to one another and we dug in. Now, looking from the outside, you would not guess at all what you were about to bite into, but it was a pleasant surprise. It was literally corn & chile! With the syrup and sweet rice it was just too delicious. The cakes were a good size, too. And there were strawberries on top. My. Goodness. I couldn't stop. Then to the potatoes ,which were perfectly crispy some bites. I was in breakfast heaven, and I'm not a big fan unless is basic. But this blew all the other breakfasts out of the orange juice!
