My family really enjoyed theirs too as their plates were empty. I couldn't finish all of mine, I think the extra spuds got me, since I finished those.

Very good food. Had the b.m.c.o. Comes layered with waffle on the bottom covered with apple-maple syrup. Much better than regular maple syrup. The next layer is the best part it was the smoked pork chop grilled to perfection and fork tender. The scrambled eggs on top got the smoke flavor too. Yummy. The other meal ordered was the Wilcox avenue. Scrambled eggs, bacon and wheat toast. All good. Cold brewed coffee is not bitter. Will be back for sure. Counter service very friendly.
First time there today. Definitely will go back. Great service and the food and coffee are excellent.
Great food and atmosphere! The coffee bar is also a nice touch. I had the Mexican eggs benedict and it was phenomenal! Fast and friendly service as well. Will definitely be back!

Pretty dang good. This place is a hidden hole in the wall. Firstly, the orange juice is bomb. It's a stupid thing to comment on, but do not underestimate a glass of fresh squeezed orange juice. Also, take their advice, the biscuits and gravy are phenomenal. It's what dreams are made of. Will definitely have to bring some friends here to try it out also. Thanks guys!
This place is great. Worth a try. Recommend not looking at yelp and just ordering what you find interesting

I came here on Sunday for brunch and I told my friend who was with me that we should go somewhere else so we don't have to wait in line! Turns out going to this restaurant was the best decision I made that day!   The staff was really friendly and I asked several questions about the menu and the waiter was really patient with me!   The cold brew that I ordered was bigger than I expected which is always a plus and I ordered the BMOC which has a good blend of hearty smoked pork and a sweet syrup so you get the best of both worlds!   I definitely can't wait to go back and explore more of the menu!
This was my first time here this morning. I must say this was the best food ever! Good selection of food, the portions are huge!  Staff friendly. I will definitely be going back

Kind of an interesting vibe in here... Asian mixed with nautical theme? The coffee was really not great, but I got the breakfast sandwich and it was pretty good. We tried the savory crepes as well which I didn't like as much. The man at the register who greeted us was very, very nice, and it didn't take us too long to get our food. They have a nice patio space outside.
Second time here....the biscuits and gravy are to die for, but if you don't like spicy maybe ask for easy gravy. Came in today and devoured the pancakes (Primrose Hill). Coffee is good too!

This place was a little hard to find, but i found it! And thank god i did! Its a cute little resturant, very mellow inside. I ordered the pain perdu and it was awesome! VERY different from what im used too but very good. The pain perdu came with bacon which was a nice mix of sweet and savory. The texture of the bread was a little weird reminded me if i was eating a very very stiff but moist cake. The only downfall i think would be there are A LOT of flies inside.. it was hard to eat because i was constantly shooing away flies.. But other than that i enjoyed myself very much.

Found this place on Yelp. It was okay.  Pros: Decent food but nothing spectacular or memorable. Easy location to find but it's sort of tucked into this little 6 business center. Employees were nice.  Cons: There are no fountain drinks, that means $2.50 for 1 can of coke. It's one of those strange "order at the counter, we bring it to you" places. This leaves a ridiculously long line zig-zagging throughout the entire walkway and eating area of an already cramped dining room. Outdoor seating had only wobbly plastic tables and chairs which led to numerous spills of the coffee.  I won't be going again but if it's your first time and you love coffee, go during the week to avoid the insanely long line and wait time.

The best breakfast in town !!! Awesome little place as comfortable as eating in your own home . Very cool atmosphere , rockin' menu items , great coffee and no better staff....eat here and be happy !!!

Yeah, it sucks that they don't allow substitutions. I'm not going to argue that.  But the food is quality, and the choices are not your standard breakfast-joint fare. Come here because it is something different, not because you want the usual!

The atmosphere was hip and the place was super busy, but we still managed to get in and out in like 22 minutes.  I had the biscuits and gravy and my brother-in-law had the Wilcox Ave. (the generic breakfast) both were delicious.  I am definitely trying this place again a d may rate higher if the service and quality persist.

Absolutely love this place.  First time there and definitely will be a repeat customer. The menu is so interesting and innovative.  Husband had the Special, biscuits and gravy with fried eggs....this was like no other sausage gravy you have ever had...this was a masterpiece.  I had the potato pancakes with grated apples...fabulous!  Kai, the Manager, is a real professional.  He has this restaurant running like a charm.  He is truly an asset to this establishment.  Can't wait to return.
Diverse menu with cooks that can back it up. Place was really busy and they were able to put out 4 star food in very short order.

Food was good but a little pricy and the service was lacking when we ordered our food at the register and this isn't the first time unfortunately. Definitely work to improve etiquette at the register.  Update:  Vovomeena reached out to rectify which is greatly appreciated. A lot to be said of a business.

I love this place. I have come 6-7 times since living (near) Phoenix and have brought several friends here who have all enjoyed it. I always look forward to a visit here. I recommend trying their cold brew sampler if you are into trying delicious coffee with infused flavor that doesn't taste artificially sweet. My favorite flavor is the vanilla bean and cocoa nibs or the plain one. Super delicious and smooth. I always enjoy my dishes but my favorite is the bread pudding (pain de perdu, I think) which is consistently delicious.

I left a review for this place and saved it in draft mode after having a unpleasant experience here last year. The service was bad and the food just wasn't good. After taking my mom to Matt's during her visit here, I told her about this place since I had heard so many good things about it.  I ordered the B.M.O.C., my son had the biscuit & gravy & the pain perdu and my mom had the Pawtucket West, none of us were pleased, my eggs arrived cold and when I asked that it be placed in the microwave to warm up a helper stated "we don't have a microwave here" and walked off....needless to say I was refunded my money back for my meal while my mother & son opted to deal with what they had and not complain.  I originally came home and wrote a yelp review to which I was contacted by the owner and offered the opportunity to come back and have breakfast on him in an attempt to change my perception of this place. I agreed, and THOUGHT I saved my review in draft mode for an update of the original review in addition to the new one, but apparently I did not because it's gone. Anywho, although my firm is located less than a mile from here and my son attends the art school across the street, I have never felt the need to come back for that comp meal.   So I guess it's safe to just leave my 2 stars (which is only 2 because of the owner) and keep it moving. I will state that although the helper guy was extremely rude, the owner was very nice and accommodating and did everything in his power to appease me.

It's been almost a month since my trip Vovomeena, and wish it weren't 2,000 Miles away from me. I wake up most mornings craving their pain perdu, and can't wait to eat it again on my next spring training trip. If you enjoy French toast and bananas you'll love this dish! All the other items I tried from my friends were excellent, and Vovomeena has the best coffee you'll find in any breakfast restaurant. You'll fall in love with their Japanese cold brew coffee.

Great brunch place with a cool southern twist to the traditional american diner brunch food. The cuban benedict daily special tasted more like an open top burger than the traditional eggs benedict. The b.m.o.c was rather large in portion size. I like that the slightly salty smoked pork chop goes very well with the plain waffles and sweet apple-maple syrup. The blend in sweet and salty, as well as the different textures made this a rather well executed dish.  Their special Japanese ice coffee was also rather tasty, and definitely did the job of giving me the caffeine kick I needed!

This place is really yummy! I tried the biscuits and gravy and the Mexican Benedict. The biscuits and gravy were awesome although I felt like the egg on top felt kind of out of place and didn't really add much to the dish but delicious none the less.   The Mexican Benedict was great. The bread was a little too chewy and tough for my liking but it was pretty good. The potatoes weren't crispy at all and could use a little more crunch and seasoning.

Cute little brunch spot that I'd love to come to with girl friends. You order before seating yourself, they have their own little coffee bar where you can see how they brew the Japanese drip coffee.   While paying for the meal I noticed some $20 bills in their tip jar so expected a lot. Was sadly disappointed by the three meals that my family shared. The coffee was delicious, the potatoes were delicious....annnnd thats about it. Willing to give the place another chance though!
The BMOC is pretty big compared to the other entrees. It was a very interesting mixture of sweet and some salty. Quite unique.  The place is casual, hip and charming. Really nice atmosphere.
Had an iced coffee. It was good, but way too expensive.  I paid $5 for a 16 oz iced coffee. So my point: good coffee, just too expensive.

Vovomeena is an incredible find in Phoenix!  From the decor, to the service, the amazing food options and delicious coffee, I always try to stop here when I am in the area.   After visiting a number of times, i have only tried two dishes because they are so very delicious!  The Tortilla Espinola & Mexican Benedict are both amazing....cooked to perfection and so flavorful.  And, their coffee is the BEST!  This is a must-try....it will not disappoint!

It's no surprise this place is rated as high as it is. Another cool spot in PHX. Had the b.m.o.c. and it was pretty incredible. The combination of a fried egg over a smoked pork chop on top of a waffle was f'ing amazing.

I wonder why I never stopped into this place considering I've walked by it so many times after leaving Chipotle or Zoyo. The food and service here is great, I ordered the pancakes with eggs and turkey sausage. The food came out quick and was delicious. It's hard to find a good pancake but these were delicious. I can't wait to go back and try the chorizo eggs Benedict!
Great food, great atmosphere, and great service. Highly recommend to all az foodies out there :D

We stopped by here for breakfast while staying in PHX. The food was excellent. The coffee was outstanding, we ordered a Togo jug of the cold brewed coffee for later in the day. Everything was beyond our expectations.

Had breakfast here this morning, and while there are still some kinks to be worked out, it was overall a very pleasant way to start the day. I had already stopped in a few times since they opened for coffee on the way to work, so I already knew the staff is friendly and courteous. This was confirmed today when, on their first really busy Sunday, the kitchen was backed up and the wait for food was long (we waited over 30 minutes for ours to come out, and even then it came out in waves).   Both our server and the (owner? manager?) made a point to stop at our table and thank us for our patience as they experienced their first busy weekend. Hey, I don't mind waiting too much if it's obviously something the management is aware of and trying to fix. I'm sure it will be smoother next time.   The food was excellent and lives up to the standards expected from the folks at Tuck Shop. We went with the boxty, two donuts, sauteed potatoes, a pancake (1 is very large and fluffy), and an egg/cheese omelet.   Critiques: 1)The menu specifically states "no substitutions" for breakfasts. However, I was told when I ordered that if I didn't want a side of meat, they would deduct the charge for it. So apparently, they are not as inflexible as they seem, but I wish I had known that while I was frantically trying to compose a breakfast that didn't include meat.   2)Because of the above-mentioned "rule", the logical solution is to order from the (small) a la carte section at the bottom, which is what my husband did. It would be nice if they would ask if you want everything to come out on the same plate rather than trying to fit a separate plate for 1 pancake, potatoes, 1 omelette, and donuts on the table when it was really all one meal. We ended up doing it ourselves at the table and handing 3 empty plates back to the server.   3)Order the donuts. If you like things that are amazing, then don't miss these. OK, that wasn't a critique. I just couldn't wait to mention these little puffs of funnel-cake heaven.  4)Hey! Vovomeena! There are a lot of vegetarians in the world, and we want to give you money to make our food. We're not asking you to change your world-view or anything, but just a little acknowledgement that not everyone wants a "choice of meat" on every single menu item. You guys are pretty light on the fruit and vegetable side of things, and no, fried potatoes don't count. And how about some other options besides cheese in the omelette? Please?   5)If you are an inflexible vegan, there is absolutely nothing you can eat here. Except maybe the potatoes, but I bet they're sauteed in butter. You can, however, enjoy a tasty soy latte and pout while your friends enjoy their food. But then again, you're vegan; you're used to this. (sigh)  I will eat here again. I promise to add a star next time if either the wait time or the non-meat options are improved...I will even think about adding TWO stars if both of those requests are heeded.

We were in a rush to catch the diamondbacks game and wanted some brunch type meal with some coffee. We called ahead to see if there was a wait, and the person of the phone responded with there's never a wait, but it's a little busy right now. I was curious to know how there is never a wait, and it's because you go up to place your order and then find a seat. Very clever way to handle a rush in my opinion. We tried the Japanese iced coffee and it was really good. I had the tortilla espanola, which was delicious and fluffy like a cake, but savory like an omelet. I also ordered a Portuguese doughnut, which was kinda harder than what I would expect a doughnut to be, it was lightly sweet, so it kind of reminded me of a flattened churro.
The best biscuits and gravy I've ever had. The best biscuits and gravy I've ever had.  The best biscuits and gravy I've ever had.  The best biscuits and gravy I've ever had.

We have been coming here for breakfast weekly for over a year now. Never been disappointed... Great food and awesome service. If you want to rev up your taste buds this is the place awesome favors that will keep you coming back for more ..did I mention the great service .

I'm usually pretty lazy about having to get in the car and go somewhere from brunch since I have quite a few choices within walking distance. But after trying Vovomeena this weekend, I may have to make an exception.  When my boyfriend and I walked in, we were a little confused about how it works. The manager was super friendly and guided us through the process. You order at the register, they give you a number, you pick a seat, and they deliver your food. I ordered the tortilla espanola, which is a potato and egg Spanish omelet, and my boyfriend got the pancakes with sausage. We also got two donuts to share, because why not?  The highlight for us both was the omelete. My boyfriend doesn't like eggs, and after trying the omelete, he said he would probably get that next time. The omelete is very basic, but it's still delicious and the hot sauce it comes with adds the perfect kick. We both also really liked the pancakes. Nothing fancy about them- they just taste like really really good homemade pancakes.   While the side of sausage was delicious, my side of bacon was kind of lackluster. I would definitely recommend the sausage over the bacon. The donuts were also just okay. They just didn't taste like they were freshly made.  We got here about 9am and didn't have to wait at all. But by the time we left, there was quite the line waiting for tables to open up since it's seat yourself. They also had a decent sized patio, but since it was raining, everyone wanted to sit inside. I'm thinking the crowd might not be so bad when outside seating is also an option.  I almost forgot to mention, the prices were great! With our two entrees, side of donuts, glass of milk, and a coffee, the bill was barely $20. I will definitely be adding Vovomeena into the brunch rotation!

Not from AZ, used yelp to find a nice, favorable restaurant of the locals. I found this restaurant to be a flop unfortunately. I really wanted to like it. The location was ridiculously hard to locate, the decor is adorable, and the food was subpar. Walking in had no direction on what to do, apparently you walk to a wall and grab a menu then proceed to the cashier stand and order, then grab a number and seat yourself, which I found to be slightly edgey yet confusing. My cashier was unpleasant to order with as I was with a vegetarian person and she wouldn't budge on letting us upcharge for a french toast? It would have to of been a separate charge to an addition of their meal. I ordered a Mexican Benedict which seemed like a nice modern twist, everything they could have cooked before service, THEY DID AND IT SHOWED. The poached egg, was over cooked (no runny yolk at all) and cooked well before I ordered, as were their breakfast potatoes, which were too thick, par cooked, slightly cold and just mainly inedible. Overall, it's a neat concept restaurant, yet I would not go back.

My friend wanted to take me to breakfast and when she mentioned the place I was thrilled to try it out, being from out of town and judging by the reviews it was worth the try.  The interior was beautiful. I absolutely loved the decor, it was simple and clean. Even the bathroom was designed well. You order your food first and then seat yourself at a table. Beware of large brunch crowds.   The food alone was wonderful. The meals were perfection and prepared with the slightest simple yet effective touch. What really drew me to the place was the flight of cold brew, what a genius idea!! We ordered a mexican benedict and a BOMC. The benedict was exactly what I expected, its presentation was great and the chorizo definitely gave off it's mexican flavor. The BOMC was spectacular. The portion is enough for two and easily one of my favorite dishes, even though I haven't tried anything else.....it was just that good. The pork chop was tender and wasn't too seasoned so the pork flavor alone was enlightening. The waffle was a perfect sweetness and my eggs were as good as scrambled eggs can be. The portuguese donut it was paired with was cute, light and powdered with sugar. I didn't have much of it because I was already extremely full from the dish, which was bittersweet. I had a iced latte with vanilla and it was great, smooth and sweet. We also had the flight which will get you to that coffee high. I can't remember the names of the brews but the jalape√±o one was interesting, though wouldn't be my first choice.  I would recommend the restaurant to any breakfast or coffee aficionado. If I'm ever in the area again I would love to stop by. I hope to try some of their other establishments if ever the opportunity arose.

Vovomeena is a dependable brunch spot in Phoenix with cute outdoor seating and a quick wait time. The biscuits and gravy was everything I wanted and more, with thick, creamy gravy, well-done eggs, and soft, layered biscuits. The savory crepe was nothing exceptional, but the pain perdu (banana bread pudding french toast) was delicious and nothing like any french toast I had every tried before. It came with sausage, rounding out the dish and adding a savory component. I will continue to come back here for the cold-brew coffee and to try their other dishes, particularly the BMOC and the Mexican Benedict.

food was delicious and coffee was delicious!! line had about 15 people ahead of us and took almost 45 minutes to get to the front. I understand having a line on a Saturday morning for brunch, but having one cashier at the front who is doing everything very slowly makes no sense to me. super disappointing :(

Went there for a brunch date yesterday. Service was  fast despite the long lines. I had the Johnnycakes and a chai latte. The johnnycakes were good. I found the syrup to be too sweet for me and the bacon was meh... I never say that about bacon, like ever.   My date had the Mexican Benedict and he enjoyed it.

I really wanted to try the chicken and waffles but it was only part of the special menu. :((........so instead I got the Pawtucket West and the waffle was crunchy on the outside and soft in the inside. It came with scrambled eggs and two slices of bacon. I thought it was reasonably priced considering the location and how nice it was inside.

I decided I needed to finally leave a review after I have been here so many times. My favorite breakfast in Phoenix, hands down best service and food you will get in town. I have always had such positive experiences here, and whenever I have family or friends in town I bring them to vovomeena. I think the quality of each dish is outstanding time and time again, paired with the friendly staff and quick service I am never disappointed. If you come before 8 you won't need to wait too long, but even if you do come in the busier time of day 9:30-12 its worth the wait! Thank you Vovomeena! And as always support local and family owned businesses.

First, and most importantly, the food is fantastic. Biscuits and gravy is everything people raved about on other Yelp reviews. The flavor is great with just a hint of heat. We also tried the Wilcox plate: bacon, house potatoes, plain biscuits, and absolutely perfect eggs. Everything was prepared beautifully and served hot.   The staff was friendly and despite the fact it does look like a less than ideal location from outside, it's a great place once you're through the doors.   I visited with a friend and I'd recommend this location mostly for parties of 2, 4 at the most. There are only a few larger spaces available.   Side note: The first time we tried to eat here it was around 11 on a Saturday and the lines were crazy, both the line to order and the line that you then wait in for your table. We were there with three kids and it was immediately obvious that it would be a long wait before one of the handful of larger tables was available. We decided to leave because it clearly wasn't a great time for a family visit. (At which point we drove over to Luci's at The Orchard and it was a perfect day to sit outside and enjoy their patio along with our kids.)

This is a beautiful little restaurant. I had the pleasure of meeting Jessica Ruiz, the Front-Gal and co owner of Vovomeena, Tuck Shop and Aster House. This gal is super cool, very inspirational and extremely positive. BTW loved the boots.  I learned more today from their coffee guru's about their craft coffee. Japanese Cold Brew. The process is like an IV drip into grounds, a 12 hour process with no heat. This is old Japanese style coffee making. They have a flight of three available light, medium and bold. Three different beans for each. I remember two of the three beans are Ethiopian and Honduras. This was an excellent iced coffee with pure flavors.  My meal was Corn Jonniecake Flapjacks with a side of sweet rice which looked like a pudding, fresh fruit on top and a couple strips of bacon. $7. A delicious breakfast.

Service was on point. The manager was very friendly and attentive! Also came to check up on me when I was seated outside to make sure everything was good after I ate.  Good is mediocre for price but the atmosphere is nice.  I liked the Orchard French toast but the portion is small-- wish it came with more for the price. Loved the Mascarpone added :)

I had the pain perdu, which is a banana bread pudding French toast and it was AMAZING. It's more of a dessert than a breakfast item, but nonetheless, it was worth the price. Their coffee is very strong and if you just get plain old coffee, it is bottomless, which for an avid coffee drinker like myself, is definitely a win-win. The service was awesome, and their manager came and checked on me twice even though you don't have a server, which I thought was icing on the cake. It's a quiet enough place to do some work, and by being able to order at the counter instead of having a server, there isn't this huge pressure to leave so the server can make more money. Will definitely return to try the cold brew flight!!

Food was tasteless.  Potatoes came to the table looking like a soggy mess.  I asked the manager if he could bring out crispy potatoes.  He told me that NO, he could not, because the potatoes were "pre-made".   I am sorry, but any restaurant that is unable to throw some potatoes in a pan and crisp them up is no place for us.  We ate one bite of the other items we ordered, were very disappointed, and left.

I went to Vovomeena for the first time today and loved it. I had the Banging Pocket which has Schreiner's banger sausage, scrambled eggs, and smoked gouda in pita bread. It was phenomenal! All of the ingredients taste so fresh. Loved the home-style goodness!  I also had a cafe latte with vanilla. Simple but delicious.  The setup up is very modern and practical. Nice looking art on the walls. The staff was polite and friendly. The bathrooms were also very clean!  I will definitely be going back when I'm on this side of town.
Love this place! So yummy and great menu. Tortilla Espanola and Mexican Benedict are both favorites. Japanese cold brew is awesome. Love the atmosphere.

We have been here two times now and both times the service has been so amazing! The food is wonderful, we each tried something new every time. The manager is so personable and makes an effort to come talk with us and check up on things. Even the customers are all very friendly and I feel very comfortable here.
Solid breakfast, get there early to avoid the line. Locals and tourists had packed the place. Great cold brew and quick service.

3 years later... I added the last star for amazing consistency over the years and I'm a little (just a little) less of snooty punk :p  This place has become a staple. Still just as good every time Service and quality off the charts Still doing the flight of cold brew, Mexican Benedict and Pain Perdu Winning combos...

Great customer service and excellent food  genuinely enjoyed our first time! We were greeted upon arrival and asked if it was our first time. A kind gentleman then walked us to the menus area showed us the ordering process and helped us with our choice.
Great food and environment! Staff was great, my bf took me for the first time and we will be going back. The biscuits and gravy with an overeasy egg was delish!!

This small coffee shop was amazing. Great customer service, good vibes and great coffee! I also ate brunch here and the food was delicious. Little on the pricey side, but you get what you pay for. Parking was a little annoying, but we made it work.   I definitely recommend this place if you're looking for a quick bite and some caffeine in a clean, quiet environment.

Food was fantastic!!! This is a hole in the wall place kind of hidden as the entrance is in a small parking lot-no signage on street but a must go! Service was great. They appear to be about different and unique coffee yet the coffee was in self serve dispensers-not my fave but again our good was unique and yummy!

My boyfriend and I found this place by chance and we decided to try it, I am glad we did. the Service was amazing , the coffee was great and the food was delicious. They would have gotten 5 stars from me had it not been for the chorizo in the Mexican eggs benedict being a bit greasy where the chorizo grease was completely all over the bottom of the sope. But other than that everything was wonderful. My boyfriend had the B*M*O*C and it also looked delicious. I will definitely be returning to this wonderful little place.
Great food, great coffee, great service. Had the Mexican Benedict. Highly recommended! Love this place.

So-so. Got the biscuits and gravy and my boyfriend got the Mexican eggs Benedict. They were both mediocre. Typical breakfast. The coffee (latte) wasn't terrible, but it wasn't great. Very mediocre in general... came here because of the high reviews... so I was expecting more.

kinda weird at first go up order wait in line then get a table. very good and different breakfast then what I'm use to! would give a 5 star but have to get up and get your own water or any other beverage for that matter. Would definitely go again tho!

This spot is special.  I love the atmosphere and the modern/hipster vibe I get from here.  My friend got the churrizo eggs Benedict, and I actually forgot what I had lol.  I remember being satisfied though.  The way they have the service set up is that you get seated (or in a cue) once you place your order.  Tables are turned rather fast and food comes out pretty quick as well.  I loved the self serve tea and coffee station they have, it really sets the vibe for Vovomeena and makes you feel like you're in another state/country.  I did have an issue with my plate, however the server immediately gave attention to the matter and swapped it out right away.  I would definitely recommend this restaurant to my friends/fam and can see this being an instant favorite brunch spot!!

Awesome food and great people watching! Last time my pork chop was a little too salty but still super tender from the brine. Also wish they had an iced coffee option that I didn't have to make myself and maybe some flavor options.

Want great coffee  AND a delicious breakfast? I went with my family before an  AZ Science Center outing on a Sunday morning and we had a little 3yr old in tow! It's an order then sit down place which works pretty well unless there's a group like the 5 of us trying to make up our minds. Sorry everyone! I was tempted by many offerings but  but I got the BMOC which has a porkchop that was smoked and heaven "scent" on a waffle with eggs on top of that and a Portuguese donut - I shared this meal with the 3 year old because it is enormous! Hubby got the waffle, son in law got the chorizo egg special, daughter got a tortilla espanola --the meats are superb and come from Schreiner's - I tried the sausage and it had a little spicyness to it and was everything you hope for. It was hard to engage in a conversation because everyone was oohing and ahhin over their breakfast. We loved the flavor of the home fried potatoes too! The donut was light and not like true Malasada's but great for a regular donut. And the baby ate EVERYTHING! I also had a latte and my daughter a cappuccino. This is a great local place with an excellent combo of breakfast AND great coffee -- I don't recall Matt's Big Breakfast offering lattes do you? BONUS! -- we didn't have to wait an hour! This is a great little place -- try it -- you'll like it!

Vovomeena has restored our faith humanity. The food was great and the wait staff couldn't be more helpful.. Hats off to Kaj and crew. Thanks for making it a great experience, we will be back for sure.

Meh.  Wanted to love this place but even with the cutester name Vovomeena is clearly not in the same foodie league as the far superior Matt's Big Breakfast.   Visited on a Sunday with my 15 year old daughter - located in a strip shopping complex downtown off McDowell. You enter from the back parking lot pavement. Cute inside but honestly nothing that special in terms of decor or ambiance. Unique? Not really.   Daughter ordered the "Pain Perdu" Banana Bread Pudding French Toast and I ordered the Tortilla Espanola.   The menu selection honestly left both of us in the dust - looks like the owners are trying way too hard to come up with foodie names and odd mixtures of flavors that make it feel quite limited.  The French Toast arrived and my daughter hated it - she described it as a wet, gloppy, overly sugary soggy mess and said it also tasted like there was meat inside the French Toast (yuck).   After a few bites she sent it back (happily accepted by the friendly staff btw) and got a plain waffle instead (she rated it as fair). She said the bacon was OK but nowhere near as good as Matt's BB. Oh well.   My Tortilla Espnola was decent - probably more potato than egg, a little dry - I've had better. I asked for a little olive oil to serve on top to moisten it a bit - server responded and said the kitchen didn't have olive oil, but "would I like some vegetable oil instead?"  A supposedly foodie place that doesn't have olive oil - anywhere? Good grief.   Ignore all the raves at this VERY mediocre spot. This is not and will not be the hot new spot downtown - not even close. LUX does a far better breakfast, so does Coronado Cafe or the reigning champ... Matt's Big Breakfast.   Work on the food and food choices here folks - you guys are trying way too hard.   Good food means simple pleasures prepared and served well. Won't be back.

A quick stop on the way to the airport yielded two very satisfied and happy customers. Mexican Benedict was perfect to split between us. Service was fast, and very friendly. Coffee was well above average. Environment puts this place to the 5 stars. My only regret, not being able to try other menu options. We watched some doses come out of the kitchen with our eyes wide and impressed.

I was visiting my family in Phoenix and we all decided on Vovomeena for breakfast on my last morning there. You line up to order breakfast first and then you are seated. I loved the decor and the relaxed atmosphere.   I decided on the Mexican Benedict and the cold brew sampler. The Mexican Benedict was absolutely delicious with the chorizo on top of the sopes and the potatoes were well seasoned and fluffy. Definitely a must try breakfast item of theirs! I can now understand why it is one of their most popular dishes. I loved the idea of a cold brew sampler in order to try the different flavors they offered. All three flavors I tried: the Black and Tan, peppermint mocha, and orange peel ginger were some of the most flavorful cold brews I've had.   I cannot wait to visit Vovomeena again and try the other breakfast items on their menu! It is a must for breakfast in Phoenix!
I ordered the BMOC and it was good. The food was fresh and tasted like it was made with great ingredients. The staff also friendly and attentive.

Waffle was made as good good as a waffle iron can make it. Coffee was brewed as good as an expresso maker can make it. If u like self service, generic food,  and overpriced coffee this is the spot. Get there early to avoid lines.

Not your average brunch place. Their medley of flavors and colors is a sight to behold for your senses. Definitely worth checking out if you're in the area... at least for those who have some sense of adventure when it comes to morning fare. That is, assuming you can wade past the crowds that seem to have also discovered this once-quiet place. Darn!

Second time to Vovomeena- and another excellent breakfast. The cold brew coffee at the front has me believing that they would do pour over coffee, but alas, I was wrong. Just drip coffee. I will move this to 5 stars... If you do pour over coffee :)   Breakfast was great- Mexican Benedict: poached egg over chorizo and a corn cake. Delicious!!!  Will Definately be back again for breakfast.

See the blog for more:  With Aileen and I arriving nearly simultaneously we entered the crisp new space only to be greeted at the front seating area by a pair of baristas standing before the Japanese Cold Brew contraptions and with everyone bright and smiling we were invited to take a seat anywhere we like, eventually settling on a four-top in front of the open kitchen.  Greeted next by our server, a delightful young woman named Hedda, and then by the restaurant's manager it was explained to us that the method of operation was to grab a menu and then order at the counter while coffee is done self-serve and with that in mind we perused the menu and the restaurant's interior before making our selections.  With the space largely empty at such an early hour (but later to fill to capacity as I sat studying till 9:30) we both admired the cozy industrial/shabby chic interior and with The Shins and Minus the Bear amongst the morning soundtrack the restaurant was lively but not loud, though a small group on the outdoor patio seemed to be having quite a good (boisterous) time.  Chatting as we waited it would not be long before the food arrived and purported to have overordered I personally thought everything looked just right when our table was filled - particularly as I sipped on my third cup of the Vovomeena's bold and intensely earthy brew.  Taking notes from various culinary traditions including the Deep South, England, Ireland, Portugal, and more our meal started with a simple buttermilk biscuit topped with salted butter and paired with a side of strawberry rhubarb jam.  With a light crisp to the exterior while the interior crumb was moist and rife with lightly sour notes I partook in the top half of the biscuit while my friend enjoyed the bottom and although good on its own the addition of the jam was definitely more my style.  Moving next to the one dish I'd probably not have ordered if I were visiting on my own, the "Banging Pocket" with Shreiner's Banger, Scrambled eggs, and smoked gouda wrapped in a pita was actually quite good, though largely due to the use of quality ingredients more than anything particularly done with them as the pocket of pillowy bread featured a nice balance of fluffy eggs, spicy sausage, and just enough cheese to make it 'stick.'  Neglecting the "griddled spuds" on the side largely because I found them a bit too greasy I will note they were quite tender and well complimented by the salt, pepper, and onions.  Noting my propensity for sweet over savory at breakfast it was not until Hedda described the "Boxty" that we decided to order it and while it too was just a bit greasy the overall effect of the hot and crisp potatoes juxtaposed against the sour shredded apple and creamy but sweet mascarpone was quite nice.  A sort of sweet meets savory hash brown served with choice of meat I personally would have preferred to see the bacon, also Schreiner's, more thoroughly cooked but that is just a matter of personal preference as the quality of the meat was quite impressive either way.  For the next choice - the most expensive on the menu with good reason - the B.M.O.C. would prove every bit as good as its description would have you to believe.  Beginning at its base with a crispy waffle lightly tinged with vanilla notes and plenty of butter then subsequently topped with apples cooked down in maple syrup, a smoked pork chop, two poached eggs, and finally a crunchy Portuguese donut it would be hard to call this plate anything but gluttonous...or delicious.  In a dish where any number of elements could have shined, what truly set this dish apart for me was actually the chop - a smoky and savory slab of meat that was easily cut with a butter knife and fork and nicely matched by the intense sweetness of the rest of the plate.  Better than the famous "chop and chick" at Matt's and less expensive (without the line) this will, and should, become the restaurant's signature in my opinion.  Moving last to the "dessert for breakfast" item that had originally drawn me into Vovomeena the day the menu was first published, the pain perdu was simply exceptional.  Featuring dense banana bread rendered into a custard style bread pudding and subsequently sliced to be fried up on the grill this was everything I want from bread pudding - crisp and caramelized on the exterior, soft and dense within, and topped with bold "whiskey caramel" sauce plus ripe bananas that push the dish ever-so-close to "too sweet" while still keeping things in check, particularly when matched with the Schriener's Sausage.  At $6.95 you'd be hard pressed to find a better breakfast dish in town and having sampled my fair share of bread puddings I'd put this iteration in my top ten.

Happened upon this place after arriving in Phoenix for a long weekend. The only bad part of breakfast was that this place is so far from Chicago. The pain perdue was just sweet perfection. I usually don't like a whole plate of sweet breakfast food, but the caramel drizzle with the bacon was the perfect accompaniment to the French toast. I will absolutely stop back next time I'm in the area.

Service was terrible.  We waited in line forever, and then when we got our food, I received mine expediently, and then my companions didn't get theirs for over 20 minutes.  We did talk with the manager and their food was comp'ed, so that redeemed the situation slightly.  I was also unimpressed with their selection.  Every menu should have something vegan or something that can be made vegan to accommodate those who choose to not consume animal products.  I see two other reviewers highlighted this as an issue.    I'm giving it two stars instead of one because the coffee was good and they had almond milk and stevia for it...although there was no counterspace to make your coffee (for those of us not getting something fancier than just a cup o' joe).

Never would have found this place if not for yelp and holy freaking moley the biscuits n gravy are on the flavour train!!!! I will not eat biscuits n gravy anywhere else cause what's the point after eating theirs, the cold brew coffee was also the best I have had (nitro excluded) worth a stop just for the coffee! Boomshockalacka!!!!
They are lucky to get two stars and the only reason for that is there amazing coffee. Food was terrible, seriously major ball drop on the food.

For a quick, gourmet breakfast this place is the spot! I had the apple and mascarpone stuffed french toast and it was just as delicious as it sounds! The food and atmosphere is definately in with the hipster crowd right down to the 19th century hair cuts some of the staff was sportin'.    They do not serve alcohol but they had a coffee and tea bar for those looking for caffiene fix.    The only downfall was that it was very crowded and hard to find a seat.  When you did find a seat you had individuals standing around either looking for their seat, the menu, or in line to order.  However if their only downfall is that they are too busy then I guess they are doing something right!  Will definately be back!
Good spot for breakfast. Orange juice is not the fresh type just FYI. Got the chorizo Benedict, which was pretty good, but it's also a little spicy so watch out.

Loved the artsy vibe breakfast was bland good but not amazing didn't really like the flys flying around there was quite a few obviously out of the restaurants control. It did make me not enjoy my breakfast fully.I would give this place 3 stars. The service when you ordered was subpar the manager did come to greet the table which was nice would I come here again not my first choice but maybe someday I'll give it another shot.

Very good! Just got off the plane and was recommended here. My friend here in Phoenix recommended this restaurant to meet for Breakfast as they had good reviews on YELP. I must say She was correct. The menu was pleasantly different. There was a line you had to go through to order and as you went through you could see the Cooks preparing the different items and you could ask them what the item was. Excellent idea!! The food was great! We will be back!

First time here was amazing! Three sister omelette was best I have ever had!! And I love good food! Every thing was a plus: the food, the service, the staff, short wait time for food on a really busy morning, and they have a barista for delicious coffee drinks.  My new breakfast spot.

I pass Vovoveema all the time; it was one of those brunch places that remained a mystery to me because they specialize in unconventional brunch dishes. For instance, their signature dish is a B.M.O.C. a huge pork chop with a waffle, eggs, and Portuguese donuts on the side! As curious as it sounded, we decided to save the extra pounds and try their Biscuits and Gravy as well as the Pain Perdu instead.  Both were delicious! The gravy tasted home-cooked and had all the components of comfort food. I thought it tasted something of a distant cousin to a chicken pot pie. The Pain Perdu was one of the largest most delicious French toast I've ever had. It was oozing of bananas, and I was surprised I kept eating it bite after bite!  Finally, we also ordered a coffee flight and had a chance to sample three iced coffees sourced locally in Phoenix. They were made using a Japanese cold-brewing method; I'd recommend trying it, because the taste does differ from cold brews, and if you're already at Vovoveema, why not? Come to Vovoveema if you'd like to take your taste buds on a different journey off the traditional brunch path.

This is a great little spot that seemed to be hopping with trendy folk. The menu was fu and relatively diverse. Tried the bread pudding, bmoc, and cold brew coffee flight. I'd get the bmoc again, but pass on the others (the coffee was all very over-roasted). I'd like to go back for the Mexican eggs Benedict.   Service was fabulous and friendly. Looking forward to a second visit!!

Vovomeena is really good. I've gotten their "giant stack of assorted delicious" item a couple of times now, and it features eggs, meats, and even a portugese donut. Oh, and a pork chop. There's a lot going on.  I wish that they were a bit more flexible with the menu. They're very clear about no substitutions, which they're doing in an attempt to ramp up the "fast service" style that they're aiming for, but it rules out a few menu options for me I'd otherwise be really excited to try, and that's a bit of a bummer.  The service was really good the first time we went. The second time, we had a hiccup where my meal had gotten lost in the ether, so I didn't get to eat until after my entire party was pretty well done with their food. But mistakes occasionally happen, so no real love lost.  Overall, it's pretty damn tasty, and a fun experience. And TONS of food. Worth swinging by.

If you've read my reviews of Tuck Shop or Astor House, you knew I would be at Vovomeena within a week of them opening.  My dad and I made breakfast plans and he requested Astor House.  I let him know they opened a new place right by Easley's we had to try instead.  He happily obliged. Vovomeena is a saving grace for an awesome brick center that was face-lifted to house small chain eateries.  I shouldn't be so hard; I love Zoyo too.  Just like Astor House (and the other eateries there), Vovomeena is order at the counter and a staff member will bring you your food.  I recommend finding an open table before ordering and claiming it with sunglasses or a book.  We were there the weekend after it opened and open tables were sparse.  I'm sure by the time I finally got around to writing my review (two months later) that it must be much busier and tables even more sparse. I woke up that day craving biscuits and gravy; so I naturally ordered the biscuits and grillades.  See my Astor House review if you want to know more about this tasty dish.  (It's just as awesome in the aves).  At a little nudging from me, my dad ordered the BMOC - Big Man On Campus.  Heck yes!  A deliciously rich waffle topped with the best pork chop I have ever had, over medium eggs, syrup, and a Portuguese donut for good measure.  I knew the waffle would be bomb because I've had the waffles at Tuck Shop (you can read about those too in my Tuck Shop review).  This pork chop was heavenly.  I'm telling you that I'm seriously planning to make pork loin with maple syrup in homage to this pork chop at Christmas.  Cut it with a fork smoked tender meat... oh my goodness!  I don't know that I could ever finish a BMOC on my own, but was happy to eat some of my dad's.  The donut was a perfect dessert my dad and I shared at the end.  Light and fluffy with a taste reminiscent of funnel cake.   Vovomeena has that amazing cold brewed coffee chocked full of the caffeine I love.  Fantastically attentive and friendly staff - probably from all that cold brewed coffee. The space is that modern, industrial chic that we all love.  There's a buffet table near one of the entrances we thought was the hostess stand before we determined it was also counter order and seat yourself - my only complaint.  Though it is not really a complaint.   I can't wait to go back and try more.  I'm disappointed in myself that I was so hell bent on having grillades that day, I didn't get to try two brand new dishes.  Luckily, it's just down the street.

Outstanding breakfast burrito and Americanos. I will make this my only stop if I am in the area. Fresh cooked (not microwaved), fresh vegetables and eggs. Good portions and fantastic flavor. Please do try it, as I want this local spot to stay open for ever.  I even stop by for a mid-day Americanos because they are soo smooth and the barista pulls the shots just right. Keep it Local!

My fianc√© found this place for me. He knows I love to try new places to satisfy my food cravings. My friend from out of state came to visit and I decided to bring her here with me for my first time experience, since she's into coffee & food in general too!  We ordered the Mexican Benedict, B.M.O.C., a flight of coffee, and iced coffee. The food was everything that I expected it to be. The chorizo was very tasty, but wasn't right for my taste buds at that time. It was my first time have poached eggs and I loved it. The bmoc was great, the taste was just mouth watering.   We didn't realize we ordered so much coffee. The flight, iced coffee and iced latte! We definitely left with a coffee high.   This place was delightful. I will bring my fianc√© for brunch soon. Even though it's kind of pricey, the coffee is what I would come back for!

If you haven't been to Vovomeena, your mouth has never been truly satisfied! Not only do they have amazing food, they have GREAT coffee. The thing that actually stands out the most is their customer service! Im an admitted coffee snob/foodie and they have, on more than one occasion, made sure to go above and beyond, delivering the best experience!

The corner of 7st and McDowell is another hot spot for many stores and restaurants.They all shared the same parking lot. There are a few parking spaces in the back lot near the Easley's Fun House side.   As most popular brunch places, coming on a Sunday afternoon, this place was extremely packed. They have 2 entrances front and back. It can be confusing if you entered from the back since no sign or service directing you until you walked to the front seeing a long waiting line.   You place the order and paid at the counter then they bring the food to your table. You can watch them preparing the food while you order. It's an open kitchen. They do have outside seating area shared with other businesses.   I tried the special eggs Benedict on board and the Japanese cold brew. It was a basic hearty meal but nothing special. The Japanese cold brew was just ok. It didn't fully capture the coffee flavors that I am used to in a Japanese cold brew. Their Portuguese donut was decent but I felt overpriced ($1.50 for a really small piece).  Overall, it's great little place in a vibrant changing neighborhood.
Coffee is soooo good. cool spot. I got the Mexican eggs Benedict... it was good.... a bit too much chorizo for me... but it was good.

The service was great and the food was amazing. Stopped by here for breakfast on a Wednesday morning. There was seating due to the flow of patrons in spite of it being packed. The host quickly attended to us upon walking in to give us a quick how to on ordering at the register and self-seating. The menu had a small but perfect amount of selections. It was difficult to choose because each dish was unique and sounded delish. The burrito had a fresh taste - and I typically do not like burritos.  I'm going back for another for sure. The side of potatoes were perfectly cooked - some had a crisp to them.  The Johnny cakes were amazing! The corn and the overall texture/flavor was on point. Kudos to the chef for the creativity and palette. The decor is modern eclectic with a relaxed friendly vibe. This place is a must!

PROS Tasty brunch! We were fans of the thick cut porkchop and crispy waffle, and the Mexican benedict.  Right amount of spices and seasoning Patio seating for dog people Service and manager were attentive and courteous   CONS The flow for  brunch is awkward, it's counter service so you order the food but then the manager seats you.  Space is very narrow Have to get your own coffee  Overall, I recommend this place for a brunch. Easier if it's a small group since seating can be a little more competitive than what I would like it to be. We are East Valley people so will only dine here if we have events or errands in downtown.
If you have not been here.... it is a must try! We ordered like four different entrees and each one was delicious. This is my new brunch place.

stopped in Phoenix on the way to California and this is seriously the best breakfast place I've ever been to in the whole U.S!!! I had the 3 sister omelet with spuds and man oh man was it delicious. They have fresh orange juice and perfectly made coffee!!

I did not end up eating here. I came on a Sunday late morning and my boyfriend and i spent 15 minutes waiting awkwardly in a corner of the restaurant for a table or seat of any kind to open up before ordering an entire breakfast. When I finally found a 2 top I was told bluntly (by someone who conveniently ignored us standing and wandering around inside and out) that I had to order before I could take a table. It was loud and crowded and although the food smelled great it wasn't worth feeling so unwelcome.
Delicious! Our first time, on our way to Veteran's parade! Gave us 1/2 off our total bill for my husband's service! Will fill in details later! Very impressed!

I fear that this place is going to get out of hand very shortly.  Please people keep to Matt's Big Breakfast and Over Easy keep the crowds away.    Ok Ok I can't be selfish but I wish I could this place is awesome.    Everything from the Japanese cold brew coffee to the espresso's to the amazing food.  I have had the pain perdu which is bannana bread french toast fresh bannanas sliced on top and a whiskey caramel sauce on top and the savory crepes with chicken and egg inside and a homemade sauce over the top.  Both dishes were AMAZING I will for sure go back just for those, but will have to try the rest of the menu first.    I am very greatful I have Monday and Tuesday's off to avoid the weekend crowds because I am sure they will be starting very soon.

My sister got the mexican benedict. She said it was super hot yet tasty :)   I got the tortilla espanola, ehhhh. The salad was very tangy and has a wierd after taste, it was similar to lasagna really, but other than that my plate was good. :) their house made orange juice was really good. Perfect.  I didn't like the set up how you have to get up and order. I love the fresh sun flowers on the tables :)
I love this restaurant. Been here many times. I've had several dishes including the banging pocket, Mexican Benedict, as well as the French toast. So good. Iced coffee is delicious as well.
What a find! Had the orchard french toast husband had the biscuits and gravy. No wait and quick food times. very quaint interior. Staff was very friendly. Glad we found this place.

Tried this place for the first time based on the good reviews and enjoying Tuck Shop, however this was a pretty epic fail   We arrive at the restaurant and were told by the barista how the menu and ordering works, and we placed our order of the mandatory BMOC and the grillades, and supplemented that with a Coconut Macaroon (not the French hard shell style) that looked good at the counter. We ordered hot green tea and a cappa  The macaroon was mainly coconut with very little cake to it, which was fun for a bit or two, then was one note and disappointing...which was a common theme  The tea came in a regular bag (which was a little bit disappointing for a place that touts their coffee, you would think tea would be more than an afterthought, and then the cappa - which ended up being an espresso covering in foam in a full sized coffee mug. It was clear the barista had no idea what they were doing, I am sure there is a name for espresso doted with foam but it was not in the right cup nor was it what I ordered - that was disappointing. They seem to specialized in cold brew and had 5 or 6 of them going, so maybe that is all they are good at, it certainly isn't making a milk based coffee drink  The food looked good upon coming out however and the first bite of the BMOC was pretty good, the waffle with syrup and apples was done properly and the pork chop was a good piece of meat, the egg was cooked well. The issue was that it was unbalanced when the components were eaten seperatly and one note when eaten together. The pork chop was salty and a bit oversmoked, so for a bite or two it was great, then it was boring.  The grillades was pretty poor all the way around, the biscuit's were not very good and the meat was simple pressed ground beef and it was overly salty, the gravy was not that appealing, a pretty poor rif on traditional biscuit's and gravy  about 1/3rd of the way through the meal we decided we were wasting calories and it was time to go  If you want a great waffle and pork chop - Matt's Big Breakfast is pretty amazing upon comparison - I had wanted to try this place to give it a comparison, and it really makes Matt's stand out, simplicity done well is very hard and they do it there, not so much at Vovomeena

First thing as you walk in the Japanese brewing method quickly catches your eye, the service is outstanding and the food is beyond delicious. I myself chose the the three sister omelet and a flight of the house infused coffee. Please don't sell yourself shot, buy the flight. If your definitely looking for a great local spot with local brewed coffee this is the place for you, atmosphere here is great and will not be disappointed with anything on the menu.
Our second time here. We just love the Vibe here and the food is very special.

Great little casual, urban hip restaurant with inspired, hand crafted food. Went there for Sunday breakfast & was very satisfied with the tasty crepes with chicken and swiss chard. Funky twist on crepes & pretty healthy. (A welcome departure from bacon & eggs.) Homemade salsa & sausages unusual. Impressive selection of coffees & cold coffee is properly brewed "Japanese style," not just poured over ice. Nice patio seating. Good vibe!
Yo this is my jam.  Favorite place to eat breakfast never am disappointed. High quality ingredients bomb coffee.  Always get the omelet cause it's straight fire. Add a donut for extra happiness.

I came here for breakfast after a long night out. Staff was really nice and food was solid. I got the biscuits and gravy. Nothing to write home about but definitely solid. I don't remember what the other people I was with got but they seemed happy as well.  4/5. Would be back.

Known in folklore as a cure-all, the Vovomeenian johnnycake smorgasbord (not the right word to use, since it means bread and butter, but let's just run with it) offers life-replenishing powers for uninspired, hung over, and weary brunch soldiers. The legend says... "Add four poached eggs to this. And a Portuguese doughnut."   So I did. The dish is just called "johnnycakes." You know, john¬∑ny¬∑cake - noun - a flat cornmeal cake typically baked or fried on a griddle.  I received two, plate-sized. Studded with corn. Stacked with fresh strawberries. Oh, and scoop of sweet rice pudding. Plus, two sausages. And a pitcher of prickly pear maple syrup. So, when you order the johnnycakes, know that it may be a working title, and that the definition is approximate at best.   Use this flexibility to your advantage and continue adding brunch items with reckless abandon. Don't think about it.* I recommend four poached eggs and a doughnut.  *Unless you have something to do in the next four hours, besides for nap.

I stopped here for breakfast at 6:30 am when they opened yesterday and the place had the prettiest decor! The food was great I had the Mexican eggs benedict. It was amazing, too bad I couldnt finish it all. My dining companion had the waffle that was amazing, as well. I had my first cold pressed coffee that was out of this world. I will for sure be back.

I really liked this place.  I got the BMOC and enjoyed it for the most part.  I think the promise of a big porkchop got me thinking of a regular grilled pork chop, but this was cured like ham.... so it was essentially a big chop of ham.  It was still tasty... and I probably should have expected ham for brunch instead of a regular seasoned porkchop.... but yeah.  Aside from that minor, brief disappointment, the meal was filling and good.    One of my friends got a french toast dish... totally sweet and delicious... and probably best as a dessert.  Another friend got the mexican benedict dish which was quite flavorful.    The flight of coffee samplers were interesting... especially the lemon/jalepeno coffee.    Nothing life-changingly amazing, but a very solid brunch place.

My buddy wanted to get breakfast on my side of town and wanted to give Vovomeena a go cause he had heard great things.  First I'll start with how hip this place is, very cool atmosphere.  You order at the counter and they run the food out to you.  The prices were adorable and the portions were decent size for the affordable price.  I ordered the Waffle, Bacon and Potatoes and at $8.95 it was priced accordingly.  It was yummy, real maple syrup would be a good addition vs. the corn syrup buttersworth/jemima one they served.    All in all this would be a nice place to catch breakfast/brunch if you're in the area.  Gonna be honest and say Matt's is still the king of breakfast in my neck of the woods, but Vovomeena is quite pleasant.

Found this spot looking breakfast on yelp. I am a coffee lover so the flight of coffee was appealing to me. Unfortunately they were out of infused coffee now that they are supplying a coffee shop. I did try their Japanese cold brewed and immediately fell in love. I tried the tortilla espanola and my friend got the breakfast pocket. Both were terrific especially the tortilla espanola! Highly recommended and definitely try the coffee.

I found myself with a morning free and contacted a very good AOB buddy of mine, T, and asked him if he wanted to join me for coffee and a bite to eat. "Sure, but I only have an hour or so. Where do you want to meet?" He said. Hmm, he lives about 2 miles away from Vovomeena and I had bookmarked this place a while ago so it seemed like a good time to give it a try. First of all, let's deal with the location. No problem for me. Personally, I typed the address into Google Maps and let the software do its thing. I read some people were unhappy because Vovomeena was hard to find. I guess they don't have a cell phone with Google Maps, or a computer at home with same, or GPS in their car, or... seriously. If you can't find a place that has an address, who's fault is it? Bash the establishment? It just makes you look silly. The place is on the South East corner of McDowell and 7th Ave. It's there. Just pull in and park, you'll find it. Once you're inside you'll be happy you went through all the hard work it was to find Vovomeena in the first place. OK, I'm being sarcastic. The innards are cool. Simply laid out with a coffee bar as you walk in. And it serves Japanese Cold Drip Coffee so if you're a fan, get some. There's also a good variety of other coffee's according to my friend so the variety should satisfy most coffee drinkers. Plenty of Yelpers have pointed out how you order and blah blah blah, so I'm not going to go over it again. I felt the guy behind the counter who took our order was very pleasant. I had a few questions about the menu since I was a Vovomeena virgin and he gave me all the insight I needed. We chatted about nothing in particular and he seemed like a very pleasant person. We had already grabbed a table in back before we ordered so once our orders were in T got himself some coffee and I opted for the fresh orange juice. Yummy stuff. The orange juice that is. I don't drink coffee.  I had the Banging Pocket ($9.95). This thing is huge. I was very impressed with the portion size. A delicious pita stuffed with scrambled eggs, sliced Schreiner's sausage, and smoked gouda. I felt everything worked together well. Winner winner Pita dinner. Could it have used maybe some other ingredients? Sure, I'm a chef. But I think the focus here is showcasing the Schreiner sausage, which this "sandwich" did. I enjoyed it. If you read the ingredients on the menu and think it should have something else, ask. There were also some lovely breakfast type potatoes alongside. T ordered the Pain Perdu ($9.50). It's a banana bread pudding French toast with Whiskey caramel sauce. He said it was pretty good. It looked good. He ate the whole thing. There were a couple of, let's say, hiccups however. The plastic varnish coating on out table was peeling away. That's because the sanitizer, cleaner and whatever else they might spray on it to wipe it down does nasty stuff to the top coat of the tables. Another issue is that since T and I ordered separately our food didn't come out together. T ordered first and I asked the guy taking the orders if he could just put my order under the same number. Nope. No can do. So the food didn't come out together. In fact, the food came out way to far apart. 3 - 5 minutes. Unacceptable. Both are easy fixes though.  Great Food. Fair Prices. Pleasant Staff. Timing issues. Furniture in need of repair/replacement. 4 Stars.

Props for the awesome decor and vibe but we thought the food was just OK for brunch; bland and nothing to write home about. Plus, we waited in a long line to order our food (30 mins) and by the time we got up front to order they were out of the  top 3 items I was considering to order.

Yummy!!! This place was quick and quaint just like I love it! The service, food and people were all good. We ordered your traditional breakfast of eggs, pancakes, potatoes and sausage and it was all good. My waffles were the best I've had in a very long time. Being fluffy and buttery was a complete party in my mouth. The coffee, vanilla latte and fresh squeezed orange juice was superb as well. Well done. Next time I'm in Phoenix I will be back.

Vovomeena having amazing breakfast and was the best breakfast that I have in my vacation to Tuscon, Phoenix & Sedona.  My parents normally have a traditional chinese breakfast and they love the food here too.  The  pain perdu - a bread pudding French toast - looks and tasted delicious as posted by many Yelpers and I agree.  I also order the Mexican Benedict and was really good.  I really wanted to swing back again before my trip was over but unfortunately I was not able to make it.  The sausages was good meat.  Ordering  & Seating can get confusing for newbie : So here is a recap (please click helpful)   1) There is a front (Bigger parking lot) & back entrances (smaller parking lot - you see the coffee barrister & the restroom if you enter thru here - go to front to order.). 2) Don't get a seat ,  you have to "ORDER FIRST" before you get seated ( The ordering is near the front entrance ) 3) After you order and paid you get a NUMBER. 4) You take that NUMBER and get on another line by the wall  across from the coffee barrister This is where the manager will find seats for you. 5) The process seem to be okay as I was able to get at seat 10 mins after I order and paid. 6) After I got seated , I probably got my food in another 8-10 mins.      For the great food, I feel okay for this process.

I love breakfast and was really anticipating vovomeena.  But was quite disappointed. Service was rude. For example; I asked if there was an alternative to the meat sides..... The gals answers was. "You can not have it.".... Wow. Thanks.    Food was nothing to brag about.  Can't say that I feel the need to return or recommend this spot.

I love everything about this restaurant! As a new yorker i am always pleasantly surprised when the service is exceptional and this service was exceptional.  So you wait on line to order your food before getting seated. We were a party of 7 and they were nice enough to seat us towards the back by ourselves.   From the other reviews on yelp I ordered the banana french toast and it was delicious. If you have a sweet tooth definitely go for this. I also really appreciate the potatoes that came with it since it added the right amount of savory to my sweet dish. I had thought i ordered a donut and the waitress went to check on it for me. When she came back she told me I actually didnt order it but they made an extra and gave it to me. Legit almost started crying 1. because i cant believe i forgot to order the donut. i love donuts! and 2. that she just gave me one.  I dont remember what my friends ordered but they all really enjoyed their food and we all enjoyed our donuts! It was light fluffy and had a healthy dusting of sugar!  The service was great and they never rushed us to leave even though we were a big party and took up a rather large table. I'll definitely remember this place the next time I'm back in Phoenix.

Fantastic!  Found this place on Yelp for my first meal in town and the daily special breakfast quesadilla blew me away.  So tasty.  I'm from the south so I don't know much but I know these guys and gals know their stuff!  Ingredients, flavors, and texture on point. So good!

Well worth the wait!!! This place has the best breakfast around amazing coffee and great customer service. My friends and I were out for spring training baseball and came across this place. This will now be a must for future spring training trips. Thank you for the wonderful breakfast. See you again

I'm stuck on the banana-bread pudding french toast with whisky caramel and a side of meat.."Pain Perdu!"  http://bit.ly/1IezYOM  Does this come as a surprise!? Others with whom I've dined have enjoyed their meals as well - and that BMOC is the BOMB.   Love it when one of my favorite restaurants for dinner (Tuck Shop) turns out to be owned by the same folks as one of my favorite breakfast spots. I didn't realize that the owners were the same until my second visit to Vovo and it was then that I caught on. (Now I just have to try their other place, "The Astor House.")  Vovomeena is counter-order, delivered to your table kind of breakfast place. The queue has always been at least seven to ten deep, but it moves quickly and the food pops out pretty quickly. The menu is unique, diverse and the portions are pretty reasonable for the price point and uniqueness of the dish. The service has always been chatty and memorable. I like it!  The main downfall is that the seating can be somewhat cramped; always prefer the patio but it can easily become too cold or warm. Likewise, the parking lot is certifiably "for maniacs only" - it is very tight. There is limited street parking on Lynwood  - residential street south of the parking lot.   Speaking of this area and specifically the street just mentioned - part of the historic "Roosevelt District" and it's a niceafter-breakfast idea to take a stroll and to walk off that meal!

This is such a great breakfast/brunch place.  I love it.  The food is fresh and well cooked- not the kind of place that just serves prepared Cisco Foods.  A little pricy but worth it.  I got the Mexican Benedict and it was HEAVENLY.  They also have great coffee and fresh squeezed orange juice.  I basically felt like I got a mini vacation today when I had breakfast there.  The only con is it's a small place, so you might have to wait to get a table.

This is the best breakfast place EVER! The hubby had Mexican Benedict and I had the savory crepes. I would have to say hands down the food was delish and fresh brewed coffee was awesome. Thanks to our friends for introducing this restaurant to us.
The orchard French toast are seriously outrageous!! The restaurant itself is super clean and their staff is beyond friendly. It was pretty busy when we went but it was worth the wait!

It was pretty good. I had the B.M.OC,pork chop was good. That being said,waffle was soggy from too much syrup. The eggs were well,eggs. The donut thing was ok all in all it was ok I'll go back to try something else. Oh and the coffee was pretty good.

Excellent restaurant all around. The coffee tastes so fresh. I had the banana pudding French toast with caramel sauce on top and bacon on the side. That's one of the best breakfast meals I have ever had. Love the way the atmosphere flows through the restaurant. Just a terrific place to go to.

I went to Vovomeena with the BF last weekend to have breakfast. The place is cute, small, but not cramped. The style is modern. You come in and order at a counter and then seat yourself, which is nice. I got the Mexican eggs benedict. It was rich and heavy, but had good flavor. It is chorizo on top of a thick corn cake of sorts...then topped with eggs and hollandaise. I think I probably gained at least a pound from this meal. The only problem with the food was the potatoes were somewhat bland. Thankfully, the serving size was huge so I didn't miss having the potatoes.
First time here! So good! The line was out the door but totally worth the wait. Took half an hr to get in. The staff was great, very organized

Vovomeena is not for non-meat eaters. The menu is limited and offers little flexibility for vegetarians. Also, they have no fish or avocado on the menu. The tortilla was over cooked and bland, and was definitely not Spanish as suggested in the menu.   Vovomeena is also not for folks expecting decent customer service. If you're a disabled woman asking for a glass of water, then don't be surprised if you're asked to head to the water cooler and help yourself - "I don't bring water to the customers. Customers do it themselves"   Overall, extremely disappointed and would recommend to stay away!

Vovomeena why were you so hard to find!!! Whether you're driving down McDowell or 7th avenue you won't see it. Maybe we just missed it, but I didn't see any sign whatsoever. The only one was right about their door, but you can't see it well from the street. We got lost and drove around and couldn't find it. I had to text my sister to see where it's at.   I ordered the banging pocket which I didn't think was very banging. Lol. It comes with sausage and eggs wrapped in a pita with a side of potatoes. It would've been nice with some onions or mushrooms or something. It just wasn't anything great.   There isn't a lot of seating at the restaurant. You probably have to come early to get a table or you'll end up sitting outside in the hot weather. They should really install misters. The service was really good but it was a far drive for mediocre food.

Cute lil coffee house vibe , Im not vegan but i dont eat pork , and the cook everything griddle style. On the plus side they did custom a egg scramble for me but ( on the negative) wouldn't do just egg whites .
My new go to breakfast place. Love the banana bread french toast. Just wish you could order a small order as a side dish. Great food, great atmosphere!
It's good but some options are either too bland or overly sweet - it just didn't do it for my taste buds
Everything was delicious. Bisquits and gravy, eggs benedict cooked to perfection. Eat the donut too!
I was really impressed with the speed at which the food came out. It was hot and very delicious. The prices are good and the staff is friendly.

Amazing coffee, and even better breakfast.  My two favorites are the benedict and the pain perdu. I highly suggest going with a friend and splitting the two, because the pain perdu is VERY sweet.  The service is amazing, impressed every time I come.

Lovely hidden treasure in downtown phoenix. Very casual concept that just seems to work no matter how crowded it is. Great customer service and a nice relaxing atmosphere. Good amount of parking very clean inside and out. The food is from local source and is simple but very tasty and you get a healthy serving as well. No doubt we will return!

We stumbled on this place via yelp, when we looked for an open breakfast place when we arrived in Arizona for a vacation. Our flight came in early. We found this, was not totally easy to find (blame it on the GPS) but when we did, we were in for a surprise. The place is hip, the food was great, and the service is exceptional. There were food choices that were among things I was not familiar with so I was willing to try out. We ordered 2 different items. They came out really well, except that I am not a big fan of waffles and, well, I ordered waffles. It was a little too sweet, being that it was mixed with some compote or apple-something. Otherwise, it was good. Outside of food, the service was great. The manager and food server were there helping us out as we figured where to go on our visit. You cant find that easily elsewhere-- staff members, who are willing to talk to you.  Do check this place out if you want good food and wonderful people in AZ!

It was our first time coming here and I got to tell you it was pretty tasty, the atmosphere and the vibe was awesome which is always a plus. I ordered the Wilcox Avenue which were scrambled eggs,spuds(potato)and bacon with a biscuit I got the biscuit for the side of gravy I ordered which is some pretty good gravy actually the gravy is what got us to this fine establishment , My wife ordered the Mexican chorizo Benedict which she said was good but, a little spicy for her. I think she'll try something else next time. I already know what I'm going to order for next time. Coffees great and also this watermelon iced tea. Well let's see what you think after you try this place out
This menu. Too many delicious recommended options to choose from - don't miss out on the cold brew coffee flight!
Great food, great service. I ordered food and was closer than I thought. Was there in 5 mins and it was ready and coffee was amazing also.

Wow! Just WOW!! You need to try this place. If you love breakfast at all, you need Vovomeena in your life. For your first trip I HIGHLY recommend trying the B.M.O.C. It sounds weird (I mean a pork chop on a waffle with an egg?) but it will change your life. For the better. And their infused coffee, delish.
