Or if plain ole joe is more up your alley, they have bottomless cups of freshly brewed local beans. Also, they use Schrieners sausage. Nuff said. Oh and the people there are awesome! Super nice, welcoming, make you feel like a regular even if it's your first time!   In summation, go to Vovomeena. You will thank me.

Trendy, snug place. Generally when I've been there, there's a line to order, but it's okay! You're greeted in line with a menu by a Host. Then after you place your order at counter, the Host will seat you with your number. Then bam!, food comes out. I got the bacon breakfast sandwich and boy did they deliver on the bacon!

It's a cool little place. The food is mostly good and the service is decent. I wasn't super impressed by the donut but the waffle is pretty yummy. Their seating policy isn't great and that's one of the reasons we don't go here more often.

Small place with amazing food and even better coffee.  Can be busy at times, but worth the wait for sure.  If traveling through Phoenix this is definitely a place to try at least once, you won't be disappointed.

Loved this place! Coffee was top notch and the food was quite good.  didn't even mind the lines-signaled to me that we'd enjoy our feast.  Only thing for me personally-I'm allergic to dairy and I had NO choices.  They had to adapt the one item that came close to safe.

The kiddo, daddy and I went to this magical spot for breakfast mid morning on a Sunday. The place is cute, a little small, but has inside and outside seating. You order at the counter first, then wait for the manager to seat you. Between the three of us we ordered the Mexican eggs Benedict, pain perdu (French toast), kid's egg/bacon/pancake, fresh oj, and a Portuguese doughnut.   Let's start out with the reason I will come back... the Portuguese doughnut was one of the best doughnuts I've ever had! You'll find it on the bottom of the menu, "add a Portuguese doughnut to your order (duh!) 1.50". Well said guys! Get one!   Second on the list is the pain perdu which my hubby ordered. He would only share two bites and I was reluctantly understanding. I wouldn't have wanted to share it either! I was a little disappointed with the chorizo on my Benedict. It was overly greasy and a little spicy for me (just preference).   Worth a try friend!

This new breakfast/brunch place from the Tuck Shop owners is the lone gem in a row of typical chain restaurants at the SE corner of McDowell and 7th Avenue. By coincidence, I ended up eating here three Sundays in a row. So, I've been able to sample a variety of entrees from their menu--which isn't all your typical eggs and bacon. That's a good thing in this case. My favorite so far is their Tortilla Espanola_ the perfect texture and combination of potato and egg with a brava sauce. They also offer Portuguese donuts. They are OK. They are like funnel cakes but seem to be made from a lot more egg. The set-up is pretty in and out. You look at the menu and line up to place your order. If you order a beverage, you move over to the coffee bar after paying for your order.   Besides the scrumptious menu, I love the decor. They have space on the patio and a bike rack. Inside, there are floor-to-ceiling ropes smartly placed between people dining and people lining up to make their orders. I also like the hanging shelves of glass bottles behind the coffee bar. The brick and industrial materials gives the place a modern and simple feel.  I recommend getting there before 11 a.m. That's about when it starts getting pretty crowded. There is no signage out front so it's easy to miss. Parking is accessible on 7th Avenue, just south of McDowell.

Food is fabulous!   The Portuguese Benedict was cooked perfectly, and the pain Perdue is like a banana bread smashed with a Cinnabon and topped with Carmel goodness.   Would give 5 stars but Coffee tasted burnt and the music isn't my thing. Could have been more loungey for the space.  Big band blaring just made people start talking louder during crescendos.  Amendment: after posting my review the manager contacted me to let me know he appreciated the constructive criticism. This is what small business owners should do. Listen, make yourself better through appreciating that your customers want to make you better. 5 stars in my book.

I've been raving about this place, letting everyone know to come to this little neighborhood breakfast gem.  It is behind some restaurants, but a great find. It catches your eye when you see a line out the door!    As you go to order, food is being prepared right in front of you.   I ordered what people talk about, the Pain Perdu.  The thing that stuck out for me was the Whiskey caramel sauce!  It covers the banana bread pudding french toast and is accompanied with two thick slices of bacon.  It is topped with slices of fresh banana.    Some very comforting dishes if you are in the mood for something sweet or down right tasty they have it all.  Also ordered was the mexican benedict.  It was made with deliciously poached eggs, having a mix chorizo, tomato, onion, it had memorable flavor.   Reasonable breakfast prices with tasty selections.

Very tasty!  If you are in the mood for comfort food, this is the place. I enjoyed brunch there a few weeks ago with my mom. We both something sweet with a side of savory meat. I had the Johnnycakes which is like a corn pancake with prickly pear syrup. Mom had the boxty which is apple and potato pancake with mascarpone.  We were full for the entire rest of the day I believe.  So satisfying!  There weren't too many healthy things on the menu, but I don't think that's what we were looking for.  Excellent cappuccino too!

This place is amazing (: Love what they done within a small space ! Everything in here looks modern! The food taste of the food is well worth the price you pay. In my opinion I think this food is well priced for the flavorful meal! I hope everything best for this companies success! Hope that they move in a more profitable area! Would love to see this place all around the Phoenix area! Oh and the girlfriend said your food is awesome! Will be back for more!

Small, local breakfast eatery.  Needed a breakfast fix after a long trip.  Where else to turn, but to my fellow Yelpers.  It is a little hidden from the street, but an excellent find.   Vovomeena has no pretenses.  Pick a menu, order at the counter/cashier, get a number and wait.  If you don't know the drill you might feel a bit lost at first.   The small outdoors dining area is quaint and shared with other businesses.  The morning dine time was quiet and peaceful.   Ordered the Johnny Cakes.  These are 2 large corn 'pancakes'.  Fresh corn and green chiles are dotted throughout, with strawberries on top.  Crispy on the outside, moist and flavorful inside.  A definite recommendation.  These are served with sweet rice and a choice of bacon and sausage.  The sausage had a good bite with plenty of texture.  Nice. The rice seemed like an afterthought, but was tasty nonetheless.   Overall a good dining experience and recommended for a delicious meal.
Amazing food and everyone was so nice that I created a Yelp account to write about how helpful everyone was.  I can't wait to come back.

I'm so glad to have a fun neighborhood spot to go to for brunch! We came here on Saturday morning. We must have arrived with a big wave of people, because there were about 8 people in line waiting to order food in front of us. (FYI - this was rare, the rest of the time we were there, there wasn't more than 3 or 4 people waiting in line) We didn't mind waiting because we got time to look over the menu and look around at the decor. The restaurant has a really nice atmosphere - modern, yet rustic? The only thing that concerned me was that when you wait in line you stand at a shoulder-height counter overlooking the kitchen and there was no protective glass shield. I felt like a misplaced sneeze could've contaminated all the food being prepped on the line!  Our food came out in exactly 20 minutes. For having 8 orders in front of us, I thought that was good time. The portions were generous. I ordered the BMOC and had to take half of my pork chop home (...but I am a girl and I don't eat that much). The food was pretty awesome. The pork chop was tender, the apple sauce (kind of like apple pie filling) they drizzled on top was sweet but not TOO sweet. My only gripe was that they placed the porkchop on top of my waffle and covered the whole thing in apple sauce so my waffle wasn't as crispy as I would've liked. if I ordered it again I would ask for the waffle on the side, maybe on a separate plate.  My friend ordered the Banging Pocket, which he loved. I tried a bite and it was really good! What put it over the top was the salsa that came in a little side cup. I've had many salsas before but there was something really special about this stuff! Very flavorful, kind of tasted like they used roasted tomatoes or something because it had a very deep and rich flavor. He did not have any leftovers to take home.  With all of the interesting choices on the menu, we could come back here several times and not get bored. I also love that you can bring your dog on their outside patio :)  Edited to add that the service was very friendly. When we walked in they explained to us how it works (order food at counter, food served at your table) and everyone else was also helpful too.

Very good! I would definitely go back. They have a lot of different types of food for anyones taste buds. I had the Mexican Benedict and it was great. Spicy addition to the classic. Not a normal serve, you order and pay at the cashier and then they will bring your food. Interesting modern approach to brunch.

First time today and it was ok. Wasn't too busy. It's a little awkward because they have a different process for ordering and seating but theres a sign to explain that. Basically you place the order, get your drink and then wait to be seated. The menu wasn't impressive, I didn't think there was many options to choose from. Anyhow, ordered the Mexican Benedict. It wasn't very impressive or anything special. I wish they had sides to order because you really don't have options. Overall, I might try again but not anytime soon.

This restaurant is super cute inside. You have to order first up front before you sit. They have a good selection of breakfast items. I always order the Wilcox Avenue. I get it with over medium eggs, their spuds (which are super delicious!), the biscuit, and bacon.

The food here is completely overrated. Do NOT order the savory crepes, the chicken has a weird taste to it. The French toast was good, but again, nothing too special about it. The staff was very nice, but unfortunately the food is not worth the wait.

It's a pretty cool shop to come have breakfast, lunch and coffee. It's a bummer that they close so early though I would definitely like to come here later in the evenings or at night but the menu seems more fitted to the hours they have open. The atmosphere is chill though, you could bring a group of friends on relax.

This is a cute order and seat yourself type restaurant. I wanted a basic breakfast that included eggs, bacon and potatoes but my friends chose this place. I didn't see what I wanted on the menu but they made it for me anyway. So thank you! It was good. I forget what my 2 friends ordered but we all liked our food. Well one had a breakfast burrito but can't remember the other order.

ONE OF THE BEST BREAKFAST PLACES!  my girlfriend and I wanted to go somewhere new for breakfast and heard of Vovomeena. We are so happy that we discovered this place. Their waffles are amazing and also the shredded chicken burro things were outstanding!!!!!!!!!  EVERYONE NEEDS TO TRY THIS PLACE OUT!

Came here for breakfast last Saturday morning. We ordered the Wilcox Ave and Pawtucket west.  The coffee is pretty good, we just had the regular coffee bit they've got quite a selection of brews. The food was great, well priced, and you get a lot of food for what you pay. I recommend getting the sausage, it tasted like it was cooked over an open flame and its taste reminded me of camping :)

i was fairly unimpressed with the blackstone scramble. pretty tasteless and i didn't even want to finish it. i really liked my cappuccino, though, and the lil sugar cubes they have. i also wasn't a fan of the whole ordering setup where you have to line up to order, take a number, wait for your drinks if you ordered one and then get seated??? weird imo.
My fam bam and I had breakfast here this morning. The atmosphere and service was top notch. Their Orchard French Toast was delish! I definitely recommend!

Food was ok. I forgot the name of what I had but it had bread and some chipotle sauce in it. My husband just had some basic eggs with peppers and a tortilla. Went early on a Saturday morning and I just loved the vibe. Made me feel like they can pass for a place somewhere in Cali. For us it was a one time visit. We don't regret it though. It was nice

Wow! So impressed.  Breakfast is one of the best I've ever had.  Good service, nice fresh environment and a big plate of delicious enjoyment.  Looking for a quality place with top quality food?  Stop here; I promise you won't regret it.

Vovomeena is the place we keep coming back to. The quality is always fantastic and the staff are friendly and helpful. It can seem a little hectic because you order first, then get your table, but it all really works out well. We've been at times when it's really busy and the quality doesn't suffer at all. If you've never been here for breakfast, I'd highly recommend giving Vovomeena a try.

Get the BMOC! Great breakfast spot with Portuguese influence, which is hard to find. The BMOC is just a big mess of all the best breakfast stuff...topped with a Portuguese donut. The best. My only knock on the place (which I admit is super picky) is they serve coffee in a paper cup. Coffee in a ceramic mug makes the meal just a bit nicer. Still one of my favorite brunch spots.

Really great customer service. Their food is great but just not a whole lot of selections. The place has a decent hip vibe and would love to come again. Their food prices is a bit pricey but worth the atmosphere, service and taste. Will come again but it's hard to choose with such limited options.

Hard to find at first but once we got there, I loved it. There's a parking lot in back of the restaurant but it gets jammed up quickly at lunchtime. They have seating inside and a patio connected to the restaurant and then a shared patio (Chipotle, salad place and a poke place in the same space) with extra seating.  I ordered the johnnycakes that came with crispy potatoes and a small side of sweet rice pudding along with a watermelon infused tea. The cakes were a mix of sweet/salty as they've got tiny pieces of corn and chile in them but strawberries on top and maple syrup to pour over if you'd like. I'm used to small, chunky cakes but these were HUGE! I couldn't even finish all of the food I received so a total bang for your buck!  The guys who run the space were great, super service focus and in an area with so many choices, I'd make this mine again and again!

What a cool surprise.  I tried the Banger Wrap and thought the smoked gouda was the perfect touch. My husband went with the biscuits and gravy. Who knew you could get such a tasty breakfast for around $20.  This is well worth the trip if you are looking for something off the beaten path.

I swing through Phoenix every few months and I've made it a priority to stop by here for breakfast whenever I can. I've never had a bad meal here and at this point I've tried a bunch of different things -- the Pain Perdue, the Johnnycakes, the Biscuits and Gravy -- and it's all phenomenal, with unique and tasty cold brew options that you just can't get anywhere else, like orange peel and ginger or peanut butter cup. And  it's adorable and the people here are always so sweet -- this is a really special place that's 100% worth checking out if you're in the area.

Upon entering Vovomeena we knew that the five us stuck out like a sore thumb. Strangers in a new land searching for a delicious breakfast that will carry us through until lunch time.  I didn't catch the gentleman's name, but he knew we were outsiders. He told us about the restaurant. That we were allowed to sit anywhere, and that we should grab a menu and wait in line to order.  While waiting you can check out the cooks preparing others food. The sights and the smells were very inviting, and only made us that much more hungry. The entire menu looked good, so I decided to start the top with the Blackstone Scramble.  Of course you gotta order the bottomless cup of coffee too. I added Almond Milk to mine because I hadn't seen this option out in my native city Las Vegas. Everyone ordered food, and everyone's looked great.  Even better we were all quiet, and most importantly we all cleaned our plates.  We had a wonderful experience at Vovomeena and we will definitely return the next time we visit Phoenix.  I think I'll just keep checking things off the list, and go for whatever is second on the menu next time.  Oh, and if you want a really soothing experience.....go check out the bathroom. It's quite calming.
As a RI native I was very excited to find this menu online. This place is awesome!  It is definitely worth checking out for breakfast.

Great tasting cold brew but their espresso setup leaves a lot to be desired. Mexican Benedict had great flavor, not impressed with the sopes on this dish though. Decent breakfast but probably won't return.

Stopped in for a mid-morning breakfast and was absolutely delighted with my choice. I enjoyed the Johnnycakes (corn & chiles) with sweet rice and fried potatoes. The Johnnycakes were tender, crispy, and oh-so flavorful. The prickly pear maple syrup was smashing drenching the salty cakes. The sweet rice was like a breakfast rice & raisins dish and meshed perfectly with the savory cakes. The potatoes were crispy on the outside, cooked through within and flavored with crispy little onion slivers. The weather has become perfect for enjoying a meal outdoors - go for it!!

Wow, I'm eating the BMOC right now and it is fantastic!   Who thought of this combo is a genius. A waffle with a big piece of something like smoked ham with Apple compote on top, two eggs on top of that, and local type of fried donut. Omg. I want to clean the plate...

This place is certainly a hidden local gem! Amazing food and the coffee in and of itself is worth the stop. The Johnny cakes are a must along with the biscuits and gravy. So far, I haven't been here and tried anything I wouldn't recommend. Parking is scarce, so I would recommend car pooling if you're meeting people. It's the perfect little spot for weekend brunch with girlfriends, family, and kids.

The food was better this time so I'm happy I gave it another chance.  I had eggs, bacon and biscuit.  Skipped the spuds. Food was tasty.  Bacon has a nice flavor. The brewed coffee is hot with good flavor, oddly enough that is not always the case.  I marked it down to 3 for the poor customer relations on the part of the cashier and blaring music..  That man needs to learn not to look so grumpy.  He assumed I and my friend were on one tab and seemed to take offence when I corrected him and asked to pay only my bill.  Took him forever to fix it, looking grumpy the whole time.  It was unpleasant.  Please turn down the music!

I came here last Saturday with my best friend for a post Junior League rummage sale breakfast and we were impressed.    The d√©cor is cute, you feel almost like you are in someones home, even if the traffic flow and set up the restaurant is somewhat perplexing at first.  Soon enough we figured out where and how to order.    For other first timers, apparently you grab a menu at the end of the line that runs right in front of the open kitchen, you chose what you want while in line and then place your order and pay at the end of the line.  Not a bad set up as it allows you to see right into the cooking stations and watch the chefs in action (which is both neat and reassuring at the same time) but, when you get to the end of the line and pay that is where you are expected to also add your gratuity, and I just don't like the idea of having to pay gratuity on a meal before I've even been served or tasted the food.    Am I the only one that feels that way?  I think setting it up like that almost encourages patrons to hold back on the gratuity because we have to bet on the law of averages and assume that the service will be mid-grade so that we're not over tipping and if the service was great the server loses because lots of people don't carry cash.  I'm definitely not gonna swipe my debit card again simply to pay an additional gratuity.  Tipping at the end of the meal represents a better snapshot of how the diners experience really was.  Okay, getting off my soapbox now...  So, I ordered the Mexican Benedict and it was very good; spicy, savory and filling.  The poached egg was laid atop a perfectly flavorful bed of chorizo and smothered in delicious Hollandaise sauce.  Sadly I didn't detect any tomato or cilantro in mine.  Perhaps it was cooked into the chorizo and that's why I couldn't taste it?  That's okay though.  Honestly, the only aspect of the meal I didn't like was the dense, cold sopes that the eggs were perched atop of; they were hard, flavorless and cold.  While I understand wanting to keep with the Mexican theme, I still think that an English muffin (or anything else) would have been a better option here.  Or maybe just heat up the sopes first, so that they're hot and soft?  My best friend ordered the Pain Perdue with whiskey caramel sauce.  Oh, dear sweet, 6 lb, 7 oz. baby Jesus, it was SO GOOD.  It had the perfect texture and sponginess and spice.  You could really taste the bananas and the whiskey sauce was the perfect complement to the French toast; amazing.  It was served with two pieces of breakfast meat (she chose bacon) and the bacon was just so-so.  Not really brilliant or detracting, just your average piece of bacon.    She had a caramel latte and I had a plain cup of coffee, she loved her coffee and I thought mine was just okay.  Again just average coffee.  Decent, but not exotic in any way.  The service was very good and we were brought our food within just a few minutes of taking our number and having a seat.  About halfway through our meal we were checked on to make sure we were doing well, we were, and then we spent the rest of the meal enjoying the food and the d√©cor and making silent comments about the eclectic assortment of guests around us.  (When you've been best friends for over 25 years, you learn to have whole conversations with just a look.)     So while I did mention a couple of things that I thought could be improved upon (the cold sopes and the advance gratuity being the most important issues) I still had a great visit, and it was a nice breakfast out for both of us.  We will definitely be back.

Unbelievably delicious.  Amazing menu selection, out of this world coffee, best service ever. What a hidden gem. Sitting outside on the lovely patio today, sipping a latte, ejoying the spring breeze, waiting for Mexican eggs Benedict,  yum!  My 3rd time here, will keep comi back. Friends & fam I sent this way, twice, have also loved it. Can't recommend enough!

I don't know if the Yelposphere knows this, but there are things called "sopes" or "picaditas" and they're basically thick ass tortillas and Vovomeena serves them as a base to their chorizo benedict and I am truly dead. I have died from deliciousness.   On another note, the manager has been there since inception and he was super great and attentive throughout our brekky. Go here!

Met one of my girlfriends for brunch on a Wednesday. It wasn't busy at all but the service was lackluster.   Whenever I go to a new spot, especially one with such great reviews, I'm eager to talk to the staff about their favorite dishes and drinks. When I approached them with my typical excitement and list of menu questions, they showed minimal interest and had dull responses. I even asked for recommendations and the cashier wasn't very enthusiastic about any of the items really. A Portuguese donut sounded interesting so I asked how they were and I was told they are, "just eh." Wow! I couldn't even believe it but I didn't order one because of it.   As a coffee addict I was pretty excited about the cold brew flight - but disappointed with all three flavors. They just weren't for me :( I'm not one to complain but I asked if I could just have a hot coffee instead. What was nice was one of the waitstaff refunded me the difference in price, even though I didn't ask to be. Even still, he just sort of awkwardly walked up to my table, handed me cash, mumbled that it was for the difference in price, and walked away. Not sure if I just caught the restaurant on an odd day or something but my entire service experience was just really was strange.   Both my friend's meal and my own tasted just okay. Nothing special about it. Pretty bummed because I was excited to find a new, cool brunch spot. On to the next one!
Food was good, I do wish the menu was a little more descriptive.   Love the ambiance and the coffee bar, will give it another go at some point.

2nd time in today. I adore this place. The service is great and the food is wonderful. A bit more crowded then the last time but no worries. I stayed a while and was not rushed out. I will have to try something other than their to die for "Pain Purdue" though the next time I come in. The owner/manager, and other patrons it seems, suggest "The Pocket." So next time it is a pocket for me.  Vovomeena has great sausages too. Some of the best I have had in AZ. In a city that thinks "Matt's Big Breakfast and Denny's are Foodie Heavens ( Why?) I am happy to find Vovomeena. Drawback- it is pricey but I do not have to eat again all day after eating here. lol

One word....Delicious!! The Pain Perdue was amazing..so light and fluffy for what looked like going to be a dense banana brownie covered in syrup...and the sausage had a little kick that evened out the sweetness. And the Morning Moonshine was great with a little almond milk.  My boyfriend had the Orchard French Toast which was also delicious and the biscuits and gravy smelled so good.     The place was also super cute. And the guys work behind the counter were really nice. I don't  go downtown much but if I am down there again around breakfast definitely going to be a stop. Great job guys

Our Friend posted on Facebook about Vovomeena and RAVED about the Pain Perdu. Naturally, we had to check it out. The Pain perdu is Banana bread pudding French toast, whiskey caramel, and a choice of meat or spuds. Like the G that I am, I had the turkey sausage and the spuds (so damn good)! The sausage was OK, but the spuds were cooked to perfection, and let me tell you about that banana bread pudding French toast... "So, good you'd slap yo Momma" - Pops! Much like the Terminator, "We'll be back!" to terminate some other yummy selections from their simple, but yummy menu selection.  Until Next Time...  Maine  PS The ICED COFFEE isn't to be played with, I was full of energy for the rest of the day! The OJ is really good, taste so fresh, and so squeezed!
Good but I don't like how you can't edit the menu to your own liking. I would have liked to order a side of eggs or like a short stack on the side.

I wasn't fond of this place and I probably won't return. The pics look good but the food was just ok. The coffee was overpriced, if I wanted to pay $5 for an iced coffee id go to Starbucks. We ordered the Mexicans Benedict, which sounded good but wasn't great. The chorizo was just ok and the sopa wasn't as tasty as I'd had hoped. I wish there was more hollaindaise sauce. I couldn't even taste it. The eggs were cooked well, which is a plus. Also, there were ANTS crawling all over our table - yes, we sat inside. We found at least 5 ants through out our meal. Dirty dirty
